job_summary:
Telenet is always looking to improve their business by leveraging the wide variety of data assets. With more than 1,7 million broadband internet and video customers and over 5 million customer interactions per month, Telenet has a very diverse data availability across the entire organization (e.g. network data, customer and product data, customer interaction data). 
We are looking for a Data scientist to become a part of our Data Science Chapter existing of over 20 data scientists, who use data analytics and machine learning to support, challenge and inspire our business with actionable insights for the entire organization. This can be building predictive models in the marketing domain to identify the most suitable product combination for each customer, improving our customer experience by predicting faulty customer equipment, or improving our network by forecasting the needed network capacity in the following year.  
Key Responsibilities:  Key overall responsibility is to work with the business teams to take fact-based and data-driven decisions on high impact topics while leveraging data analytics and machine learning. This typically includes the following activities: 

Understand the challenges and problems of your business stakeholders and translate them into a data solution 
Provide analytical guidance in strategic decision-making processes 
Build predictive models using statistical and machine learning techniques and maintain existing data science intelligence under guidance of a senior colleague 
Share your results in a clear way with business stakeholders through data storytelling and data visualization 
Synthesize complex insights into easy-to-understand actionable recommendations that resonate with business stakeholders 
Industrialize new build machine learning models with the support of data engineers 
Share your project results with other data scientists to enhance knowledge sharing in the Data Science Community of Practice 

 About You: 

Master with a focus on data science/informatics/math/statistics/economics 
Recently graduated or first years of experience in data science 
Experience with (at least one of) the required programming languages (SQL, Python, Pyspark) or another language (R, SAS) and willing to learn. Experience with Cloud (AWS) is an advantage 
Strong acumen in analytical thinking and structured problem solving, and experience in statistical and machine learning methods in a big data context 
Pragmatic in your approach, using the right techniques to provide the needed quality and detail while avoiding complex solutions. 
Excellent presentation and storytelling skills and ability to influence decision makers 
Be able to deliver projects autonomously, while working closely together with a team of other data experts (data analysts, data scientists, CRM experts, data engineers) 
A learning mindset, willing to learn new tools to stay up to date with the latest data science developments 
Fluent in English and preferably in Dutch/French 

 What We Offer: 

A position in an innovative, healthy and ambitious organization which is committed to put data intelligence at the core of its business 
An agile organization that stimulates internal mobility and the possibility to change roles 
The chance to further develop your career through learning opportunities,via an extensive training catalogue and external platforms such as Datacamp and Linkedin Learning, and on the job learning and mentoring 
You join a team of young, dynamic, enthusiastic and results-driven data profiles, with fun team buildings and on-site padel games 
An attractive compensation & benefits package, including a personal development plan, discount on Telenet products, flexibility in homeworking (3 days per week), flexible working hours etc. 

Location: Mechelen

Telenet is always looking to improve their business by leveraging the wide variety of data assets. With more than 1,7 million broadband internet and video customers and over 5 million customer interactions per month, Telenet has a very diverse data availability across the entire organization (e.g. network data, customer and product data, customer interaction data). 
We are looking for a Data scientist to become a part of our Data Science Chapter existing of over 20 data scientists, who use data analytics and machine learning to support, challenge and inspire our business with actionable insights for the entire organization. This can be building predictive models in the marketing domain to identify the most suitable product combination for each customer, improving our customer experience by predicting faulty customer equipment, or improving our network by forecasting the needed network capacity in the following year. 
Key Responsibilities:  Key overall responsibility is to work with the business teams to take fact-based and data-driven decisions on high impact topics while leveraging data analytics and machine learning. This typically includes the following activities: 

Take the lead in data science projects and cases and ensure results get delivered through appropriate communication and coordination, while collaborating with business stakeholders and your data colleagues (data scientists, data engineers, data analysts etc.) 
Identify and prioritize the challenges and problems of your business stakeholders and translate them into a data problem with a strategic value mindset 
Provide analytical guidance in strategic decision-making processes 
Build predictive models using statistical and machine learning techniques and maintain existing data science intelligence 
Share your results in a clear way with business stakeholders through data storytelling and data visualization 
Synthesize complex insights into easy-to-understand actionable recommendations that resonate with business stakeholders 
Industrialize new build machine learning models with the support of data engineers 
Organize learning, coaching and sharing sessions to stimulate on-the-job learning 
Push innovative ideas, techniques and data science innovation towards other data scientists 
Attend meet-ups, conferences etc. to pro-actively improve own skills and be up to date about latest developments in the field to share with other data scientists 
Mentor, train and coach actively junior data profiles and share your data science expertise for ongoing projects 

About You: 

Master with a focus on data science/informatics/math/statistics/economics 
At least 6 years of experience as a data scientist or data science related roles 
Experience with (at least one of) the required programming languages (SQL, Python, Pyspark) or another language (R, SAS) and willing to learn. Experience with Cloud (AWS) is an advantage 
Strong acumen in analytical thinking and structured problem solving, and experience in statistical and machine learning methods in a big data context 
Pragmatic in your approach, using the right techniques to provide the needed quality and detail while avoiding complex solutions. 
Excellent presentation and storytelling skills 
Ability to influence decision makers and able to deal with conflicting priorities and ambiguity 
Be able to deliver projects autonomously, while working closely together with a team of other data experts (data analysts, data scientists, CRM experts, data engineers) 
A learning mindset, willing to learn new tools to stay up to date with the latest data science developments 
Fluent in English and preferably in Dutch/French 

What We Offer: 

A position in an innovative, healthy and ambitious organization which is committed to put data intelligence at the core of its business 
An agile organization that stimulates internal mobility and the possibility to change roles 
The chance to further develop your career through learning opportunities, via an extensive training catalogue and external platforms such as Datacamp and Linkedin Learning, and on the job learning and mentoring 
You join a team of young, dynamic, enthusiastic and results-driven data profiles, with fun team buildings and on-site padel games 
An attractive compensation & benefits package, including a personal development plan, discount on Telenet products, flexibility in homeworking (3 days per week), flexible working hours etc.

Les données sont le nouvel or, et nous sommes en quête de chercheurs d’or. Pas du type « cowboy » traditionnel, mais plutôt de personnes intelligentes qui peuvent trouver et extraire les données, les exploiter, les transformer en quelque chose d’utile et qui peuvent également créer des choses merveilleuses et brillantes avec elles.
Votre objectif est de créer des solutions de données intégrées de bout en bout. Vous aiderez nos clients à les réaliser d’un point de vue fonctionnel et/ou technique. Certains d’entre nous abordent même le défi des données de manière plus stratégique : en discutant avec la direction générale sur la manière de devenir une entreprise véritablement axée sur les données. Cela signifie aussi, de temps en temps, prêcher l’évangile des données au monde de l’entreprise.
L’une de vos caractéristiques incontournables est votre passion profonde pour les données. C’est le cas ? Alors, rencontrez-nous !



 Que ferez-vous en tant que consultant·e Data & Analytics?


En tant que consultant·e Data & Analytics, vous travaillerez sur un, plusieurs ou même l’ensemble de ces quatre domaines clés de l’analyse et des données :


Saisie de données. Vous extrairez et rassemblerez autant de données structurées, semi-structurées et non structurées que possible, où qu’elles se trouvent, vous découvrirez différents types de ressources de données, vous mettrez en place des lacs ou entrepôts de données, vous déploierez les solutions sur site et dans le Cloud, et bien plus encore. Parmi les systèmes qui vous aideront dans cette tâche, citons Azure Data Factory, SQL Server Integration Services, SAP Data Warehousing (BW4 et HANA Native), Azure Databricks ou encore Azure Data Lake.


Gestion des données et de l’information. En plus d’intégrer et d’enrichir les données, vous gérerez également l’architecture des données, ainsi que leur modélisation, gouvernance, qualité et sécurité. Vous concevrez et optimiserez également des processus. Les systèmes que vous déploierez régulièrement pour cela sont notamment SQL Server, SAP HANA, SAP Data Intelligence, SAP MDG, Winshuttle et la suite Profisee. Vous utiliserez également les technologies les plus récentes en matière de gouvernance des données.


Visualisation. Vous vous assurerez que les données sont correctement visualisées, tant au niveau du contenu que de la présentation. Vous mettrez en place des rapports et des tableaux de bord interactifs, entièrement mobiles. Ici aussi, l’agilité est la clé ! Pour ce faire, vous serez capable d’utiliser des outils d’analyse en libre-service tels que SAP Analytics Cloud, Power BI ou Tableau.


Analyse et data science. Vous aiderez vos clients à générer le bon type d’informations. Vous rapporterez des événements passés, traiterez de grands volumes de données (pensons notamment à la gamme multi-TB), prédirez et prescrirez même des événements futurs (la partie data science). C’est là que les données prennent la « route de l’analyse ». Ce n’est pas une tâche facile à réaliser dans un environnement complexe où les données se trouvent sur différentes plateformes. Robovision, DataStories, Azure Machine Learning Services, Azure Databricks, SAP Data Intelligence, R ou Python seront à votre disposition.


En tant que consultant·e Data & Analytics, vous ne cesserez jamais d’apprendre. Vous vous tiendrez au courant des dernières avancées en matière d’IA, d’IoT, d’apprentissage machine et de toutes les autres innovations technologiques qui génèrent des données (à savoir à peu près « toutes les innovations technologiques » !). Il est également possible d’élargir votre expérience en prenant la direction de projets ou en jouant un rôle de coach au sein de l’équipe.
Sachez qu’en tant que consultant·e chez delaware, vous serez en mesure de faire tout cela pour une grande variété de moyennes et grandes entreprises, dans tous les types de secteurs, tant au niveau local qu’international.




 Avez-vous ce qu’il faut pour devenir un consultant·e Data & Analytics chez delaware?



Vous êtes passionné·e par les données et ce qu’elles peuvent impliquer pour les entreprises de toutes sortes. Vous avez plus de 3 ans d’expérience en business intelligence, Big Data ou data science. Peut-être avez-vous travaillé dans le domaine des solutions de données de référence, de la gouvernance de la qualité des données ou dans un autre domaine des données et de l’analyse ? Êtes-vous au moins prêt·e à vous plonger dans un ou plusieurs domaines de données et d’analyse ?
Vous êtes orienté·e solutions de nature et une personne dotée d’une bonne communication ainsi que d’un esprit analytique qui peut traduire les bits et les octets de données de manière compréhensible pour un homme d’affaires ;
Vous avez de l’expérience avec les méthodes de travail agiles et vous avez déjà travaillé avec certains des outils et plateformes mentionnés ci-dessus ;
Vous parlez couramment l’anglais et le néerlandais ou le français.

Nous pourrions être compatibles et vous devriez nous contacter !




 Vous souhaitez en savoir plus ?


Si vous souhaitez en savoir plus à notre sujet, consultez notre site web et notre blog. Vous pouvez découvrir notre ambiance de travail ici, mais nous sommes encore plus sympas dans la vraie vie !
Venez donc nous voir à Anvers, Courtrai, Gand, Lummen, Liège ou Wavre.

Data Scientist | Medical Sector | Full-time | Attractive Salary Package | 1090350
 
   Hays is looking for a Data Scientist to help our client build a cross-platform ecosystem to revolutionise cardiac consultation.
  

Your new role
 • You will be responsible for the data treatment, manipulation to ensure the quality, logic and coherence of the data extracted.
  

You will participate in the development and improvement of machine learning models to detect cardiac insufficiency.
You will help with the optimisation of the signal processing algorithms.
You will participate in the cost optimisation of the CPU/GPU usage in Cloud.


What we are looking for
 • You have a Master’s degree in engineering, computer sciences, mathematics or physics
  

You have a good knowledge of Python, Machine Learning and Calculus for signal processing
You have a good command of English or French
You like to share your knowledge and ideas with others


Nice to have
 • You have a personal interest in the medical domain, cardiology or artificial intelligence
  

You have a first experience with 3D data
You have experience in optimisation of Machine Learning algorithms
You have knowledge of signal processing (fluids, tremors, vibration)
You have a good sense of humour and like to be a team player.


What you will get in return
 A permanent position with a competitive package and intellectual property rights in a fast-growing startup in a booming sector
   A stimulating working environment within a team of enthusiastic entrepreneurs
   Working on a technology that will revolutionise healthcare and will positively impact society
  

Your new company
 The company we are recruiting for is a digital health startup whose vision is to provide anywhere, anytime cardiac health assessment. They have developed a web and smartphone application to provide cardiac teleconsultation. The technology is born out of the cardiac research of astronauts in space and offers unique measurements and diagnostics based on artificial intelligence. The company is based in the Walloon region and supported by ESA's Space Solutions Belgium & WSL incubator. A large part of their activity is carried out in partner university hospitals in Belgium and neighbouring countries.
  

If you're interested, even if you don't match 100% of the requirement, don't hesitate to apply! Your application is welcome! #1090350
 

 Attractive Salary Package

Do you want to build an innovative product with a positive climate impact?Then Toqua is the right place for you.
Toqua is a fast-growing, award-winning AI start-up based in Ghent, Belgium.We reduce emissions at a global scale, by bringing the fuel-saving potential of Machine Learning to shipping. Our goal is to deliver cutting-edge Machine Learning to the whole industry through APIs, accelerating the decarbonization of shipping.
Toqua consists of a young & dynamic team that values ideas over hierarchy.We’re convinced work should be a place of permanent learning that lifts up yourself and those around you. Most importantly, we believe job satisfaction comes from working on something you care about.
Job Description
Toqua is looking for a bright, motivated, and creative data scientist to bring Toqua’s modelling capabilities to the next level. By applying your ML knowledge, creativity, and passion to the domain and modelling challenge at hand, you’re constantly gaining new skills while iteratively improving Toqua’s ML models. You take a pragmatic approach to overcome the modelling challenges that will arise as Toqua scales up its modelling to more vessels throughout the industry. Through guiding client-facing projects you stay in touch with the field, the customer, and the problem - allowing you to identify gaps in modelling capabilities, improving these, and increasing the fuel-saving potential of Toqua’s ML.
Responsibilities

Improve Toqua’s modelling capabilities through constant iterations & creativity


Document & share your findings with the team


Guide client-facing projects


Stay up to date with the latest ML trends and put these into practice

Qualifications

Master’s degree or PhD in computer science, statistics, math, physics, or similar through experience


Understands the fundamentals of Machine Learning and is comfortable putting these into practice


Experience with Python (TensorFlow/Keras/sklearn/PyTorch/…)


Practical and results-oriented
Bright, creative, and eager to learn

What we offer

Work in an ambitious & motivating environment


A fast learning trajectory and lots of ownership


An informal and supportive way of working


Flexible working hours, remote working options and competitive pay
The chance to join a start-up in an early phase and share in the financial success of what you build via stock options

Even if your experience doesn't precisely match the criteria above, please consider applying!

For over 80 years, GfK has been a reliable and trusted insight partner for the world’s biggest companies and leading brands who make a difference in every consumer’s life - and we will continue to build on this. We connect data, science and innovative digital research solutions to provide answers for key business questions around consumers, markets, brands and media. With our headquarters in Germany and a presence in around 60 countries worldwide, you benefit from our global company with a diverse community of ~9,000 employees.
Harnessing the power of our workforce, the greatest asset we have is our people. As part of GfK, you can take your future into your own hands. We value talent, skills and responsibility and support your development within our international teams. We are proud of our heritage and our future: Currently we are in the latter stages of a transformational journey from a traditional market research company to a trusted provider of prescriptive data analytics powered by innovative technology. This is only possible with extraordinary people and this is why we are looking for YOU to help create our future. For our employees as well as for our clients we pursue one goal: Growth from Knowledge!
Our Media Measurement department delivers robust and independent metrics on audio and video. Our core business is helping media companies by providing them with the right data for audience analysis. We received continuous surveys that help our customers to define trends and strategies.
We are now looking for a Junior Data Analyst that can help us with data analysis, consistency and checks. As a data analyst you set controls that guide us to analyse trends, establish automatized checks, create reports and support our team in daily operations.
Do you have a passion for data and analysis? Do you also have a certain affinity with Media? Then the position of Junior Data Analyst is definitely for you.
As a Junior Data Analyst, you have the following important responsibilities:

Ensure the data integrity during data processing.
Verify the accuracy and validity of data processed.
Support on continuous reporting and data improvement.
Provide support within the daily tasks of the MM OPS team for the Media Measurement Team
Maintain positive working relationships and open communication with the colleagues, MM developers and commercial people.
Continually innovate, develop and suggest enhancements to gain better work efficiency

Now that we have introduced you to the Junior Data Analyst role, what skills, qualifications and experience do you need to have?

At least 1 or 2 years of experience in either data processing/analysis
Flexible, agile mind-set, generally pro-active and open-minded
A team player
English + NL or FR in spoken and written
Professional problem-solving skills and enhanced analytical skills
Efficient and effective use of provided tools and applied processes for all established collaboration models and distributed work.
In-depth knowledge of Excel

Join our team and benefit from the following advantages:

Exciting work environment that brings people together
Use of the latest digital technologies
Initial and ongoing trainings to support your development
Opportunities for personal and professional growth
Flexible working hours and home office
Food vouchers and health insurance
Last but not least – GfK office in Leuven is located close to the city centre and easily accessible from any point by public transportation

We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.
Can there be a better place to take center stage in the digital revolution? We are excited to getting to know you!

 Location 

      Zaventem HQ
    
 Roles & Responsibilities




      In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible. The tasks of a data scientist are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!
     


 What is the job about?
     


 Stepping into conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions
 Gathering and organizing data
 Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
 Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
 Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist IT profiles
 Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…
 Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG




 Skills & Qualifications 



      Elements we hope to see in our data scientists:
     


 A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,… Other types of eduction are also valued.
 A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
 Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,…
 Obviously, additional bonus points for more specific knowledge on e.g. Keras, D3.js
 The desire to learn and grow
 A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset



 We offer




      Do you consider a career at KPMG? Here’s what we have to offer for our talent:
     


 A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
 An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and background.
 Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
 Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
 A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.

Fondée à Florence (Italie) en 1982, Dedalus est le principal fournisseur de logiciels de santé et de diagnostic en Europe et l'un des plus importants au monde. La structure de l'actionnariat assure stabilité et grande capacité financière grâce à la présence d'Ardian, la plus grande société d'investissement privée en Europe et la quatrième dans le monde. Dedalus Group aide à la transformation numérique de 6 100 hôpitaux et 5 300 laboratoires dans le monde, en prenant en charge la gestion des soins de plus de 330 millions de patients. Nous employons plus de 6 000 personnes dont plus de 2 000 représentent la plus grande équipe de logiciels de R&D du secteur en Europe. Nous sommes présents dans plus de 40 pays différents à travers le monde, offrant une opportunité unique de travailler dans un environnement multiculturel et très dynamique.

like to be a gold digger, searching loads of data for that precious piece of insightfulness?

· you will - driven by your passion - build predictive models and machine learning algorithms

Data is one of Solita’s four areas of expertise. We have more than 200 data specialists, and our knowledge portfolio contains a variety of data-related specializations involving data solutions in all technologies, both in the cloud and otherwise. In Solita, you will be part of a team that is courageous and passionate, but at the same time easy-going & caring.
 We are focused on fast change and impactful technologies making the change possible. We employ 1,500 top-notch tech professionals across the Nordics and West Europe, of which more than 60 in Belgium and 10+ in Germany.
 As the Belgian market is a cornerstone of our growth strategy in West Europe, we are strengthening our Belgian team with new colleagues. You will be working in our Leuven or Ghent offices (Hybrid of course) where everything is in place to make your working day meaningful: coffee chats, office dogs, and apero with colleagues at the end of the day.
 As a data scientist, you will be exposed to a wide range of international clients who are at the cutting edge of innovation in their field and work on fascinating problems, build data-driven solutions that truly serve end user needs. Want to know more about the Belgian data science team? Solita is building a data science community in Belgium – Solita
 In this role you will apply advanced analytical, statistical, and programming skills to different projects, such as identifying maintenance needs in advance or optimizing resource usage and production capacity along the supply chain. We also build intelligent services that make everyday life easier for both our clients and our clients’ customers. You will work hands-on on customer projects, together with customer representatives as well as solitary colleagues – for example Machine Learning Engineers, Data Engineers, and AI Service Designers


 Solita's data science team and technologies
 Solita has data scientists working in international projects in Belgium and the Nordic countries. Our Data scientists work across Solita in different customer cases and with different experts. Our closest colleagues are our own team and 200 Solita data scientists, not forgetting design and software development professionals. Colleagues in the DS teams support you in solving different and new problems. The Data Science teams have the responsibility and freedom for project implementation and technology choices, in cooperation with the customer, of course.


 Our expectations of a Data Scientist
 You will have in-depth knowledge in one or more of the following areas:

You find it rewarding to support our customers in a consultant role and you are prepared to challenge the status quo.
You are pragmatic and always put first what is really needed or valuable for our customers.
NLP/text mining, deep Learning, reinforcement learning, statistical learning theory or machine learning.
You are familiar with the main concepts & best practices of MLOps.
You can extract and manipulate data from DWH, big data and other systems including knowledge and understanding of SQL.
Familiarity with cloud services (e.g. AWS / Azure/ GCP), especially regarding the ML / AI domain.
You are also happy to mentor and share your knowledge with other team members as well as solitans.
It is also very helpful if Solita's values seem to coincide with what you expect from the work community and what you value in your colleagues.
Fluent in Dutch or French, and English

WHAT WE OFFER

Challenging, impactful projects to work with
Possibility to learn and work with the latest technologies/tools
Nordic work culture of autonomy and professionalism
Individual benefit packages that suit your personal needs
Learning and career growth opportunities
Caring community of 1500+ tech expert colleagues across Northern Europe

We believe diversity of ideas and backgrounds gives us the creativity to be successful in a rapidly changing world. In support of this, we stress equality of opportunity for all qualified individuals in accordance with applicable laws. Decisions on hiring, promotion, development, compensation or advancement are based solely on a person’s qualifications, abilities, experience and performance.
 INTERESTED TO HEAR MORE?
 We want to hear from you and figure out together what works best for us both. Tell us about yourself and your background in your own words. Unfortunately currently we can’t offer relocation for candidates outside Belgium.
 Our recruitment consists of two rounds of interviews where you will meet our team and learn more about working at Solita.
 If you have any questions, please contact Recruiter Liese Hennus: [email protected]

Transforming complex data by using algorithms and models to create client-oriented solutions. That is the core of your challenge! You'll actively contribute to the improvement of client solutions, business models, and operational processes by automatically translating data into reliable information, that is where you'll create an immediate impact. With your broad expertise, you'll know exactly what the client needs, often without them realizing it themselves.

 Are you an experienced Data Scientist and are you passionate about developing algorithms and data models? Then we'd love to have a chat with you!

mozzeno
 mozzeno heeft het eerste Belgische platform gelanceerd waarmee particulieren onrechtstreeks leningen van andere particulieren kunnen financieren. Via technologische vernieuwingen zet mozzeno.com de consument centraal in haar aanpak. ‘Positive money’, daar draait het om. Het krediet is daarbij een middel om projecten van consumenten, zelfstandigen en ondernemingen sneller waar te maken.
 De organisatie en het beheer van data is cruciaal voor de ontwikkeling van de activiteit van kredieten en investeringen.
 Als fintech scale-up gelegen in Brussel en met bedrijfszetel in Waver wil mozzeno.com de financiële sector op een positieve manier veranderen.
 Jouw functie
 Als data scientist:

Beantwoord je businessvragen door de database te doorzoeken. Je voorziet rapporten en dashboards die je indien nodig in productie zet.
Hou je redelijk complexe processen up to date via opzoektabellen en mapping. Je integreert noodzakelijke en reglementaire aanpassingen die voortkomen uit de ontwikkeling van het platform.
Help je mee bij de zoektocht naar en de integratie van nieuwe databronnen die voor een betere inschatting van het risico en een betere klantervaring zorgen.
Creëer en ontwikkel je voorspellende modellen (risico, fraude, churn, …)
Help je bij de ontwikkeling van business-segmentaties, waardoor we beter begrijpen wie onze klanten zijn.
Help je in nauwe samenwerking met de andere afdelingen bij de digitalisering en automatisering van de procedure voor een kredietaanvraag. Dat doe je via de analyse van transactionele data (psd2).
Help je bij het berekenen van het rendement van de investeerders en draag je bij aan het design van de statistiekweergave waar investeerders toegang tot hebben.
Help je bij de definitie van nieuwe pricing products via de ontwikkeling van een simulatietool.

Hiervoor zal je worden bijgestaan door een senior data scientist en werk je samen met alle teams van mozzeno.
 Jouw profiel

Je bent onlangs afgestudeerd in een wiskundige hogeschool- of universitaire opleiding (computer science, data sciences, wiskunde, statistiek, fysica, of anders …) en kan heel goed overweg met cijfers.
Je houdt van gegevens programmeren en hanteren. Je hebt ervaring met R of een van de volgende programmeertalen: Python, SAS, SQL, powershell.
Je beheerst excel en google sheet. Kennis van andere reporting tools (Tableau software, data studio, powerBI) is een plus, maar geen vereiste. Je vindt immers snel je weg in dit soort programma’s.
Je bent heel georganiseerd, stipt en proactief.
Je blijft in alle omstandigheden vriendelijk.
Je houdt van een dynamische omgeving, je bent een teamplayer en je past je makkelijk aan.
Je bent niet bang voor nieuwe uitdagingen en doelen.

Ons aanbod

De kans om mee in een nieuw, boeiend en erg motiverend avontuur te stappen.
Een heel aangename werkomgeving aan de rand van Brussel (Waver), makkelijk bereikbaar met het openbaar vervoer zodat je de files kan vermijden.
Een bedrijfscultuur die verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel waardeert en ontwikkelingskansen biedt.
Een competitief loon en extralegale voordelen naargelang je profiel en ervaring.



 Interesse? Mail dan snel je cv en motivatiebrief naar job@mozzeno.com

You are self-motivated and confident with a positive attitude. 
You have excellent time management and organizational skills, with attention to details.

In addition

3+ years of experience in advanced data analytics.

FibriCheck is looking for an experienced Data Scientist to make an impact in the mobile healthcare industry.
 About FibriCheck
 FibriCheck is a young, dynamic and fast-growing company in the digital health sector. Our mission? Preventing unnecessary strokes. How? Our smartphone and smartwatch applications make it easy for people to self-monitor their heart rhythm and therefore to detect possible arrhythmias, such as atrial fibrillation, in time. A 60-second check-up immediately learns our users if they need further follow up. Faster detection of arrhythmias will lead to faster and better treatment and will avoid people from suffering possibly severe complications like a stroke. Our applications are more than just apps, they are full-fledged medical devices that are CE-marked and FDA-approved. FibriCheck is used today by over 800.000 people, is prescribed by over 2.000 physicians and has processed over 8 million PPG measurements. Today we are mainly focusing on Europe, but our plans to conquer the world are ambitious!
 Your responsibilities

Research and develop state-of-the-art deep learning methods and leverage over 8-million heart rhythm traces to improve the detection of heart rhythm on PPG data. You will need to go beyond the regular supervised way to push the boundaries of PPG heart rhythm analysis.
Explore the FibriCheck database to discover new insights with clinical relevance. You will perform advanced data analytics to confirm or disprove hypotheses and suspicions from healthcare experts (i.e. cardiologists). This work will ensure FibriCheck remains a frontrunner in the mobile healthcare sector.
Cooperate with the clinical team at FibriCheck to process, analyze and visualize data acquired in clinical studies. You communicate the findings in a clear and visual manner to your colleagues and external stakeholders.
Possibly interact with the business team and apply your data science expertise to business-related topics.

Your profile

A Master’s Degree or PhD in data science, computer science, mathematics, statistics, civil engineering or comparable field.
A strong theoretical background in data science and machine learning, with a strong emphasis on statistics and deep learning.
Expert knowledge of Python and several machine learning and visualization libraries (TensorFlow/PyTorch, NumPy, pandas, SciPy, Matplotlib, seaborn, …).
Knowledge of Git (or another distributed version control system).
Knowledge of AWS (or another cloud platform).
Knowledge of Docker (or another containerization platform) is a plus.
A biomedical background, great interest or a willingness to learn about the mobile health industry.
Experience with time-series data is a plus.
Excellent oral and written communication skills (Dutch and/or English).
Positive attitude, proactive mindset and team player.
Actively participate in a culture of innovation.

What do we offer

A full-time job, attractive salary and numerous benefits (meal vouchers, eco vouchers, health insurance, company car, group insurance, dental insurance plan, …).
A challenging and innovative work environment with plenty of opportunities to grow.
Training opportunities to make you excel at work and learn more about your interests.
A scaleup environment, where it will be very very difficult to get bored.
A flexible working environment.
An office at Corda Campus in Hasselt and in the center of Leuven combined with the opportunity to (partly) work from home.

If you are interested please send your CV and motivation to career@fibricheck.com.

Le Centre d’Informatique pour la Région Bruxelloise (CIRB) est le leader de la transition numérique à Bruxelles. Nous accompagnons nos clients – les institutions publiques bruxelloises – dans leur parcours digital.
 Ainsi, pour offrir aux Bruxellois une Région durable, ouverte sur le monde et à l’économie dynamique, nous mutualisons des technologies de pointe en matière d’infrastructures, de plateformes et de services ICT.
 Nos collaborateurs constituent notre première ressource pour relever ces défis.
 Plus de 550 collègues enthousiastes vous attendent au CIRB, au cœur même de Bruxelles. La satisfaction de nos clients est au centre de nos préoccupations. Être orienté solutions est notre mantra. Qui va de pair avec le plaisir de travailler en équipe et notre attachement à équilibrer vie professionnelle et vie privée.
 Envie de rejoindre une organisation où la connectivité se vit en mode numérique et social ? Envoyez-nous votre candidature dès maintenant !


 Votre fonction :

Vous collaborez avec les équipes internes et les partenaires du CIRB pour identifier les opportunités d’utilisation des données,
Vous traduisez les problématiques métiers en projets « data science»,
Vous préparez, explorez et analysez les données,
Vous appliquez les modèles statistiques et le machine learning afin de répondre aux problématiques identifiées,
Vous collaborez avec les autres membres de l’équipe pour mettre en production les modèles,
Vous assurez le monitoring des modèles afin de gérer leur cycle de vie et de les faire évoluer,
Vous communiquez les résultats des analyses.

Votre formation et expérience :

Master en économie, statistiques, mathématiques ou équivalent par l’expérience,
Première expérience de min. 2 ans dans le domaine de l’analyse des données, l’analyse statistique et le machine learning,
Très bonne maitrise de Python,
Intérêt pour les solutions « Big data » :
une connaissance en bases de données nouvelles générations (SQL et noSQL) est souhaitée,
une connaissance en databricks est souhaitée,
Des connaissances en analyse de données géographique, GIS, données 3D et/ou reconnaissance d’objet sont un plus.

Vos compétences :

Passionné par l’univers de la data science,
Volonté démontrée de produire des solutions qui ont un impact concret sur les problématiques envisagées,
Excellente aptitude en résolution de problèmes,
Capacité à travailler dans une équipe pluridisciplinaire ,
Bon sens de la pédagogie et de la communication,
Capacité à condenser les résultats d’analyse complexes et techniques en conclusions claires et concises.

Nous offrons :
 Nous offrons un contrat à durée indéterminée muni d’un package salarial attrayant qui inclut de nombreux avantages extra-légaux :

l’assurance hospitalisation étendue à l’ambulatoire pour vous et votre famille,
une assurance-groupe (capital pension et maladie invalidité),
un package « formations » annuel,
les transports publics pris en charge à 100%,
votre abonnement GSM,
des frais d’utilisation pour Internet et votre GSM,
des chèques repas de 8 euros,
mais aussi : 37 jours de congé par an (sur base d’un temps plein).

Description du poste
En tant que Data Science Officer vous travaillez au sein de la division Network (planification offre de transport) dans l’équipe Network Data Analytics en charge de la récolte et l’exploitation des données de transport (fréquentation et performance). Votre rôle sera principalement de trouver des solutions opérationnelles pour exploiter au mieux des datasets complexes, d’analyser les outputs des modèles de Data Science pour répondre aux besoins du business, de guider l’équipe dans la transition d’une culture d’exploitation des données à une culture de Data Science et d’assurer la veille technologique et méthodologique dans le domaine du Data Science (outils, données, méthodes), .

  Votre fonction de Data Science Officer plus en détail: 
  

Trouver des solutions opérationnelles pour récolter, structurer, explorer des datasets complexes et analyser les outputs des modèles de Data Science pour répondre aux besoins du business 
Conseiller le business en traduisant ses besoins concrets par des KPI et solutions analytiques pertinents, en s’immergeant au besoin dans le domaine de compétences du business demandeur (contexte, stratégie et problématiques), et en innovant 
Communiquer avec impact les résultats des analyses pour enjoindre à l’action, notamment en vulgarisant des résultats complexes pour des partenaires non spécialisés et en traduisant les résultats d’analyses en recommandations 
Contribuer activement au basculement d’une culture d’exploration des données à une culture de Data Science au sein de Network Data Analytics. 
Conseiller, former, et soutenir les Data Scientist dans leurs analyses et leur prise en main des outils de Data Science afin de garantir la qualité des outputs de l’entité. 
Assurer la veille technologique et méthodologique afin de maintenir Network Data Analytics à la pointe en ce qui concerne les méthodes et outils de Data Science (data mining, machine learning, modèles prédictifs, …). 


Profil recherché

Vous disposez d’un master à orientation quantitative 
Vous disposez de solides connaissances des méthodes statistiques et techniques de data science. 
Vous avez de l’expérience avec les outils de traitement de données quantitatives (Access, Excel, SQL, …), de reporting (SAP Lumira, Tableau, Power BI) et de Data Science (SPSS, SAS, R, Python, …) 
Vous avez la capacité à s’adapter constamment aux nouveaux outils, données et méthodes et vous êtes désireux d'apprendre les technologies de pointe dans le domaine 
Vous êtes en mesure de communiquer efficacement les résultats de votre travail à un public non technique 
Une excellente connaissance du réseau STIB et de la Région Bruxelloise sont un atout. 
Intérêt manifeste dans le domaine de la mobilité urbaine et du Data Science. 
Vous maitrisez le français ou le néerlandais. Une connaissance de l’autre langue constitue un atout à votre candidature. 
Vos qualités personnelles : 
Capacités analytiques et de synthèse 
Orientation résultats & problem solver 
Orientation client 
Capacité à innover et curiosité intellectuelle 
Rigueur et sens de l’organisation 
Communication et collaboration 

Notre offre

Un job varié et passionnant dans une ambiance dynamique et conviviale. 
Une offre de formations internes et externes développée sur mesure pour les collaborateurs. 
Un salaire en rapport avec vos responsabilités et de réelles possibilités d’évolution de carrière. 
Des avantages extra-légaux compétitifs : chèques-repas, assurance groupe et hospitalisation (octroyée après 1 an de service), 35 jours de congé payés par an, abonnement gratuit sur les réseaux STIB, TEC et De Lijn (également pour les conjoint et enfants), 70% de réduction sur l’abonnement de train domicile-travail, etc.

Entreprise
Avec plus de 10.000 collaborateurs, la Société des Transports Intercommunaux de Bruxelles (STIB), acteur clé de la mobilité à Bruxelles, y est également un des plus grands employeurs.  La modernisation du métro, l'élargissement du réseau tram et la construction de nouveaux dépôts ne sont que quelques exemples des projets passionnants pour lesquels la STIB recherche des collaborateurs enthousiastes.  Une carrière variée, une formation continue, des projets uniques et passionnants, une stabilité d’emploi et une diversité à tout niveau enrichissante, voilà ce que peut offrir la STIB à toute personne assez curieuse pour venir découvrir ses 300 métiers uniques.

Willing to push the boundaries with us for a more sustainable world?


If you have a passion for statistics and data analytics in combination with quantitative finance, this position will certainly of interest for you.


The asset and liability management (ALM)-treasury department is looking for a member for its data science team. ALM is situated in the center of the bank and the management of the liquidity and structural interest rate risk of the bank is its core responsibility. In both mandates the data science team makes important contributions through the analysis of client behavior and the translation of this behavior in financial risk models. Some examples of this are the early prepayment of credits in the drawing behavior of non-maturity deposits. The correct assessment of this kind of behavior is of crucial importance for any credit institution.


Your future job


Your challenges in this function are:

You translate together with the rest of the team new insights in client behaviour into existing or new financial models. To accomplish this, you analyse financial data and you apply statistical/quantitative techniques, both conventional as artificial intelligence algorithms. Furthermore you will have contacts with the commercial businesses and with the data department to exchange ideas on business problems but also on the newest artificial intelligence methodologies.
You work within the guidelines of the BNP Paribas group and you coordinate continuously with colleagues from the head office. Your well documented model proposals will be validated by the risk department and for this you will be in regular contact with them as well.
You will have a central role within ALM-treasury as other teams within the department will rely on your expertise and insights for their recurrent work.




Highlight your strengths


You possess as (commercial) engineer, quantitative economist or mathematician a strong analytical mindset:

You are inquisitive and you are capable to develop a broad view on banking activities in general. Preferably you already have some experience within a department of a bank: knowledge of common financial products and financial techniques is a plus. You have a basic knowledge of econometrics and statistics.
You communicate fluently in English. Furthermore some knowledge of French or Dutch is considered as a plus.
You are passionate about machine learning, data mining and data visualisation techniques.
You have some basic programming knowledge, experience with Python, SQL, SAS, Spark and Hadoop is considered a strong plus.
You love team work and you like to realise common goals and projects.

Together, let's build the bank of tomorrow: innovative, responsible and sustainable. All of our full-time vacancies are also open to candidates wishing to work 80% or 90%.

Vacature 
   
Data Scientist 







Je bent een data scientist met een passie voor het voorspellen van de toekomst, het vinden van patronen in de wereld om je heen en het bouwen van systemen die miljoenen datarecords verwerken. Je bent een specialist in NLP en het bouwen van machine learning modellen om data om te zetten in waardevolle zakelijke inzichten en plausibele toekomstscenario's. Je staat te popelen om bij te dragen aan concrete business projecten in uiteenlopende domeinen.
 Als jij dat bent, dan willen we graag met je praten over de rol van Data Scientist bij We Connect Data. We Connect Data is een data technologie bedrijf dat haar klanten ondersteunt bij het opbouwen van markt- en competitive intelligence door het implementeren van een AI-enabled workflow om systematisch data op te halen en te verwerken over concurrenten, innovatieve technologieën en markttrends in snel veranderende omgevingen.
 Locatie: Ons kantoor ligt in Gent, maar we zijn het gewoon om op afstand te werken
 Als data scientist werk je in een interdisciplinair team van Machine Learning ingenieurs, software ingenieurs, designers en Business Analisten, waarbij je wiskunde, data en machine learning gebruikt als belangrijkste troeven van DataScouts, ons Market & Competitive Intelligence Platform.
 Je zult betrokken zijn bij het verbeteren van autonome stakeholder mapping en trends analyse, het blootleggen van early alerts en blinde vlekken in Market en Competitive Intelligence. Je zult waardevolle inzichten afleiden door gebruik te maken van zowel supervised als unsupervised machine learning methodes.
 Je bent een zeer samenwerkingsgerichte persoon die in staat is om je eigen agenda te beheren, samen te werken met collega's en prioriteiten te stellen voor taken met impact. Je zoekt naar manieren om dingen te verbeteren en je leert snel.








Functie. 


Bouw AI-enabled oplossingen samen met het engineering team en ontwikkel het engineering proces om te schalen met data
 Werken aan gevarieerde datasets om directe inzichten op te bouwen
 Ontwikkel en train ML-modellen om patronen beter te identificeren en nauwkeurige voorspellingen te kunnen doen.
 Schrijf zeer geoptimaliseerde code om onze end-to-end machine learning pipelines te verbeteren
 Werk in een multidisciplinaire omgeving met collega's in machine learning, engineering en desig
 Werk samen met onze Product Manager om je complexe modellen te interpreteren en deze te vertalen naar een gebruiksvriendelijke en intuïtieve ervaring
 Werk nauw samen met ons ecosysteem en bedrijfsanalisten aan concrete klantcases
 Presenteer projectresultaten en deliverables aan interne teams en aan onze klanten.
 Data cleanen, analyseren en visualiseren







Profiel.

 Python is essentieel, andere talen (bijv. R en Julia) zijn nuttig

 Goede presentatie- en communicatievaardigheden, met het vermogen om complexe analytische concepten uit te leggen aan mensen uit het bedrijfsleven
 Methodische maar ook creatieve probleemoplosser
 Ervaring in het toepassen van data science en machine learning methoden op real-world problemen

 Sterke analytische en planningsvaardigheden

Je maakt deel uit van een ambitieus, jong, divers en snelgroeiend team. Je job zal veel variatie bieden door klanten in verschillende sectoren, verschillende domeinen en verschillende omgevingen.
 Als je een ondernemersgeest hebt, enthousiast bent over het vinden van slimmere manieren om dingen te doen, en een brandend verlangen hebt om deel uit te maken van een team waar je echt het verschil kunt maken, dan kijken wij ernaar uit je te ontmoeten.

What we are looking for
 ‍The Product Team at constellr uses a wide array of remote sensing data, including our own satellite imagery, to provide actionable insights for agriculture. We identify the best use cases, design data products, prototype them, test them with customers, and maintain them throughout their lifetime. This includes for example data fusion on a series of heterogeneous sources to provide homogenized top-of-canopy reflectance, or analytics to measure relevant biophysical parameters such as the evapotranspiration rate or the soil organic carbon content.

 Your tasks will include:

 Holding responsibility for your data product(s), and ensuring we deliver value and quality.
 Understanding and handling complex technical and scientific concepts, ranging from remote sensing, to biophysical crop and soil modeling, and data science.
 Collecting feedback from customers, analyzing their specific needs with a critical mind, structuring this information, and taking the best decisions on the product development.
 Understanding system-level constraints and the underlying science, as well as the reality of the agriculture industry, and the necessity to make our products financially viable.
 Prototyping new data products or product features, with Python or any other suitable languages, and iterating on them in a lean way through the integration of potential customers feedback.
 Liaising with the developer team to ensure the adequate implementation, industrialisation and maintenance of the data products you are responsible for.

 We expect you to:

 Have a Master’s or Ph.D. degree in Engineering, Remote Sensing, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related technical discipline preferrable.
 Have hands-on experience in remote sensing and image processing, with a preference for the development of analytical insights in the context of vegetation, environment, and agriculture.
 Have hands-on experience in one or more programming languages, e.g. Python (software packages, scipy, xarray, pandas, etc.), R, C/++ or Java.
 Have hands-on experience with hyperspectral and / or thermal infrared satellite image technology is a plus.
 Bring a positive can-do attitude, a solution and results-oriented mindset, with a great 80-20 mindset
 Be an excellent communicator, good listener, fluent in English


 What you can expect at Constellr

 A career at constellr is for those who are seeking the extraordinary. We are operating in the new space and agri-tech sectors, combining engineering, Earth Observation and agronomy to address one of the biggest challenges of our time: how to ensure global food security.
 We are a fast-growing team of more than a dozen highly motivated engineers, scientists, and business professionals with a shared vision to rebase decision making in tomorrow’s smart farming industry. ConstellR has offices in the European capital, Brussels, situated between the attractive Etterbeek and Watermael districts and in beautiful Freiburg, in south west Germany, bordering the Black Forest and in close proximity to France and Switzerland.  


You will be part of a fast-growing, multidisciplinary and diverse team with a strong desire to leverage change
 You will be given the autonomy to set and deliver against your own goals, develop new skills and capabilities and lead others to do the same
 You can directly influence your contribution to achieving several of the UN's sustainable development goals, including Zero Hunger, Clean Water, No Poverty and Climate Action 
You will contribute to bringing the world’s first commercial infrared constellation into orbit and enabling an entirely novel set of smart farming capabilities, as part of our mission to build a new biophysical atlas, driving an unprecedented understanding of our planet and its resources.
 We offer a competitive salary & benefits package and for some roles a remote or hybrid model. We encourage you to spend at least some time in Freiburg or Brussels with the team.

 The world leader in mineral-based specialty solutions for industry, with over 16,000 employees and over 200 sites worldwide, Imerys delivers high value-added, functional solutions to diversified set of industrial sectors, from processing industries to consumer goods. The Group draws on its knowledge of applications, technological expertise and its material science know-how to deliver solutions based on beneficiation of its mineral resources, synthetic minerals and formulations. These contribute essential properties to customers’ products and performance, including refractoriness, hardness, conductivity, opacity, durability, purity, lightness, filtration, absorption and repellency. Imerys is determined to develop responsibly, in particular by fostering the emergence of environmentally-friendly products and processes.
 If you want to grow your skills and develop your career, find out more at www.imerys.com

 The Position Industry 4.0 - Group data scientist (On-Site / Remote)
  
 Job Summary
 JOB SUMMARY/PURPOSE
 You will be responsible for extracting the value from the data, working in a close collaboration with the operations teams and interacting with IT/data engineers and Business teams. You will be using data-driven techniques to solve business-related problems selected from different domains (process, quality, supply chain…) and identifying the opportunities that allow the teams to better understand, automate and improve processes and performance by exploiting data and creating (or updating) machine learning algorithms. You will participate in the case selection, identification of business needs, implementation of models and validation of impact.
 You will also support the teams and metier experts to better understand the data science and artificial intelligence approach to ensure the adoption of developed solutions. You will be a key contributor to the upskilling of our teams through the presentation of projects results, sharing successes and return of experience, and participating in benchmarking to bring relevant information and accelerate the development of this topic within the company.
 JOB SCOPE/DIMENSIONS
 You will be part of the Group Center Of Excellence (COE), within the continuous improvement department, and a key player in the Industry 4.0 team, responsible for the definition and realization of the digital transformation of our operations in Imerys: more than 16000 employees, 230+ sites in 45+ countries.
 Initially the scope is focused on the pilot site, in Belgium, which will allow us to validate the model of Imerys factory of the future to extend the program to other strategic sites in the group. The position will require your presence in the pilot site to understand the operations and business problems to be prioritized and improved applying advanced technologies.
 You will report to the Group Industry 4.0 program manager, and work closely with the multidisciplinary team (data engineer, designers UX/UI, network and security engineers, ...).
 KEY TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

 Develop analytical solutions from creation until delivery of code and models, then dig in on it to bring meaningful insights that are interpreted with the operations teams to translate the results into actionable plans.
 Work with the operations and IT data team to develop/implement data collection tools and data mining, sometimes need to collect from external sources
 Improves in-house data collection procedure, bring expertise and feedback to the central and local IT/OT teams


 Collaborate with operations and business teams to validate tools and solutions developed, assure the utilisation of it by final users and measure the impact on the business KPIs
 Assure updates and adjustments for new deployments in other processes steps and sites
 Communicate effectively with the project teams, involving IT and operations


 Manage and transfer the knowledge through documentation and presentations (training, workshops, seminars, posts)

 KEY COMPETENCIES & BACKGROUND
 Skills requirements

 Degree in Engineering school with a master and experience in data science, or in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Operation research, Physics, PhD is a plus .
 +3 years professional experience in data science, with proven achievements in data science projects, from the business case selection phase, through the prototyping and implementation of the models
 Ideally you have an experience in fields similar to Imerys’ in the process industry would be a plus (minerals processing, chemistry, glass, cement, steel, pharma or food).
 Strong on AI techniques (machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, Computer Vision)
 Strong analytical skills.
 Problem solving oriented.
 Machine Learning workflows automation - ML pipelines
 Programming and development for data science
 Experience with databases (SQL, AWS redshift or other,), programming experience (Python and R,) ML Tools and libraries (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, Keras, pandas, numpy, matplotlib, seaborn, MLflow), CUDA is a plus.
 Knowledge on big data frameworks (Hadoop, Spark, …) would be a plus
 Ability to understand business requirements
 Capacity to elaborate precise and synthetic documents
 Ability to describe analytic processes from start to finish in your area of expertise
 Team player, ability to work with colleagues across operations sites
 Willingness to travel and work with team on site
 Languages: professional proficiency in English and French, a third language will be a plus

 Travels : up to 50% during the first year 

Position Type Full time
   and Permanent

job_title: Scientist, Data Science – Acoustic Processing Scientist (JRD...
job_summary:
Janssen Research & Development (“JRD”), a Johnson & Johnson company, is recruiting for a Scientist, Data Science – Acoustic Processing Scientist. The location for this position is Spring House, PA; Titusville, NJ; La Jolla, CA; Cambridge, MA; Raritan, NJ; Beerse, Belgium; Leiden, The Netherlands; Barcelona, Spain; London, UK; Paris, France. Remote may also be considered with up to 15% travel.
Janssen develops treatments that improve the health of people worldwide. Research and development areas encompass oncology, cardiovascular and metabolic disorders, immunology, pulmonary hypertension, neuroscience, and infectious disease. Our goal is to help people live longer, healthier lives. We have produced and marketed many first-in-class prescription medications and are poised to serve the broad needs of the healthcare market – from patients to practitioners and from clinics to hospitals. To learn more about Janssen, one of the Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, visit https://www.janssen.com/us/.
The Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning and Digital Health team within Janssen R&D develops innovative insights and solutions leveraging a variety of different data sources across multiple disease areas. We are looking for outstanding scientist whose responsibilities include:

Independently design, build, and implement state-of-the art audio/acoustic (e.g., analyzing speech, cough, and other biological sound data) and other bio-signal processing combined with predictive modeling
Contribute to experimental design and development of analytical plans
Work with large, sophisticated data sets
Participate in cross-functional collaborations with external companies and internal scientific and data science teams
Present analysis in a cross-functional setting, contextualizing how it fits within the broader project
Contribute to scientific publication, patents, tech reports
Stay on the cutting edge of the data science, digital health and signal processing fields to invent and customize when necessary


Qualifications
 Required qualifications:

A Ph.D. degree (or Master’s degree with at least 3 years of relevant industry experience) in biomedical science or engineering, biostatistics or statistics, mathematics, computer science and other relevant fields
Demonstrated experience with audio/acoustic AND other bio-signal processing, machine learning algorithms, exploratory data analysis, statistical modeling is required
Proficiency with one or more programming language such as Python, Matlab, R, C++, or Java 
Ability to effectively communicate technical work to a wide audience
Passionate about maximizing data to drive scientific innovation
Proven scientific excellence, as measured by publications, patents, high-level presentation


Ability to work in an agile matrix environment

Preferred qualifications:

Knowledge of video process
Experience developing and/or testing analytic pipelines and code
Familiarity with drug discovery and the clinical development process and/ or expertise in one or more therapeutic areas
Familiarity with the statistical design and analysis of randomized controlled trials and observational studies

 

At Johnson & Johnson, we’re on a mission to change the trajectory of health for humanity. That starts by creating the world’s healthiest workforce. Through cutting-edge programs and policies, we empower the physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our employees and the ones they love. As such, candidates offered employment must show proof of COVID-19 vaccination or secure an approved accommodation prior to the commencement of employment to support the well-being of our employees, their families and the communities in which we live and work.
Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.

Desotec's mission is to protect our planet. We provide end-to-end purification solutions for pollution in air, water and other gases and liquids. We do this by supplying mobile activated carbon filters to our B2B customers all over Europe. We recycle our own saturated filters by taking back the spent activated carbon for reactivation, making our filter solutions circular.
   

 In order to prepare for its continued worldwide growth, Desotec is implementing a new ERP system: Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O. Additionally extra projects will be launched to capture company wide data and ERP data into a data lake, with the objective to deduct insights and improve operations.

 As a data analyst you will be part of the SDBPI team, a team of 5 fantastic Desotec Warriors who are responsible for Strategic and Digital Business Process Improvement within the Desotec Group. This team’s key mission is to prepare the ERP transition and to ensure that Desotec’s processes are optimized to a maximum extent.

 As a data analyst:



       You will be able to provide business insights thanks to your excellent analytical modelling skills
     


       You will support or take end responsibility for some of the workstreams (mainly those related to data) within the ERP implementation trajector
     


       You will work with key users to optimize ERP processes
     




Profile 




      You have a Master's degree
     


       You have a very strong analytical and mathematical mind, you delve into details and maintain a helicopter view
     


       Experience in a production environment is an asset
     


       Excel (and building models in Excel) has no secrets for you. Experience with JET reports/analytics and PowerBI is a plus
     


       You have a critical mind, but deal with challenges in a pragmatic and problem-solving way
     


       You work thoroughly, accurately and in a structured way
     


       You are stress resistant and you meet deadlines
     


       You communicate proactively with the business in order to gain a better understanding of the figures
     


       The fight for a better environment drives you
     




Offer 




      An exciting position in an international, fast-growing, innovative company
     


       A dynamic and team-oriented work environment
     


       Continuous opportunities for further development and growth
     


       A competitive and motivating salary package

Job description
 As a Data Scientist, you will need a combination of business focus, strong analytical and problem solving skills as well as programming experience to be able to analyse large data sets of information with the appropriate tools and techniques in order to deliver insightful and actionable information in an impactful manner.
 Your main mission will consist of working with our customers and understanding their business context.
 This unique role will engage you with the business by addressing strategic and tactical questions through the use of data mining and data visualization techniques, including pattern detection, graph analysis or statistical analysis. You’ll be challenged to propose innovative ways of addressing problems with alternative options and creative and workable solutions. You will also use the new visualisation tools to present your validated findings in a clear and precise manner to non-technical people.
 You will be exposed to different sectors and company functions. You will work most of the time at client sites in Belgium.
 Profile

Master or PhD in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Operations Research or any related field
A minimum of 2 - 5 years of working experience as a data scientist or in analytics
Passionate about data and/or statistical analysis, with mathematics and causal modeling skills
Strong programming skills such as Java and/or Python
Knowledge of statistical modeling and tools (SAS, R, Matlab...), SQL and data mining is required
Knowledge of machine learning, Hadoop or other Big Data frameworks is a plus
At ease in manipulating and analysing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from various sources
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills: you have the ability to communicate results clearly to non-technical colleagues
Strong analytical competencies and excellent creative problem-solving skills
Experience in Data Visualisation (knowledge of Business Intelligence Reporting & Analysis tools)
Overall knowledge of Business Intelligence is an asset
Fluent in English and/or Dutch - French

What we offer
 Keyrus offers a working environment and projects that attract the best people working in Data, Digital and Business Transformation. Working on diverse and challenging projects, you will have the opportunity to develop multi-disciplinary skills to help you build a strong career path.
 To support you in this we have a digital learning platform with access to over 30,000 training courses as well as courses created by our experts. We dedicate a generous training budget that allows you to manage your career path at a pace that suits you.
 We have also implemented an Agile Performance Management framework, where strength-based coaching, aligned company goals, alongside regular check-ins and feedback managed throughout the year are at the heart of our people management strategy.
 Our salary package is generous and includes ‘’Innovation Income Deduction’’ which recognises Keyrus and, in turn, our employees for the creation of innovative solutions and Intellectual Property. This means a greater net salary for you. On top of this we offer a car, petrol card, DKV insurance, net allowances and a cafeteria plan, amongst other benefits!
 Keyrus gives you the chance to develop your career alongside leaders in data, digital and management and transformation. Our project and clients at the heart of data and digital transformation changing the world we live in for the better, making data matter.

 Who we are  Keyrus, creator of value in the era of Data and Digital.
 Keyrus is dedicated to helping enterprises take advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.
 Keyrus in Belgium employs 200+ highly skilled consultants and is part of the international Keyrus Group, an international player in consulting and technologies and a specialist in Data and Digital. Created in 1996, listed on Euronext's Eurolist, with consolidated revenues of €289.1m in 2021 and with more than 3200+ employees in 22 countries. The Keyrus Group offers the performance, solidity and know-how of a large professional services organization, whilst preserving the agility of a young company.
 For more information, visit our website: www.keyrus.be

At the Positive Thinking Company, we are looking for your talent to strengthen and grow our community of Data & Analytics experts. Joining us is joining a company that resembles you, building itself as you express your talents, your passion, and communicate your ideas.


 So, are you ready to take the plunge and become our next Data Scientist? To be perfectly sure, here is all the information you need!



Your mission

As a Data Scientist, you will:

Formalize a business need into a technical solution & implement it
 Deal with both structured & unstructured data and provide information through predictive models
 Collect, prepare & visualize data, optimize predictive models & deploy the solution
 Be part of an Analytics team composed of Data Analysts and Data Engineers, collaborate daily with the business teams

The technical environments available with our customers are: Python (Tensorflow, Pandas, Numpy, scikit-learn…), R, SQL, Machine learning & AI tools and techniques (k-nearest neighbors, random forests, ensemble methods, clustering, regression, neural networks…).
Your know-how will enable you to bring a real added value to our customers, and you will contribute to the development of our Data & Analytics domain concerned while benefiting from the sharing and pooling of our teams’ experiences.

Your talent as a Data Scientist


You have a master’s degree, preferably in computer science, statistics, economics or a comparable field of study
 You have approx 2 to 8 years of professional experience as a data scientist
 You are committed and careful, have a high level of motivation and enjoy working well in a team
 Your work is characterized by a high level of customer orientation and excellent communication skills
 High proficiency in English and French or Dutch.
 Willingness to travel within Belgium (mainly Brussels, Gent or Antwerp)


Why coworkers love working with us

By joining the Positive Thinking Company, you will become a member of a community of enthusiasts with whom you will continually develop your knowledge by imagining the best solutions! But what will really make your day-to-day work interesting will be:

Diverse projects in our Data & Analytics domain with customers from different industries
 The opportunity to train and work on promising technologies
 Individual development opportunities, tailored to your strengths, for your further career path with us
 Benefit from our 360° evolution approach, workshops, certifications and training to help you develop your skills.
 Attractive remuneration, additional benefits, and 30 days of vacation and a company car.

Advisory - Manager
    
 Location 

      Zaventem HQ
    
 Roles & Responsibilities 



      In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.
     

       What is the job about?
     

 Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
 Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
 Mentoring colleagues
 Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions
 Gathering and organizing data
 Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
 Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
 Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist IT profiles
 Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…



 Skills & Qualifications 



      The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!
     

       Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:
     

 Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
 A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
 Other types of eduction are also valued.
 A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
 Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
 Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
 The desire to learn and grow
 A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
 Knowledge of dutch is a big plus



 We offer 



A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
 An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and background.
 Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
 Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
 A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.
