  Your role & work environment 
As a Data Analyst at ING you will play a crucial role in the data-driven culture by supporting our products and services Tribes. You will be responsible to support the decision making process by delivering valuable insights to both your colleagues and our clients. 
For this position you will join as a Data Analyst the Digital Monitor Squad. Here you will be part of an Agile environment by being a member of a multidisciplinary team of 8 to 9 professionals. Their main mission is to improve the international reporting in IBM cognos. Your duties will also include analysis and optimization of our inbound and outbound marketing activities.
 Your key responsibilities
 Translating the business needs into an analytical request:

Hereby you will be discussing and challenging the needs and requirements with your stakeholders. 
While thinking along you already think a step further in terms of a feasibility analysis, setting realistic timelines, and cross-checking the data needs and availabilities.
Based on this, you define a suitable approach and solution that fits the needs. These you communicate in a clear and transparent way to your stakeholders.

 Go over to the execution phase, this by applying some advanced analytical skills, capabilities and techniques, some examples are: 

Executing an in-depth analysis on our customer data base to come up with answers to some specific questions or needs from the business
Defining the most relevant offers for our customers based on insights from our datamart
Create some advances ad-hoc reporting for specific needs, using tools like Cognos and Adobe

 After the analytical quest you communicate your insights and recommendations in an appropriate way to the stakeholders:

This by applying the right visualization techniques.
Adapting your storyline and message to the needs and context of your stakeholders.
Communicating clear and on a convincing way your recommendations and next steps; while keeping aspects of GDPR, data sensitivity and confidentiality into account.

 We look for 
A colleague with a talent for taking it on and making it happen, enthusiasm for helping others to be successful and a knack for always being a step ahead. In other words, you strive to bring fresh ideas to life and embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment. You are a naturally collaborative person who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals. You love to challenge the status quo and are eager to propose creative solutions to problems. 
As a Data Analyst you will also need to have following qualifications and competences: 

Master’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or alike, and/or equivalent experience of 3 years 
2 years relevant experience in data analytics
Experience in SQL is a must
Experience with tools such as SAS, Cognos or Adobe are a plus; an interest in these tools is a must
Be a team player
Be analytical: extremely curious, constantly looking for an explanation; analyzing sharply, concise & to the point
Take ownership on tasks assigned: you will be cultivating analytics within the bank
Be able to influence and convince not only peers but also the stakeholders based on analytical results 
Good knowledge of English

 We offer you 
A clear purpose, a unique offer and a range of flexible compensation and other benefits:

Personal growth & challenging work with endless opportunities to realize your ambitions
An informal, dynamic environment with innovative colleagues supporting your endeavors
A progressive and agile way of working, where new ideas are valued ahead of convention

 Furthermore, within the Digital and Customer Interactions tribe as a Data Analyst, you can count on a range of opportunities to invest in your personal and professional growth with: 

Ample opportunities to participate in courses and trainings within the analytical domain
Challenging, strategic and highly visible projects to support or take the lead in
Personal coaching through our agile structure by the help of Agile coaches and Chapter leads
An environment that stimulates continuous learning and improvement, and the possibility to experience over time multiple different aspects within data analytics

 We redefine banking. What about you?
 We’re on a journey that’s centered around our customers, powered by technology and driven by smart, determined people. Our customers feel our people are empowering them to stay a step ahead in life and in business. We’re proud of that!

 Om onze Corporate Service Information Data Knowledge Management (CS-IDKM) te versterken, zijn we momenteel op zoek naar een Senior Data Scientist


 Inhoud van de functie
 Een groot aantal gegevens die in verschillende databases worden beheerd, ondersteunt de afvalbeheer- en afvalbergingsprocessen.
 De missie van onze new afdeling IDKM is het doorvoeren van een cultuur van beheer, kwaliteit, en het delen van kennis en informatie (data / documenten) gecentraliseerd binnen de NIRAS en Belgoprocess organisatie. We nemen deel aan een transversaal prioritair project dat de verschillende databanken in verband met afvalbeheer, die administratieve, technische en industriële processen omvatten, samenbrengt. Dit is gekoppeld aan een ander project dat wij hebben opgezet op het gebied van informatiebeheer met betrekking tot dezelfde processen. Deze laatste zullen gegevens gebruiken om informatie te contextualiseren en deze bedrijfsprocessen te ondersteunen.
 We zijn op zoek naar een Senior Data Scientist om ons multidisciplinaire team te versterken en om de cel van onze Data Scientists aan te sturen.
 Je zal verantwoordelijk zijn voor het voorstellen van een strategie en een aanpak voor het gegevensbeheer, rekening houdend met de huidige situatie en prioriteiten. Daarnaast zal je verbeteringen aan de relationele modellen van de databases voorstellen en de masterdata bepalen. Je zal zorgen voor de invoering en toepassing van governance ter zake en voor de totstandbrenging van datasets, zodat NIRAS/Belgoprocess te allen tijde kan beschikken over kwalitatieve, unieke en accurate gegevens.
 Je verantwoordelijkheden

Je werkt mee aan het voorstel voor een strategie voor het beheer van gegevens die op het niveau van NIRAS/Belgoprocess gedeeld worden.
Je werkt de governance uit met betrekking tot het gegevensbeheer en verzekert de toepassing en het documentaire beheer ervan.
Je zorgt voor de uitwerking en implementatie van de relationele datamodellen op basis van de analyse van de bestaande data en huidige relationele schema’s, in nauwe samenwerking met de Data Engineer en de Data analist en de data Owners.
Je ontwikkelt en implementeert, met de steun van de Enterprise Architect en diverse interne diensten, de technische normen die de veiligheid, integriteit, beschikbaarheid, traceerbaarheid, context en kwaliteit van de gegevens garanderen, alsook de naleving van de geldende wetgeving op nucleair gebied.
Je werkt samen met diverse interne partners om hun behoeften te begrijpen en te integreren in de strategie en de relationele schema’s.
Je zorgt voor de aanvaarding van veranderingen inzake gegevensbeheer binnen de ruimere IDKM strategie.

Je profiel

Je hebt een masterdiploma met een technische/engineeringopleiding in informatica of minstens vijf jaar relevante ervaring in een vergelijkbare functie.
Je geeft blijk van initiatief en bent stressbestendig en polyvalent.
Je hebt zin voor organisatie en bent een teamspeler.
Je bent conceptueel sterk en goed in het stellen van prioriteiten.
Je bent in staat te interageren met verschillende afdelingen en beschikt over sterke interpersoonlijke vaardigheden.
Je beschikt over zeer goede communicatie-, analyse- en synthesevaardigheden.
Je bent in staat de businessbehoeften te vertalen door de gegevens te analyseren en de impact ervan op het relationele model te bepalen.
Je hebt een goede kennis van het plannen, ontwerpen en realiseren van masterdata met behulp van Microsoft-tools.
Je beschikt over: 
   
kennis van en ervaring met technieken en tools voor de verwerking van gegevens, het beheer van de databases (SQL Server, SQL DB, MS Access) en de visualisatie ervan;
kennis van en ervaring met technieken en tools voor het modelleren van gegevens, bijvoorbeeld: Enterprise Architecture (Sparx);
algemene kennis van de concepten, van het analyseren van de behoeften tot het ontwerpen van OO-, multitier-, web- en/of UML- omgevingen;
goede kennis van Data Warehouse- en BI-concepten, -processen en -architecturen;
kennis van Data Warehouse-veiligheidsaspecten;
kennis van de bouw van de volgende Data warehouse-componenten: data-integratie (ETL), rapporten en analyses (BI), databases en metadata;
het vermogen om het ontwerp van nieuwe bedrijfsprocessen en gegevensmodellen te herzien, waarbij je inzicht toont in het toepassingsgebied, de strategieën en de bedrijfsdoelstellingen.

Je bent functioneel tweetalig Frans-Nederlands (mondeling en schriftelijk). Je beheerst ook voldoende het Engels om met internationale contacten te communiceren.

NIRAS biedt je

een functie met talrijke uitdagingen en grote verantwoordelijkheden;
een marktconforme verloning, rekening houdend met je kwalificaties en ervaring, en aantrekkelijke extralegale voordelen (groepsverzekering, hospitalisatieverzekering, terugbetaling van vervoerkosten, maaltijdcheques enz.);
een voltijdse arbeidsovereenkomst (40u/week) van onbepaalde duur;
een aangename werkomgeving die een goede balans garandeert tussen werk en privéleven en die je in staat stelt je competenties te ontwikkelen ten dienste van een belangrijk maatschappelijk thema;
structureel telewerk van twee dagen per week gemiddeld.

Plaats van tewerkstelling
 Je zal voornamelijk tewerkgesteld zijn in onze kantoren in Brussel en zal je regelmatig verplaatsen naar onze sites in Dessel-Mol (provincie Antwerpen) en Fleurus (provincie Henegouwen).
 Kandidatuur
 Heb je interesse voor deze functie of ken je iemand die de nodige kwalificaties bezit om ze uit te oefenen

Présentation de la société

Mieux nous connaître pour faire le bon choix

 Que diriez-vous d’évoluer dans une entreprise 
  qui agit au quotidien avec l'ensemble de ses équipes pour être LE leader de la relation client ?
   Rejoindre Cofidis, c'est rejoindre un acteur majeur du crédit 
  qui place l'humain au cœur de toutes ses actions dans le but d’écouter, d’accompagner et de valoriser ses clients.
   Expert du crédit depuis 1985, Cofidis Belgique soutient les Retailers / Courtiers dans le développement de leurs activités. Cofidis, membre du Crédit Mutuel Alliance Fédérale, propose une gamme de solutions et de services financiers simples, performants et personnalisés : Prêt à Tempérament, carte de crédit Mastercard®, facilité de paiement en 3 fois. Leader de la relation et en pleine croissance, Cofidis Belgique est actuellement à la recherche d’un(e) Data Analyst afin de rejoindre une entreprise dans laquelle l’humain est au premier plan.
  
 Autonomie, responsabilité, solidarité entre les équipes, mais aussi moments de fun et de partage font partie de 
  notre cadre de vie. Il illustre la façon dont nous voulons faire notre métier au plus proche de nos 420 collaborateurs et de nos clients.
  
 Venez rejoindre une équipe dynamique au sein d’une entreprise certifiée 
  Great Place to Work.
  
 N'attendez plus, faisons connaissance !
  
Notre conseil pour postuler : restez vous-même ! Venez avec votre motivation, vos ambitions, vos idées et toute votre énergie.

 Notre conviction :
   « Nous croyons que chacun est libre de vivre la vie qu’il désire et d’avancer à sa façon. Notre moteur est l’humain dans toutes ses différences. Celui qui assume son quotidien, celui qui décide de franchir le pas, celui qui réalise son rêve.
   Nous l’écoutons l’esprit ouvert et accompagnons son chemin, en proposant des solutions financières simples. »
  

Cofidis. Libre d’avancer.

Mission

  Vous intégrez l’équipe campaign et customer intelligence, une équipe soudée, centrée sur le développement du business et la satisfaction des clients. Nous utilisons la data au quotidien pour optimiser les campagnes marketing et l’expérience de nos prospects et de nos clients.
   Personnellement, vous contribuerez à atteindre cet objectif grâce à :
  
 L’étude du comportement de nos clients yc sur les sites et applications mobiles de Cofidis
 L’analyse des A/B tests pour orienter les évolutions des sites
 La mise en place des reporting nécessaires pour suivre :
    
 Le business
 Les évolutions du comportement de nos prospects et/ou clients
 La dynamique de notre fichier client.

 L’automatisation et le suivi des outils de connaissance client (scoring, segmentation…) en binôme avec notre datascientist


Profil


Vous avez une connaissance solide en SAS, SQL,
 Vous avez déjà utilisé au moins un outil de data visualisation (Qliksense, PowerBI, …)
 La connaissance d’un outil de modélisation de type R ou Python est un plus
 Vous êtes rigoureux et vous aimez faire parler les chiffres
 Vous avez une appétence forte pour le monde du digital et le métier du marketing
 Vous avez une bonne capacité d’écoute et vous êtes capables de transcrire un besoin métier en plan d’études ou en maquette pour un tableau de bord
 Vous savez vulgariser vos analyses pour communiquer largement vos résultats
 Vous avez l’esprit d’équipe
 Vous êtes orienté résultat
 Vous aimez bénéficier d’autonomie dans vos missions


Avantages

  Nous vous proposons de venir travailler dans une entreprise où il fait bon travailler, certifiée Great Place to Work pour la 5e année.
   En plus de vos congés légaux, vous bénéficiez de 21 jours de RTT. En plus de votre salaire, nous vous offrons des chèques repas et plusieurs primes annuelles, sans compter que Cofidis vous permet de flexibiliser votre package salarial via un plan caféteria !

What if we didn’t focus on who you are now, but who you could become? 
Here at EY, you’ll have the chance to build a truly exceptional experience. We’ll empower you with the latest technology, surround you with high-performing teams, and provide the global scale and diverse and inclusive culture you need to discover your full potential. Through our coaching and training programs, you’ll develop the skillsets you need to stay relevant today and in the future – all while building a network of colleagues, mentors, and leaders who will be on the journey with you at EY and beyond. 
The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.


The opportunity: your next adventure awaits
EY People Advisory Services professionals can help effectively harness the people agenda as part of an integrated business strategy. This can translate into competitive advantage by helping clients get the right people, with the right capabilities, in the right place, for the right cost, doing the right things.


The Reward team ensures that organizations can offer the best possible Reward experience to their employees. We help our clients to set up a Reward system which is in line with their vision and which also takes into account all relevant implications from a tax & HR perspective.


Our fast growing team, which is part of People Advisory Services at EY, is welcoming new, dynamic colleagues who would like to kickstart their career as Data Analyst.


Your key responsibilities
If you are convinced that ‘Data is King’, then you are the new Reward Data Analyst we are looking for. You will be part of our truly multidisciplinary team of remuneration experts, technology geeks and data wizards. You will be dragged into projects answering client questions such as :

How can we give extra insights to companies regarding their employees (Dynamic Dashboards regarding Compensation & Benefits, Salary Evolutions, Pension Build up, possible savings, Absenteïsm, Turnover…)
Smart scans of remuneration packages (fe payroll data) to look for optimizations (better cost-net relationship, Tax and Social Security savings, market comparison, legal constraints…)
How can we optimize the current remuneration package of the employee population based on the current data? 
How can we align remuneration packages of one or more companies being in a M&A?
How can we create a lasting People Experience in the mobility strategy?
What are the new trends in the market?

As a Reward Data Analyst you will help the team and clients with rethinking their reward and remuneration strategy based on the current available data and how to link them to the best solutions available in the market. Next to that you will also be involved in the implementation and the deploy of the new solutions with the required supporting technology and data analysis.


What we look for

You have an innovative and collaborative mindset
You have a ‘data mindset’
You can work with data analysis programs or are eager to learn how to work with them (e.g. Excel, Alteryx, R, Python, Spotfire, Power BI,…)
You are enthusiastic to work with your colleagues and to deliver the exceptional experience to our clients
Curious, innovative nature that strives to solve client problems in a new way
You say “challenge” instead of “problem”
You have an untamable curiosity about the new world of work to create new solutions taken into account different aspects
You are fluent in Dutch or French and English



What’s in it for you

Accelerate your technical capabilities and transformative leadership skills with future-focused courses and development programs.
Broaden your horizons by working on highly integrated teams across the globe and collaborate with people of diverse backgrounds — both professionally and culturally.
Bring out the best in yourself with continuous investment in your personal well-being and career development. 
Develop your own personal purpose and help us create a positive ripple effect on our teams, our business, clients and society – building a better working world, together.
A competitive remuneration package including fringe benefits and a company car will be offered.

With the creation of a Business Intelligence center, Alken Maes aims at gathering all the business analytics and reporting roles to build a cutting-edge structure to accelerate insights creation, collection and delivery to the operational Business teams (marketing, out of home & off-trade).
It enables organic development and accelerate capability growth by elevating analytical & data-driven skills and mindset throughout the OpCo. By combining all fragmented business intelligence capabilities, it leverages cross-functional collaboration and learning by ensuring intelligence profiles are embedded together to increase their development. The Business Intelligence Centre have E2E responsibility in this field consolidated in a roadmap and agenda.


YOUR JOB


As a Data Analyst you support our ambition to become a data-driven company. You source and shape data into meaningful insights using Microsoft Power BI or Excel. You listen, challenge, and serve our business users to help them become more data-driven. You bridge the gap between business and the back-end BI development to align business requirements with back-end data sources.


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES


1.Turn data into meaningful and usable insights

Listen, challenge and serve our business users with new and structured Power BI / Excel data solutions.
Maintain the existing Power BI landscape.
Introduce and bring into practice new tools and technologies to help our organisation become more data-driven.
Act as a middle-man between business and ID&T (IT) to make sure the available data and tooling capabilities match the business requirements.
Support the Data Strategy Lead in forming and bringing the BI roadmap into execution.
Help to increase data governance within the company by embedding and maintaining a report catalog, business glossary, business rules.
Together with Global/external partners participate in several data-driven projects (MMM, DDS, iDDM,…).
Educate business stakeholders on new data capabilities and assets
Constantly challenge the Way of Working by showcasing how we could enable business problem solving through data analytics

2. Be the SPOC for our D&A team (Data&Analytics):



Give input to the D&A team to form the backlog based on business requirements/BI roadmap.
Test (user acceptance) the delivered D&A solutions.
Arise incidents and align with D&A team.
Join sprint planning and review meetings to increase collaboration with D&A and BI-team.




YOUR PROFILE



You have a professional Bachelor or Master in Economics or computer science;
1-3 years of experience in a similar role in data analyst, front-end BI developer, data advanced analysis or data modelling either client side 
You have an educational background in IT, Advanced analytics, engineering, computer science or similar.
A hands-on expertise in: Microsoft Power BI (or other OLAP tool), Excel, SQL, Python (optional),…
You have at least a basic understanding of data terms: data warehouse, facts and dimensions, star-schema,…
You have an understanding of web fundamentals (e.g. JavaScript, cookies, tagging);
You know the Agile / Scrum way of the working.
You have a strong analytical and critical mindset and you are creative in looking for improvements;
You work very precisely, and you have an eye for detail;
You are very pragmatic, pro-active and hands-on;
You are a team player and solid in stakeholder management;
You have good communication skills and you find it easy to maintain contacts with different stakeholders;
You are eager to learn, and you can easily respond to change;
You are trilingual (Dutch/English/French).


 
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?



A dynamic environment, a smaller & approachable structure with the benefits of belonging to our larger, international Heineken family;
Jovial colleagues who enjoy a refreshing Cristal 0.0 or Desperados 0.0 after work;
The opportunity to make your mark and take the initiative, which, according to our colleagues, is unanimously one of the greatest advantages of working at Alken Maes;
And of course, a competitive package and other nice conditions.

Hou je ervan om interne communicaties te stroomlijnen en heb je affiniteit met data analytics? Ga aan de slag als communicatieverantwoordelijke bij Colruyt Group Data & Analytics. Van een communicatiestrategie uitwerken tot inspirerende testimonials schrijven, variatie troef!Jouw takenpakket als communicatieverantwoordelijke:

 Je stelt een communicatiestrategie op en werkt communicatieplannen uit voor diverse topics zoals bijvoorbeeld veranderingstrajecten, de uitvoering van het strategische plan, enz. Je zorgt daarbij voor een gepaste kanalenmix en timing. Dankzij jouw aanpak is het voor iedereen duidelijk wat onze divisie doet: meerwaarde creëren uit data.
 Je werkt nauw samen met de verschillende stakeholders zodat je steeds het ideale communicatieplan kan opstellen voor alle betrokken partijen.
 Je helpt de communicatieskills van je collega’s te verbeteren. Daarnaast breng je ook het redactieteam samen zodat je alle nodige informatie kan verzamelen voor de communicatiestrategie van je divisie.
 Je communiceert niet alleen intern maar ook naar de rest van de organisatie. Jij maakt technische zaken duidelijk en behapbaar voor iedereen. Zo draag ook jij je steentje bij tot het creëren van een customer-oriented organisation.

 Je werkt in Wilgenveld en kan 2 dagen per week thuiswerken of in één van onze regionale kantoren (Mechelen, Deinze, Merelbeke, …). 



Profiel


 Kennis en ervaring –Je hebt een bachelor- of masterdiploma in marketing, communicatiewetenschappen of -management en een paar jaar werkervaring in een communicatiefunctie. Heb je daarnaast interesse in data analytics en een vlotte pen? Top! 
Talenkennis – Je communiceert vlot in het Nederlands en het Engels. Je hebt een basis Frans.
 Organisatie – Je kan een operationele en tactische planning opstellen en verliest het menselijke aspect nooit uit het oog.
 Positieve mindset – Je kan mensen mobiliseren om projecten tot een goed einde te brengen.




 Wij bieden


 Impact –Je hebt een boeiende job met ruimte voor initiatief. 
Loonpakket – Je krijgt een aantrekkelijk loon met extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques en winstdeelname.
 Opleiding – We bieden een breed opleidingsaanbod om jezelf te blijven ontwikkelen.
 Breed netwerk – Je komt in contact met specialisten uit verschillende vakgebieden.

Op basis van jouw passie voor data én tuinbouw, voer je innovatief praktijkgericht onderzoek in de (glas)tuinbouw. Je verdiept je in het opbouwen, connecteren en analyseren van grote datasets, artificiële intelligentie, modellering en beeldanalyses. Dit binnen verschillende onderzoeksthema¿s, gaande van klimaatbeheersing en energie, beheersing van ziekten en plagen, innovatieve teeltsystemen en automatisatie (netwerken van sensoren,¿), robotisering, duurzaam watergebruik,¿ en dit voor de teelten van tomaat, paprika en aardbeien. Als data scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor één of meerdere onderzoeken in het kader van jaarlijkse onderzoekprogramma¿s en projectonderzoek en ben je trekker van het datagedreven onderzoek. Je overlegt met het onderzoeksteams vruchtgroenten en aardbeien, je spart met onderzoeker(s) uit het datateam en rapporteert aan de directeur. 
Een greep uit het takenpakket: 
Je neemt deel aan onderzoeksprojecten in nationale en internationale context 
Je connecteert nieuwe en historische datasets in databanken. Je analyseert deze data door middel van neurale netwerken, metaheuristieken en regressieanalyse (bv populatiemodellen, oogstprognoses,¿) 
Verwerking van fotodatabanken door middel van beeldanalysetechnieken 
Internet of Things opportuniteiten voor de (glas)tuinbouw (bv mbv sensornetwerken) valideer je in praktijkonderzoek 
Je verdiept je in de dataregistratiesystemen en geautomatiseerde sorteermachines voor de productie- en sorteringsdata van de vruchten uit al onze onderzoeksplots 
Je rapporteert, publiceert en presenteert praktijkgerichte conclusies op basis van onderzoeksresultaten 
Je ondersteunt onderzoekers bij opbouw en verwerking van datasets en daarbij horende statistische analyses. 
Profil 

Je beschikt over een masterdiploma in wetenschappelijke of wiskundige/informatica richting 
Affiniteit met tuinbouw 
Je hebt ervaring met data analytics en gaat vlot om met de gangbare tools voor statistische analyse en machine learning (R / Python) 
Kennis van datavisualisatie in bv. R Shiny, PowerBI,¿ is een pluspunt 
Je kan zowel mondeling als schriftelijk vlot uitdrukken in Nederlands en Engels 
Kritisch, accuraat en praktijkgericht 
Je bent ondernemend, leergierig en oplossingsgericht 
Je bent teamgericht en je kan autonoom werken 
Heb je werkervaring in een data science rol dan spitsen we helemaal onze oren. Maar ook als je die ervaring niet hebt maar wel zeer datagedreven bent, leren we je graag kennen. 

Connaissances linguistiques 

  Nederlands : Goed 
 

  Engels : Goed

job_title: Consumer Journey Data Analyst Antwerp, Belgium Consumer
job_summary:
Did you know that Philip Morris International is undergoing a revolutionary business transformation? We will be far more than a leading cigarette company. We want to change society and deliver a better, smoke-free future. Thanks to the imagination and perseverance of thousands of people at PMI, we have developed smoke-free products that are better alternatives to cigarettes.
 
 And it does not stop there. We are investing in a portfolio of innovative products beyond nicotine. So, whether in new product development, commercialization, operations, science, you name it, we are putting our vision into reality every day and make the change happen, right now.
 
 The mission of our consumer centric organization is to deeply understand consumer needs in order to accelerate the transition of current smokers who don’t quit towards a smoke-free alternative.
 

 The team will achieve this mission through their relentless focus on value-adding activities based on experience from the past, consumer insights and decision-making. The main responsibilities will be:
 
 o analyzing data from various sources to identify consumer pain points and delights
  o suggest initiatives that will solve the key consumer pains 
  o end to end ownership and continuous analysis of the consumer journey
  o understand the consumer experience at retail 
 
 To strengthen this team, we are looking for a Consumer Journey Data analyst that will report to the Voice of Consumer Manager.
 
 Purpose of the role
 
 We are currently looking for a Consumer Journey Data Analyst.
  The role consists of consumer data analytics (60%) and organising retail landscape analysis (40%). 
 
 As part of the CCO team and reporting to the Voice of Consumer Manager, you are connecting the dots on the continuous incoming consumer feedback, perform deep dive analysis on consumer insights, identify data gaps, propose recommendations on how to fill the gaps and provide consolidated consumer insights from several sources to the organization. You will also assess the consumer experience at retail by organizing retail analysis visits to test the retailer messaging towards our Legal Aged Smokers and will need to create questionnaires and work together with an external agency to arrange the visits. 
 
 Key accountabilities
  1. Analyse continuous consumer feedback data streams coming from all channels (e.g. Customer Care Team, Direct consumer feedback from B2C force, Consumer feedback from surveys). 
  2. Consolidate & connect the dots between the omni-channel consumer data and provide valuable insights back to the organization for taking action.
  3. Identify consumer knowledge gaps across the Consumer Journey and propose recommendations on how to collect the data. 
  4. Cooperate closely with other departments (Business Intelligence, Customer Care, Digital, CRM etc) and drive mutual analysis and collaboration
  5. Align with the country team on the needs for retail analysis visits (e.g. which channels to visits and which messaging to test), prepare the questionnaire for the visits and connect with an external agency to organise the visits. 
  6. Next to these accountabilities, it might be perfect if you also are a pioneer in visualising all the insights and digitalizing the different data sources in order to process consumer data more efficiently and can take adequate actions more quickly (e.g. dashboard creation, apply machine learning / sentiment tracking automation, etc). 
 
 Key challenges in the role
  1. Ability of putting your teeth into the data by doing deep dives but also bringing this back to a higher level in order to make sure the insights become understandable and actionable. 
  2. Work cross-functionally and be able to continuously collaborate with other departments that have data which can help create a bigger picture
  3. Constantly stand up for the ‘voice of the consumer’’. Live for and defend insights-driven decisions.
 


 What we are looking for: Key competencies & Experience
  Key competencies 
 

Strong consumer focused mindset
Strong analytical skills with high attention to details 
Adopt a curious mindset and passionate by connecting the dots in the benefit of our consumers
Excellent communication skills at all levels in the organisation, able to present insights in an easy and understandable way 
Cross collaboration with departments that also have data & with external suppliers 
Fluency in English required, Dutch reading ability is a necessaty as well.
Extra advantage if you have competencies in visualizing data and creating dashboards 

 Experience
 

Bachelor’s degree (economics, mathematics) or equivalent by experience
Proven expertise in (consumer) analytics 
Advanced user of MS Office applications, especially MS Excel and PowerPoint
Experience of digitalizing consumer data by using new technologies (e.g. machine learning / sentiment tracking) will be an advantage

 What will the selection process look like?
  Talent Acquisition (TA) will perform an initial screening to assess whether candidates match with the defined vacancy requirements. If this is the case, the candidate will be invited for 2 competency-based (virtual) interviews. 
  In parallel, you will be asked to complete online assessment tests*. At the end of the process, each candidate will receive the assessment results, as well as actionable feedback for their further development.
 


Assessment Tests
 The tests are integrated in the selection process to increase objectivity of the final decision making. The assessment tests for this role is a cognitive ability test. The results will not be saved in the employee’s file, and will only be used in the context of the vacancy for which the employee is applying. Results are therefore not used for purposes of performance evaluation. 
 

Cognitive Ability Test: Report links under three headings: 
1. Deductive reasoning (measuring the ability drawing logical conclusions)
  2. Inductive reasoning (measuring conceptual and analytical thinking)
  3. Numerical reasoning (measuring capacity to understand numerical data and interpret mathematical information correctly)

Belgium, Olen Corporate Research & Development Research & Development
 Posted on 02-09-2022



 About Umicore


Reducing harmful vehicle emissions. Giving new life to used metals. Powering the cars of the future. As a global materials and technology group, we apply our specialist knowledge to offer materials and solutions that are essential to everyday life. We aim to be a clear world leader in materials for clean mobility and recycling and have turned our sustainability approach into an even greater competitive advantage. With ambitions like this, imagine what you could do?




 About Corporate Research & Development


Reducing harmful vehicle emissions. Giving new life to used metals. Powering the cars of the future. As a global materials and technology group, we apply our specialist knowledge to offer materials and solutions that are essential to everyday life.




 What you will be doing


As an Associate Data Scientist in Corporate R&D you bring your enthusiasm and proven data science background to address challenges that arise in our R&D and production facilities. You work closely together with other data scientists and experts in the field to analyse bottlenecks, eliminate inefficiencies and drive data-driven product and process optimization. You will develop a solid understanding of processes, technology and business challenges and provide firm advice to the project team. You will also keep up-to-date with the evolution of data analytics in an industrial context.
 Your detailed responsibilities

 Carry out data analytics projects from data exploration to building and training customized machine learning models
 Collaborate with different functional teams to implement data-driven models into production and ensure continuous improvements
 Work with stakeholders across the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions 
In some cases, act also as project coordinator 
Strengthen own and group’s expertise in the area of data science and machine learning
 Be involved in the IP strategy for the assigned projects





 Who we are looking for


An analytical colleague with:

 Master’s degree in computer science, applied mathematics or engineering with relevant data science specialization (minimum of 2 years working experience preferred)
 Thorough knowledge of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
 Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, discriminant analysis, etc.) 
Good coding knowledge and hands-on experience in Python
 Understanding of cloud deployment, experience in Azure Databricks, MLflow and Azure Machine Learning (preferred)
 Good networker with an eye for customer centricity 
Interest in and exposure to industrial activities, processes and technology
 Good oral and written English communication skills. Dutch, French, German, Korean, Japanese, Chinese capabilities are an asset





 What we offer


We aim to lead the way. Not just for our customers, but for our employees too. That is why we strive to create a collaborative environment in which we can all succeed, and a culture through which we can all share ideas, develop our expertise and advance our careers. We engage in building an inclusive work culture that offers equal opportunities for all employees irrespective of their diverse backgrounds. As you would expect from a world-leading organisation, we will also reward your contribution with a competitive salary and benefits. With all this and more, imagine what you could do?




 If our pioneering approach can make us a leader in sustainability, IMAGINE WHAT YOU COULD DO ?





Solliciteer

De KSB zoekt een gemotiveerd wetenschapper met een achtergrond in geofysica, geodesie en/of data science. 
De aangeboden functie vereist creatief denken, modelleren en programmeren, evenals het gebruik van Machine Learning om diverse gegevensbronnen te analyseren met het oog op de ontwikkeling van een automatisch systeem voor de kwaliteitscontrole van GNSS-gegevens. 
De ontwikkelde methoden zullen worden toegepast op de gegevens afkomstig van meer dan 1000 GNSS-stations van het European Plate Observing System (EPOS)-netwerk en zullen bijdragen tot een betere interpretatie van de berekende positieveranderingen. 
De succesvolle kandidaat zal ook het GNSS-team van de KSB ondersteunen bij zijn operationele activiteiten. 
Hij/zij zal wetenschappelijke verslagen opstellen, wetenschappelijke publicaties schrijven en de onderzoeksresultaten presenteren op nationale en internationale workshops en conferenties. 
Profil 


Master of doctoraat in computerwetenschappen, geofysica, wiskunde, natuurkunde of ingenieurswetenschappen 
Uitstekende wetenschappelijke programmeervaardigheden, bv. grondige kennis van wetenschappelijke pythonbibliotheken voor data-analyse en visualisatie 
Kennis van GNSS-gegevensmodellering en/of Machine Learning-technieken zijn sterke troeven 
Gevorderd niveau in mondeling en schriftelijk Engels, kennis van het Nederlands en/of Frans is een pluspunt 
Gemotiveerd, met zin voor initiatief, wetenschappelijke nieuwsgierigheid en teamworkvaardigheden 
Dynamisch, pro-actief en servicegericht

job_title: Ingénieur Usine du Futur – Data Science F/H
job_summary:
Description du poste

   L'activité Data Science de l'équipe Usine du futur consiste à mettre en place des solutions informatiques permettant d'améliorer la maîtrise de nos procédés de production. Elle s'articule essentiellement autour de 4 axes : 
   o La plateforme Thingworx de collecte et d'affichage des données machines 
   o La plateforme Rapidminer pour traiter les données et développer des modèles de Machine Learning 
   o Le logiciel Power BI pour développer des tableaux de bord officiels, pointant sur le Data Warehouse 
   o Le logiciel MES (Manufacturing Execution System) pour gérer toutes les activités des ateliers, en ce compris l'interaction avec le PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) au travers du MEDS (Manufacturing Engineering Design System) 
  
 L'activité du/de la candidat(e) consistera principalement à : 
  

Identifier les besoins internes en terme d'automatisation des tâches ou de modélisation (contact avec les chefs de lignes, les bureaux des méthodes,) et les structurer et prioriser, afin d'alimenter la roadmap Usine du Futur 
Prendre en charge la modélisation et le développement informatique des applications et s'assurer qu'elles répondent aux exigences 
En ce qui concerne le quatrième axe, participer au choix des solutions MES et MEDS, puis conduire le projet visant à valider et ensuite à déployer sur tout le site les solutions retenues. Outre l'aspect technique, ce sujet en particulier nécessite de bien comprendre les besoins des acteurs de terrain (opérateurs, chefs de ligne, agents de méthode, …) afin d'apporter des solutions qui seront efficaces et qui susciteront l'adhésion. 
Assurer un rôle de référent technique et assurer la formation du personnel SAB dans ses domaines d'expertise 
Participer aux projets subventionnés par la Région wallonne et/ou des fonds européens.


 Exigences du poste

Ingénieur industriel ou civil à orientation mécanique, électromécanique, science des données, aérospatiale ou informatique 
Intérêt / expérience dans la supervision et la modélisation des procédés de fabrication (usinage, traitements de surface, contrôles, …) 
Affinité envers les outils informatiques et volonté de développer une expertise dans les domaines tels que : 
o Power BI 
  o Programmation (Javascript, Python, C sharp, HTML/ CSS…) 
  o Bases de données (SQL, MongoDB, Influx DB…) 
  o Protocoles de communication (OPC UA, MTconnect, Modbus, Bacnet…) 
  o Réseau et sécurité (protocoles sécurisés, firewall…) 
 

Structuré et synthétique 
Respect des plannings et des budgets 
Soucis de répondre aux besoins des clients internes 
Autonome, rigoureux, dynamique, proactif et tenace 
Atouts supplémentaires : 
o Expérience probante dans les outils informatiques cités ci-dessus 
  o Connaissances en Machine Learning 
  o Connaissances en développement d'interfaces Homme-Machine 
  Spécificité du travail
 Missions occasionnelles en Belgique ou à l'étranger pour effectuer de la veille technologique ou faire du suivi de fournisseurs/partenaires


Safran est un groupe international de haute technologie opérant dans les domaines de l'aéronautique (propulsion, équipements et intérieurs), de l'espace et de la défense. Sa mission : contribuer durablement à un monde plus sûr, où le transport aérien devient toujours plus respectueux de l'environnement, plus confortable et plus accessible. Implanté sur tous les continents, le Groupe emploie 76 800 collaborateurs pour un chiffre d'affaires de 15,3 milliards d'euros en 2021, et occupe, seul ou en partenariat, des positions de premier plan mondial ou européen sur ses marchés. Safran s'engage dans des programmes de recherche et développement qui préservent les priorités environnementales de sa feuille de route d'innovation technologique.   Safran est classé 3ème meilleur employeur mondial dans son secteur par le magazine Forbes en 2021.   Safran Aero Boosters conçoit, développe et produit des compresseurs basse pression, des équipements et des bancs d'essais pour la propulsion aéronautique et spatiale. La société équipe la plupart des avions civils en service ainsi que le lanceur européen Ariane. Implanté à Liège (Belgique), Safran Aero Boosters emploie 1 800 personnes et dispose de 2 filiales aux États-Unis.
 MASTER 
 Jeune diplômé-e/Première expérience

Envie de faire bouger les lignes avec nous pour un monde plus durable ?


Etes-vous passionné(e) par l’application des techniques quantitatives financières et/ou l’économétrie, en combinaison avec l’analyse des datas et des statistiques descriptives ? Tant mieux car ce poste vacant à l’ALM-Trésorerie doit vous intéresser !


Le département Gestion Actif-Passif (ALM)-Trésorerie est en ce moment à la recherche d’un collaborateur pour son équipe ‘modèles financiers’. ALM-Trésorerie se trouve au cœur de la banque et a, comme principale mission, la gestion du profil de liquidité et du risque structurel de taux de notre entreprise.
L’équipe ‘modèles financiers’ contribue d’une manière importante à l’analyse du comportement client afin de le traduire en modèles de risques financiers. Quelques exemples de ces comportements client à analyser sont, en autre, le profil des retraits des dépôts sans maturité ainsi que le profil des prépaiements des crédits long terme à taux fixe. Ces comportements ont beaucoup d’impact pour la banque et leur estimation est essentielle.
Votre futur Job
Vos défis dans cette fonction sont les suivants : 

Vous traduisez, ensemble avec vos collègues de l’équipe, les différentes évolutions du comportement des clients dans des modèles financiers. A cette fin, vous analysez une grande quantité de données qui vous sont fournies et vous y appliquez des techniques statistiques, quantitatives et de big data (machine learning techniques, data cleaning, data preparation and exploration…). Vous avez l’opportunité de contacts réguliers avec les business financiers et avec le département Data au sein de la banque. Vous pouvez facilement discuter des nouvelles méthodologies et systèmes relatifs au AI.
Vos liens avec le groupe sont récurrents et permettent une discussion méthodologique entre experts Big Data. Avant toute mise en application des modèles, ceux-ci sont soumis à la validation auprès du département Risk. Vous devrez établir les contacts avec eux et leur fournir toutes les informations nécessaires à leur validation. Vous leur présentez des analyses complémentaires à vos modèles Big Data pour défendre votre approche.

As the collective research and innovation centre for the technological industry in Belgium, we are helping yearly 1.500 companies to make the right technological choices and to realise their innovation projects. Our 150 passionate experts actively work on tomorrow's business activities, products and factories, with as our goal to safeguard a successful future for the technology industry.









Sirris is looking for two senior Data Scientists to join its Data and AI Competence Lab (Ghent, Brussels or one of the other Sirris sites). In that function, you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of topics in the context of collaborative and multi-disciplinary R&D projects, helping companies to realize AI and data driven innovation.

 You take the lead in industrially-driven research projects in the domain of data analytics, you supervise small project teams and coach colleagues.
 You work together with our industrial and research partners to develop data-driven solutions for real-world problems in many diverse application domains such as renewable energy, manufacturing, smart environments, etc. This includes supporting companies in defining, setting up and evaluating their research and innovation roadmap, while also being closely involved in the subsequent execution.
 You build an (inter-) national knowledge network within the industry, the research world and with Sirris' partners, and manage multi-party (inter)national R&D projects in the field of Data Innovation and AI.
 You shape, discuss and write new project proposals with companies and research partners.
 You build up knowledge about the latest technological developments in research and industry and contribute to the organisation of dissemination events towards companies to spread those insights to the industry.
 As an ambassador of AI you facilitate cross-domain internal collaboration with our experts of other technological disciplines with the goal of adopting AI expertise in those teams.

 There is always a nice challenge ahead.





You hold a PhD or master in Computer Science or in a related engineering discipline.
 You have at least 5 years of experience in an R&D environment with hands-on knowledge about state-of-the-art ML/AI technologies.
 You have a track record of contributions in the field of data innovation and AI, either in academia with solid post doc experience, in industry or in an industrial related R&D environment.
 Knowledge about the following is a plus: statistical and machine learning tools such as scikit-learn and Pandas, non-relational databases such as MongoDB or time series databases such as InfluxDB.
 You are familiar with setting up R&D proposals.
 You have good coaching skills to lead small project teams and you enjoy sharing your AI expertise with other Sirris-colleagues.
 In order to fit in our collaborative and international environment, you are creative, dynamic and are able to work independently yet transparently towards colleagues. In addition, you are also a strong team player, both with colleagues as well as with external partners. Both individual and team problem solving skills are crucial in this position.
 You see the value of a multidisciplinary approach, working across different technologies and industries.
 You have the desire to work with the industry and to turn research results into services.
 You enjoy presenting (preliminary) results in a tangible way and demonstrate engaging teaching skills by sharing knowledge with industry via workshops, seminars, masterclasses and social media.
 You have good communication skills and are fluent in Dutch and English enabling you to clearly formulate arguments and reasoning. French language skills are an asset.
 And most of all: you are a fast learner that keeps on learning, improving, innovating in a continuously changing and fast-growing environment.





As a Sirris expert, you will be working on top class projects with Belgian companies. You will accumulate knowledge and experience in the most advanced of technologies. Every day you will experience the satisfaction of knowing that you are doing pioneering work. In other words, you will be delivering innovation in its purest form.
 Varied work, personal development and a working environment where cooperation comes first, is typical Sirris. We’re offering an attractive pay package that fully matches the job and your experience.
 Please contact Franne Godderis for further information about this position. 
Please do only apply via the website (not via e-mail)

   You’re an original. So are we.

We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines in manufacturing. And we build sustainability into everything we do. Our brands stand for freedom and self-expression around the world.
 


   We're looking for a Merchandising Data Analyst to join our merchandising product team based in our European Headquarters in Brussels. You’ll support the team in bringing the latest trends to life for our customers and consumer. You'll oversee pricing set-up, reporting and insights with relevant analysis for our regional product and sales across a diverse omni channel marketplace. As a result, you'll empower the merchandising team with the knowledge and help them build strategies to grow, maximizing the revenue, productivity and brand experience. You will report to the Pricing and Analytics Manager for Europe
 


   ABOUT THE JOB
 

 You'll build and provide accurate and insightful reports on a timely and ad hoc basis looking across an omni channel marketplace, to drive business results
 You’ll be building new tools that enable merchants to understand data and facilitate the decision-making process
 You'll be the partner to our merchandising leadership team to provide data insights, present findings and consult on risks and opportunities
 You'll provide quantitative and qualitative consumer insights, monitor competition trends and propose improvements and opportunities to the commercial and brand teams using market-place expertise to seek synergies and help develop several geographical business strategies.
 You'll establish close working relationships with cross functional teams to align on reporting requirements, best data sources and consolidate various inputs
 You'll help the brand team to get an optimal mix of product categories, supporting the brand vision and ensuring financial growth



   Start date: as soon as possible.

 You have a minimum of a bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Retail Management and or Engineering.
 You have 2-3 years in a corporate environment (apparel industry preferred) – can be internships in the retail or consumer goods industries.
 You are expect in Excel (can write advanced macros) and Powerpoint. Knowledge of Tableau, SQL or PowerBi are a plus.
 You enjoy juggling with data information, having experience handling large datasets
 You are a good communicator and feel comfortable presenting and providing insights to senior leadership
 You like having different projects simultaneously and have a focus on collaborative, diverse and international teamwork.
 You are entrepreneurial and curious, always looking to optimize and explore new territories
 You are fluent in English.
 You are a problem solver and like to simplify complex processes through planning and organization



   WHAT WE OFFER
 

 The chance to build a career with a world-renowned, historic fashion brand that lives by its values and with a large public commitment to driving our capabilities in advanced analytics.
 A chance to guide real change in an organization undergoing significant growth and transformation.
 A diverse, international environment of smart, inspiring people.
 A fun, creative, modern casual culture.

  Zaventem, Belgium

  Full time

Het Centrum voor Informatica voor het Brusselse Gewest (CIBG) is de koploper voor de digitalisering in Brussel. We loodsen onze klanten – de Brusselse openbare instellingen – langs de uitdagingen van het digitale tijdperk.
 We werken permanent mee aan een duurzame, sociaal verantwoorde en dynamische economische omgeving, voor alle Brusselaars. Een gewest dat steunt op het bundelen van hoogtechnologische infrastructuren, ICT-platformen en ICT-diensten.
 Maar onze belangrijkste resource blijft menselijk kapitaal.
 Ons team bestaat uit meer dan 550 enthousiaste medewerkers met wie je zal samenwerken in hartje Brussel.
 Bij het CIBG dragen we klanttevredenheid hoog in het vaandel, dus oplossingsgericht werken is ons mantra. Daarnaast hechten we veel waarde aan fijn teamwork en een correcte werk-privébalans, want je goed voelen, werkt beter.
 Ook zin om aan de slag te gaan in een organisatie waar verbondenheid zich digitaal én sociaal uit? Stuur ons dan snel je sollicitatie!
 Jouw functie:

Je werkt samen met de interne teams en partners van het CIBG om de mogelijkheden voor datagebruik op te sporen
Je vertaalt de problemen van de verschillende functies in 'data science' projecten
Je bereidt de gegevens voor, onderzoekt en analyseert ze
Je past statistische modellen en machine learning toe om de vastgestelde problemen aan te pakken
Je werkt samen met de andere teamleden om de modellen in productie te nemen
Je volgt de modellen op om hun levenscyclus te beheren en ze te laten evolueren
Je communiceert de resultaten van de analyses.

Jouw opleiding en ervaring:

Je hebt een masterdiploma Economie, Statistiek of Wiskunde of hebt een gelijkwaardige ervaring
Je hebt een eerste ervaring van minstens 2 jaar achter de rug op het gebied van data-analyse, statistische analyse en machine learning
Python heeft voor jou geen geheimen.

kennis van de nieuwe generatie databases (SQL en noSQL) is wenselijk
kennis van databricks is wenselijk
Kennis van geografische gegevensanalyse, GIS, 3D-gegevens en/of objectherkenning is een pluspunt.

Jouw competenties:

Je bent gebeten door alles wat te maken heeft met data science
Je kunt oplossingen bedenken die een concrete impact hebben op een probleem
Je bent een echte probleemoplosser
Je draait perfect mee in een multidisciplinair team
Je kunt iets helder uitleggen en goed communiceren
Je kunt complexe en technische analyseresultaten kort en bondig weergeven in duidelijke, beknopte conclusies.

Vous êtes passionné.e par la data ? Vous souhaitez utiliser vos compétences de modélisation avancée et implémenter des mécanismes d’intelligence artificielle pour anticiper le comportement des consommateurs ? Vous souhaitez créer des modèles analytiques prescriptifs et prédictifs pour soutenir la prise de décisions de grandes entreprises ?
Alors postulez chez SIRIUS Insight et mettez vos compétences au profit d’entreprises issus du retail, de l’automobile, des banques et assurances, des pharmacies, des mutuelles, … Votre expertise fera la différence pour leur développement.Le consommateur au cœur de la stratégie géomarketing SIRIUS Insight est une PME belge spécialisée dans la stratégie géomarketing. Nos clients font appel à nous pour bénéficier de nos conseils pour définir un réseau optimal de points de vente, estimer un chiffre d’affaires, déterminer le risque de churn, quantifier l’impact de différents scénarios, … L’équipe dont vous ferez partie est composée d’analystes géomarketing. Le respect, la prise d’initiative, l’entraide et la confiance sont les éléments clés qui conditionnent notre fonctionnement.11 millions d’habitants et plus de 200.000 points de vente et de service : les données pointues à exploiter Segmentation des consommateurs, données comportementales, potentiels de marchés, données de localisation, temps de trajet, … la liste des données à exploiter pour mener à bien vos objectifs est longue. Avec plus de 30 ans d’expérience, SIRIUS Insight dispose des données de marché les plus pointues et vous aurez l’opportunité de les utiliser. C’est vous qui choisirez les données, outils et méthodes appropriés en vue de l’objectif recherché.
Vos missions chez SIRIUS Insight seront particulièrement variées et vous pourrez compter sur une équipe d’experts pour vous soutenir.

Vous développez, maintenez et sécurisez les données géomarketing de SIRIUS Insight.
Vous modélisez de nouvelles données de consommation et vous êtres responsable de la mise à jour de nos différentes données.
Vous êtes la personne de référence pour le maintien et l’évolution de notre segmentation des consommateurs.
Vous pilotez et participez activement à l’amélioration et le déploiement de nos outils.
Vous participerez également à différents projets clients afin de mettre en place des modèles analytiques précis.

Il/elle n’a pas peur de prendre des initiatives, reste informé.e de nouvelles approches et est en mesure de suggérer des pistes d’amélioration internes tant sur le plan technologique, méthodolgique qu’analytique.

The vente-privee group has consolidated its various European brands, together made up of 6000 employees, under one unified conglomerate: Veepee. This coalescence marks a new chapter in its European history.
  


 With Privalia, vente-exclusive, Designer & Friends, Zlotewyprzedaze, Eboutic and vente-privee, Veepee achieved a 3.7 billion Euro turnover as of 2018. Present in 14 countries now, Veepee is taking a leading role in the European digital commerce landscape.
  


 Our 6000 employees have chosen a job at Veepee to spice up their daily lives! Our teams implement new technologies to fuel our strategies, offering our customers the best possible experience.
  


 Are you eager to learn? Veepee offers you a variety of trades to develop your career, enabling you to renew your skills constantly. Tech, logistics, sales, marketing, sales production: join us on an exciting, digital-centered journey.
  


 About the role :

 Your job

 Your team 

Accenture Applied Intelligence covers the range of Data and AI skills, from Strategy, Data Science, Data Architecture, AI Engineering and Visual Insights. With 20K+ people around the globe, strong local practices and recognized as a leader by industry analysts, we collaborate with a powerful global alliance, innovation and delivery network to help clients deploy and scale AI within any market and industry.



Your background 


Completed Master preferably in engineering or any other quantitative field with a strong focus on ML/AI, advanced analytics, data science, operations research.
 A minimum of 2 years of experience in applying data & analytics techniques to manufacturing process & supply chain across one of the following industry: Life Science, Chemicals, Raw Materials Transformation, Goods manufacturing in environments related to operations
 Proficient understanding of a few of the fundamental concepts related to plant data and information systems such as: automation systems, MES/DCS, machine sensorization, preventive or predictive maintenance strategies, line scheduling, OEE or equivalent metrics, quality processes, yield optimization, etc.

 Passion for Innovation, collaboration with eco-system and create value for our clients
 Aptitude to interact with functional or business stakeholders who are not familiar with ML Engineering considerations.

 Our offer

 Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Janssen Research & Development (“JRD”), a Johnson & Johnson company, is recruiting for a Principal Scientist, Data Science. The primary location for this position is flexible – either; Titusville, NJ; Raritan, NJ; Spring House, PA; Cambridge, MA; New York City, NY; San Diego, CA; South San Francisco, CA; Beerse, Belgium; remote may also be considered with up to 10% travel.
Janssen develops treatments that improve the health of people worldwide. Research and development areas encompass oncology, cardiovascular and metabolic disorders, immunology, pulmonary hypertension, neuroscience, and infectious disease. Our goal is to help people live longer, healthier lives. We have produced and marketed many first-in-class prescription medications and are poised to serve the broad needs of the healthcare market – from patients to practitioners and from clinics to hospitals. To learn more about Janssen, one of the Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, visit https://www.janssen.com/us/.
The R&D Data Science Analytics & Insights team within Janssen develops innovative solutions leveraging a variety of different data sources across multiple disease areas. Successful candidate will develop cutting-edge methodologies to drive critical global development decisions and positively impact the way we conduct trials for patients. We are looking for outstanding scientists whose responsibilities include: 

Independently partner with the Janssen R&D Data Science Portfolio Management and Therapeutic Area teams to execute on the priorities, building a roadmap to deliver the projects from conceptualizing the research questions, data feasibility, study design and analysis to final presentation to senior cross-functional leaders and publication 
Will be able to advice and contribute to projects outside of his responsibilities and collaborate with research scientists in diverse projects
Deliver scalable machine learning solutions and insights to impact functions and therapeutic areas within R&D and participate in cross-functional collaborations with internal scientific and data science teams, and external companies
Lead and contribute to machine learning and artificial intelligence solutions to accelerate and enable global development
Lead and contribute to patient modeling and enrollment simulations to have accurate projections for completion of enrollment
Leverage emerging scientific and technological developments to generate new research ideas, solutions and initiatives using real-world data (electronic health records, insurance claims, others) 
Provide thought leadership for developing, adapting, and delivering real-world data methodologies to identify healthcare practitioners or organizations with patients matching, diversity and inclusion requirements, and hotspots mapping
Be a hands-on technical leader among the Data Science team, helping institute best practices while crafting a data-driven culture, developing, and mentoring more junior members of the team while advocating for skill development, working alongside a robust team of data scientists, bringing fresh perspectives and scientific rigor across Data Science projects and therapeutic areas
Clearly articulate highly technical methods and results to diverse audiences and partners to drive decision-making
Participate in cross-functional collaborations with external companies and internal scientific and data science teams


Qualifications
 Required qualifications:

A Ph.D. degree, or master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., artificial intelligence, computer science, statistics, biostatistics, health economics, biomedical informatics, epidemiology, applied mathematics, or similar)
Relevant experience (4+ years for Ph.D., 6+ years for a master’s) within a start-up, technology, or healthcare industry
Extensive experience with machine learning, deep learning, statistical modeling, causal inference methods, multivariate regression and classification, and natural language processing 
Proven project leadership in complicated context, able to influence and engage the strategic and technical partners in a matrix organization
Proven track record of consistently delivering on high impact data science projects 
Demonstrated experience in leading cross-functional teams and managing external vendors
Experience leading, coaching, growing and motivating data science experts in a direct-reporting or matrixed-reporting manner
Ability to work in an agile matrix environment
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills
Expert proficiency in Python or R, and SQL

Preferred qualifications:

Hands-on technical data analysis and machine learning modeling experience (across roles)
Experience delivering on Data Science projects using predictive technologies, forecasting, natural language processing, artificial intelligence, or machine learning
Familiarity with drug discovery and the clinical development process and/ or expertise in one or more therapeutic areas
Demonstrated experience in one of the following domains: real-world data (EHR, insurance claims, registry data), building patient cohorts, enrollment modeling, or clinical trial analytics
Experience working closely with healthcare professionals
Ability to effectively communicate technical work to a wide audience

The team 
Data Product and Services is one of the departments of the Group Strategy and Product Expansion division (GSPE). The GSPE division forms one of the key activities under the leadership of Euroclear’s Chief Business Officer. The division leads Euroclear’s evolution through the steering of its strategic planning, business development, and corporate development. 
The Data Product and Services department is led by Euroclear’s Chief Data Officer and covers the key activities of a modern company data office: data governance, metadata management, change and data communities management, data quality, data business development (data monetisation), client and transaction data analytics. 
Developing and maintaining the broadest and best overview of Euroclear’s client and transaction data assets in order to actively lead and support value creation for clients and senior management by leveraging data of value to customers and market participants. 
Monetising Euroclear’s data through the development of data products (e.g. data feeds to clients through APIs) and data services (e.g. Advanced analytics / AI solutions) and their sales, both to Euroclear participants and new clients. 
Developing and implementing tools to (better) manage data, supporting staff onboarding and training (e.g. on data intelligence solutions like Collibra, (big) data and analytics platforms like Hadoop, … 
Providing community management, change and communication to teams across Euroclear, engaging with senior management to support the Data Owners, Data Stewards and Custodians, Data Scientists and Engineers, Report Owners, API Owners, etc. 
Defining new ways of working with regards to data to increase the added value (e.g. through the development of new/better products and services), operational efficiency and regulatory compliance. Defining and maintaining group data roles (e.g. Data Steward, Data Owner), their responsibilities, governance bodies, etc. 
Your role 
We are hiring a Data Analyst, reporting into the Head of Client and Transaction Data Analytics, a new team set up in July 2022. 
Developing and maintaining business knowledge of Euroclear’s data with the highest value to customers, participants, and stakeholders part of Euroclear’s ecosystem. Developing and maintaining the knowledge of the list of these data, their master sources, their key present usages, their owners and their quality. 
Engaging proactively with Commercial, GSPE and ESG divisions on important data topics related to Euroclear client and transactional data. Being able to query, extract and combine any client and transaction data, as well as being able to aggregate, segment and visualize the data with the appropriate (big) data platforms and tools. 
Supporting the design, testing, development of “Minimum Viable Products” or “Proofs of Concept” of new (or upgrades of existing) data products and services towards Euroclear clients. Gathering required data, its analysis and transformations; building mock-ups and first versions for client or internal demo or proofs of value. (Automation and transfer into production of the developments being handled by Euroclear IT teams.) 
Our commitment 
We offer you a unique opportunity to contribute to Euroclear’s developments in the promising area of data, leveraging the most modern and efficient methods and tools, and benefiting from a high visibility towards senior management and external stakeholders. 
We offer an entrepreneurial mindset in a young team within Euroclear, composed of experienced Euroclear staff as well as experts joining from outside Euroclear, all demonstrating a high level of expertise and professionalism in their respective fields of data management (e.g., data monetisation, metadata management, data governance, data quality, change and community management). 
We offer the opportunity to work on one of the pillars of the Euroclear strategy, offering growth opportunities in a challenging environment with demanding expectations from all levels of the company (up to the senior management and Board levels). 
Your profile 
You have a passion for data and its added value for Euroclear clients and teams/management within Euroclear. In particular you have a passion to build and expand knowledge of Euroclear’s data. 
You are familiar with modern data analytics tools and platforms. 
You have a strong bias towards practical solutions and apply a pragmatic approach to deliver results in a steady pace. 
You are a strong problem solver, able to work independently whilst being a team player. You demonstrate strong analytical skills (e.g. breaking up & structuring complex problems into manageable pieces). 
You are familiar with or show eagerness to learn about data quality management, meta-data management, Lineage/Traceability, (data) modelling, data base development and management, data engineering and/or data science. 

Advanced knowledge of SQL, able to write and understand complex queries 
Programming: Python, (Py)Spark, Visual Studio in combination with Hue editor and Jupyter Notebook => available in the Data Analytics Lab in Euroclear 
Eagerness to continuously develop your data analytics skills through self-learning (Datacamp, EDX) 
Knowledge of Power BI as developer is an asset

The role

 Is your day successful when you could apply your knowledge in data science to deliver data-driven insights to the business? Do you get a thrill from seeing your algorithms being deployed in our products and processes?

 The Compressor Technique Service division will continue to grow, partially thanks to the business insights our team deliver and the algorithms we develop to make our products and processes smarter. Our data analysts in each department are close to the daily need for data analysis and solutions. They rely however on you as data scientist for the larger projects which require a statistical and/or data modelling approach. Once the algorithms are developed and deployed, our data analysts act as single point of contact and take over operational responsibility, while you remain owner of the algorithm design. In our collaboration with universities, you will ensure that the algorithms developed in a PhD are useful and can be further developed in our team to be eventually deployed.

 Are you interested to stay up to date on the latest data modelling and data analysis methodologies, tools and best practices? Do you like to share what you have learnt with the bigger data analyst community? You will take a leading role in increasing the competence and capability of our group of data analysts and data scientists to successfully deliver data driven insights and models. You will organize trainings, host community best practice sessions, hang-outs to learn the broader business context, workshops to conclude on standards and best practices, etc. You will mentor junior data analysts and data scientists setting their first steps on the analytical ladder. We expect you to start this position with a sound knowledge of data modelling techniques and sufficient experience to have learnt how to use this theory in real research projects. Some basic understanding of project management will also help to manage your research projects well. The team is currently using a combination of SAS and R/Python flows in databricks.

 Are you genuinely interested in our business of selling and performing service on compressed air installations worldwide? Being involved in projects across different departments, over time you will learn our business in and out. And in that position, it will be your role to further challenge and innovate our business in the direction of data driven processes and products. You will organize ideation sessions with business departments, and you will be involved in strategy meetings to help the departments to develop the data driven aspect of their business. It would be ideal if you already have experience in leading these initiatives.
 Is it the cherry on the cake when you can present the conclusion of your research to the internal customer and to higher management? You will get the opportunity to share your progress during the project as well as the conclusion to our divisional management. You will find there an educated audience, interested in the outcome of your research, but also willing to think along on further improvements.

 Do you enjoy diversity? You will have regular contact with people all over the world, to improve the products they sell and the operations they run. You will become part of a diverse and international team.

 What we expect of you?

 To accomplish this role, a master’s degree in Engineering (Computer science, Big Data Analytics, Artificial Intelligence) or in Statistics, problem solving skills, professional experience in data analytics and an affinity to an industrial B2B market will help you. High self-motivation, an innovative mindset and accountability are key for success.

 Then we would like to get to know you better and to see if you click, not only with our Data scientist vacancy, but also with our own company values.

 Are we a good fit?

 Atlas Copco is a Swedish company, the Swedish human culture continues to flow through the veins of our 38,000 employees in more than 90 countries. It has a strong family vibe with a warm respect for each individual and we strive for strong diversity. We also invest heavily in our customers, in the environment, ... but first and foremost in our own people. In this way, we provide a stimulating environment in which you can develop your competencies on a daily basis. In addition, our family-friendly working atmosphere gives you the flexibility to find an optimal work life balance. Would you like to get to know us? Hope to see you soon!

 We add value wherever we do business

We have a wide range of positions so whatever your interests or area of expertise, we offer interesting challenges and the opportunity to grow.
