 Does this sound like a challenge for you? Then don't hesitate to apply and join our team!

Beschrijving van de onderneming 

L'Observatoire royal de Belgique (ORB) est un institut scientifique fédéral belge. Ses recherches et services se concentrent sur la Terre (géodésie spatiale, sismologie, gravimétrie, temps et rotation terrestre), le Soleil, les planètes et les étoiles. 
Pour plus d'informations sur l'institut et ses activités, visitez notre site web http://www.orb.be. 

Functiebeschrijving 

L'ORB recherche un scientifique (h/f/x) motivé ayant une formation en géophysique, en géodésie et/ou en science des données. 
Ce poste requiert un esprit créatif, de la modélisation et de la programmation ainsi que l'utilisation de techniques Machine Learning pour analyser diverses sources de données afin de développer un système automatique de contrôle de la qualité des données GNSS. 
Les méthodes développées seront appliquées aux données provenant de plus de 1000 stations GNSS du réseau EPOS (European Plate Observing System) et contribueront à faciliter l'interprétation des changements de position calculés. 
Le candidat retenu soutiendra également l'équipe GNSS de l'ORB dans ses activités opérationnelles. 
Il/elle préparera des rapports scientifiques, rédigera des publications scientifiques et présentera les résultats de ses recherches lors d'ateliers et de conférences nationales et internationales. 
Le poste proposé est un poste à plein temps (niveau de salaire SW1 du personnel scientifique). 

Profielbeschrijving 


Master ou doctorat en informatique, géophysique, mathématiques, physique ou ingénierie. 


Excellentes compétences en programmation scientifique, par exemple, connaissance approfondie des bibliothèques python scientifiques pour l'analyse et la visualisation des données. 


Connaissance de la modélisation des données GNSS et/ou techniques Machine Learning sont des atouts importants. 


Niveau avancé en anglais oral et écrit, connaissance du néerlandais et/ou du français est un atout. 


Forte motivation, esprit d'initiative, curiosité scientifique et aptitude au travail en équipe. 


Voordelen van de betrekking 


Contrat d'un an à temps plein, avec possibilité de prolongation (sur évaluation positive) 


Environnement de travail dynamique, en partenariat avec d'autres équipes GNSS internationales 


Un salaire conforme aux réglementations fédérales pour la carrière scientifique, en tenant compte de l'expérience scientifique antérieure pertinente. 


Possibilité d'acquérir une prime pour le bilinguisme (néerlandais/français) 


Remboursement des frais de déplacement en cas d'utilisation des transports publics ou du vélo 


Accès aux avantages prévus pour les employés des institutions scientifiques fédérales (par exemple, assurance hospitalisation collective, possibilité de suivre des formations, garde d'enfants en juillet/août). 


Horaire de travail flexible et possibilité de travailler partiellement à domicile 


Travailler dans un environnement vert et agréable 


Extra informatie 
 Werkplek Ukkel, België 
  Soort overeenkomst : ABD 
  Andere informatie : 
 Envoyez votre CV (incluant une liste de publications) avec une lettre de motivation et les coordonnées de deux références à Carine Bruyninx (C.Bruyninx@oma.be). 
Date limite de dépôt des candidatures: 20 fév. 2022.

Word jij onze nieuwe Data & Conversion Analyst?
 Met 55 winkels in Vlaanderen, een webshop en een hoofdkantoor in Sint-Niklaas speelt e5 (www.e5.be) een hoofdrol in de Belgische moderetail.e5 staat voor comfy, stijlvolle en trendy kleren die iedereen laten stralen, ongeacht leeftijd, figuur of stijl.
 Hou je van aanpakken en kun je je helemaal vinden in de filosofie en waarden van ons Belgisch familiebedrijf? Ben jij op zoek naar een job waar je jouw stempel om kan drukken? Lees dan zeker verder!
 Functie
 Data & Conversion Analyst @ e5, what is it?

 Als Data & Conversion Analyst ben jij binnen het e-commerce team de data goeroe die het team en de organisatie voorziet van de juiste data en inzichten om samen de klantreis te optimaliseren en door middel van conversie optimalisatie de ambitieuze online sales doelstellingen te behalen. Dit doe je door:

Het initiëren, vormgeven en voorbereiden van onderzoeken en A/B testings. Je zoekt steeds naar oplossingen met de hoogste commerciële impact.
Het verzamelen, ordenen en correct meten van relevante data alsook de inrichting te verzorgen van alle website- en campagneverkeer hierrond.
Samen te werken met de CRM analyst en Business Intelligence (BI) afdeling om de verschillende datastromen te combineren zodat de omni-channel klantervaring kan worden vorm gevormd en verbeterd.
Jouw inzichten te vertalen naar concrete optimalisaties of advies richting jouw e-commerce en marketingcollega’s, zodat zij direct aan de slag kunnen om verbeteringen door te voeren.
De ontwikkeling van datamodellen te realiseren en de beschikbare data en customer journeys te analyseren alsook het rapporteren ervan aan het bredere marketing team en het management.

Profiel
 Are you the one?

Je beschikt over een bachelor of masterdiploma in een economische of wiskundige richting en/of hebt 3 jaar relevante werkervaring op het gebied van conversieoptimalisatie en web analytics (Google en/of Adobe) binnen een commerciële of retail organisatie.
Je hebt niet alleen een passie voor cijfers, maar ook mode draag je mee in het hart.
Sterke interesse in data en technologie is een echte must. Je weet hoe tools te implementeren en hebt ruime ervaring met analysetools (Google Analytics, Google Tag manager, Google Optimize, Google Data studio, Hotjar, A/B testing tools, etc.)
Door jouw kennis en know how heb je een commerciële mindset ontwikkeld. Je haalt energie uit het omzetten van ideeën en kansen naar commercieel resultaat.
Met jouw manier van commniceren weet je perfect hoe je anderen kan inspireren en kennis kan overbrengen.
Jouw leergierig kenmerkt je waardoor je zelf pro-actief op zoek gaat naar potentiële verbeteringen.
Je bent positief ingesteld, vlot in de omgang en hebt een ‘can do’ mentaliteit.
Als teamspeler met een goede dosis humor pas jij perfect binnen het e-commerce team.
Je hebt kennis van HTML, CSS & Javascript.

Aanbod
 What's in it for you ?

Een uitdagende functie waarbij je samen met jouw collega’s je schouders zet onder een Belgisch modebedrijf dat wordt gekenmerkt door zijn familiale werksfeer.
De kans om mee te bouwen aan een boeiend en dynamisch verhaal, waar ondernemerschap centraal staat.
Alle ruimte voor inbreng en creativiteit. Je kan zichtbare meerwaarde brengen.
Je komt in een energetisch en enthousiast team terecht, dat gedreven wordt door passie voor mode en retail met een vleugje humor.
Bij e5 heerst een aangename en ongedwongen werksfeer waar iedereen zichzelf mag en kan zijn.
Je hebt recht op een personeelskorting die zowel geldig is in de e5-winkels als onze webshop via www.e5.be .
Een aantrekkelijk salaris met extralegale voordelen en een interessante vakantieregeling. Daarnaast krijg je de kans om in te stappen in de e5 hospitalisatieverzekering.

Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze vacature? Overtuig ons met jouw cv en motivatiebrief via jobs@e5.be .

Description du poste
Vous travaillez dans le département Corporate Security Office qui est responsable de la détermination de la stratégie sûreté de la STIB. En tant que Data Analyst & Security Observatory Coordinator, vous pilotez et gérez l’Observatoire Sûreté, organe transversal, multidisciplinaire et indépendant, dont la mission est d'améliorer la connaissance des problématiques sûreté auxquelles la STIB est (ou pourrait être) confrontée, afin d'alimenter la stratégie sûreté de l'entreprise et de contribuer à la stratégie tactique et opérationnelle des différentes équipes. Ainsi vous participez à la résolution de la problématique de sécurisation et vous rendez le travail des collaborateurs STIB et l’expérience voyageur de milliers de voyageurs plus agréables et plus sûres.
Plus en détail :

Vous développez et pilotez l’Observatoire Sûreté. Vous définissez les thématiques et les priorités. 
Vous mettez en place et entretenez des partenariats internes et externes (Universités, Police, Bruxelles Prévention Sécurité, communes, associations, …). 
Vous mettez en place un système de collecte et de reporting de données liées à la Sûreté. 
Vous réalisez l’analyse stratégique des données relatives à la Sûreté. 
Vous identifiez et proposez des mesures préventives/correctives. Vous formulez des recommandations stratégiques en collaboration avec les acteurs internes. Vous rédigez les rapports d’analyse et assurez les présentations des résultats en interne et en externe. 
Vous effectuez une veille technologique et méthodologique (lecture, benchmarking, …). 
Vous contribuez au Plan Sûreté du Corporate Security Office en objectivant les problématiques sûreté et en mettant à jour le diagnostic Sûreté. 

Profil recherché

Vous avez un master en criminologie et/ou un master à orientation quantitative ou équivalent par expérience. 
Vous disposez idéalement d’une expérience en tant que data analyst et vous avez une bonne connaissance en collecte, reporting et analyse de données. 
Vous disposez idéalement d’une expérience dans le domaine de la Sûreté 
Vous connaissez le territoire bruxellois et ses enjeux sécuritaires. Vous disposez d’une affinité avec l’analyse spatiale. 
Vous maitrisez Excel et vous avez une affinité pour les autres outils informatiques de traitement de données quantitatives, notamment Power BI. 
Vous êtes francophone ou néerlandophone et vous avez une bonne connaissance de la deuxième langue et de l’anglais (connaissance passive au minimum). Vous avez d'excellentes compétences rédactionnelles. 
Vos qualités personnelles : autonomie, prise de décision, facilité à constituer un réseau, excellente communication orale et écrite, orienté.e résultats, capacité d’apprentissage, capacité à s’adapter à un environnement changeant, pro activité.

Notre offre

Un job varié et passionnant dans une ambiance dynamique et conviviale. 
Une offre de formations internes et externes développée sur mesure pour les collaborateurs. 
Un salaire en rapport avec vos responsabilités et de réelles possibilités d’évolution de carrière. 
Des avantages extra-légaux compétitifs : chèques-repas, assurance groupe et hospitalisation (octroyée après 1 an de service), 35 jours de congé payés par an, abonnement gratuit sur les réseaux STIB, TEC et De Lijn (également pour les conjoint et enfants), 70% de réduction sur l’abonnement de train domicile-travail, etc.

Entreprise
Avec plus de 10.000 collaborateurs, la Société des Transports Intercommunaux de Bruxelles (STIB), acteur clé de la mobilité à Bruxelles, y est également un des plus grands employeurs.  La modernisation du métro, l'élargissement du réseau tram et la construction de nouveaux dépôts ne sont que quelques exemples des projets passionnants pour lesquels la STIB recherche des collaborateurs enthousiastes.  Une carrière variée, une formation continue, des projets uniques et passionnants, une stabilité d’emploi et une diversité à tout niveau enrichissante, voilà ce que peut offrir la STIB à toute personne assez curieuse pour venir découvrir ses 300 métiers uniques.

Collect&Go est le service de courses en ligne de Colruyt Group. Vous dégagez des perspectives de qualité pour le management sur la base des données et informations disponibles. Un poste passionnant dans un secteur dynamique : parfait pour un débutant !
 Chez Collect&Go aussi, les courses en ligne sont en plein essor. En tant que data & information quality analyst, vous travaillerez sur de nombreux projets captivants. Votre fonction consiste à dégager des informations claires des données et rapports ainsi qu’à surveiller la qualité du flux d’informations. Vous exercez une réelle influence.
 Concrètement, vos tâches sont les suivantes :

 Vous établissez des analyses et rapports fiables et efficaces afin de permettre à Collect&Go de prendre des décisions fondées. Vous répondez à des questions ponctuelles ou liées à un projet en particulier. Vous vous appuyez sur votre esprit critique pour contribuer à préciser les besoins et objectifs de Collect&Go. Vous examinez les scénarios, définissez des indicateurs et établissez des analyses ainsi que des rapports. 
Vous interprétez les analyses et formulez vos conseils à Collect&Go. Vous vous basez sur des données pour dégager des perspectives de soutien stratégique à l’aide de techniques statistiques. Vous expliquez clairement vos chiffres, interprétations et perspectives, de sorte que l’équipe de management comprenne les conséquences des analyses et puisse en tirer parti.
 Vous décelez les besoins, les facteurs sous-jacents ainsi que les tendances afin de détecter plus rapidement les possibilités et les risques. Vous construisez des relations durables avec les différentes parties prenantes et mettez en évidence les besoins actuels et futurs. 
Vous contribuez à faire gagner les rapports et analyses en maturité au sein de Colruyt Group : vous veillez à la qualité de l’information et êtes responsable de la politique en matière de gestion de l’information.

 Vous travaillez main dans la main avec des collègues experts (analyste opérationnel, responsables reporting, analystes) et, bien entendu, avec de nombreux services au sein même de Collect&Go. Ce poste vous offre également la possibilité de vous créer un large réseau de contacts au sein de Colruyt Group et d’approfondir chaque jour vos connaissances. Vous travaillez avec des collègues passionnés dans un environnement de travail stimulant.
 Vous travaillez à Hal, mais avez la possibilité de faire un ou deux jour(s) de télétravail par semaine.



 Profil


 Connaissances et expérience – Vous êtes titulaire d’un master dans le domaine de l’intelligence artificielle et êtes capable d’utiliser différents outils statistiques tels que Python, SQL, Webi… Les juniors et débutants sont aussi les bienvenus. L’essentiel est votre motivation à exploiter vos talents dans un contexte de reporting. 
Ouverture d’esprit et intérêt pour l’innovation – Vous travaillez dans un environnement dynamique. Vous êtes flexible, prenez des initiatives et saisissez les occasions lorsqu’elles se présentent. 
Esprit d’analyse et compétences communicationnelles – Vous parvenez à dégager des observations sur la base des données et à les communiquer clairement.
 Autonomie – Vous bénéficiez des conseils de vos collègues, mais êtes également capable de travailler en toute autonomie. Vous prenez les choses en main et apprenez rapidement.
 Connaissances linguistiques – En tant que francophone, vous parlez couramment le néerlandais, ce qui vous permet de collaborer efficacement avec vos collègues, vos partenaires et les parties prenantes 




Nous vous offrons


 Influence et responsabilités – Vos observations et conseils contribuent à définir la stratégie de l’entreprise.
 Liberté d’initiative – Vous avez la liberté de prendre des initiatives et de définir en partie le contenu de votre fonction ainsi que vos responsabilités.
 Apprentissage et développement continus – Une entreprise grandit à mesure que ses collaborateurs se développent. Voilà pourquoi Colruyt Group investit dans des formations internes et externes pour le développement professionnel et personnel de tous ses collaborateurs.
 Rémunération attrayante – Votre salaire s’accompagne de divers avantages extralégaux, comme des chèques-repas et une participation aux bénéfices.

Junior Data Analyst – Graduate Program 
Our Company 
Cognizant is one of the world's leading services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 195 on the fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. 
With 285,800 employees worldwide, Cognizant is one of the top performing and fastest growing companies in the world. Cognizant Benelux has offices in Amsterdam, Eindhoven and Brussels. We provide consulting, engineering, technology and outsourcing solutions and services with combined onshore and offshore teams. 
We are hiring graduates to join our international colleagues within Business Consulting, Technology or Domain teams who provide services to our clients across industries. Prior to your client engagement, you will attend an Induction Training abroad. After this you will join our 18 months graduate program, which will focus on personal development and technical training. We will ensure you get all the support to kickstart your career. 
What you will do 
As data analyst / analytics consultant you will apply your analytical, coding and visualization skills every single day. Depending on your expertise, you can: 

Extract, wrangle and analyze data to find patterns and translate them to actionable insights 
Make fact-driven conclusions to help the business prioritize what matters most
Create reporting to give business ongoing insight into reality
Assess data quality and provide guidance to improve the data

Most of the time you will be working on-site with customers in Belgium.


Your profile 
o Master in Economics, Engineering, Computer Science or any related field 
o A curious data enthusiast continuously looking to explain the world around you
o A natural-born problem solver who takes initiative and is eager to learn 
o A good mix of analytical knowledge, programming skills and business focus 
o Strong data wrangling skills: extract, transform and analyze data 
o Knowledge of an analytical tool such as SAS, SPSS, R, Python, Matlab or equivalent 
o Familiarity with relational databases and SQL 
o Nil or maximum 1-year work experience 
o Fluent in Dutch and/or French and English 
o You must be authorized and eligible to work freely in the EU 

Employee Status : Full Time Employee
 Shift : Day Job
 Travel : No
 Job Posting : Jul 06 2022


 About Cognizant
 Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

job_title: Data Analyst pour le service Fédéral d'Audit Interne (FAI) (...
job_summary:
Let’s talk about the job :
 Travaillez-vous depuis plusieurs années en tant qu'agent statutaire au sein du secteur fédéral ? Êtes-vous prêt à donner une nouvelle orientation à votre carrière ? Êtes-vous motivé à partager votre expertise et à aider à construire l'avenir du secteur fédéral ? Alors vous êtes la personne que nous, le service Fédéral d'Audit Interne, recherchons !
 Si vous êtes désireux de mieux connaître les différentes organisations qui composent le paysage fédéral ou de soutenir le management dans l'amélioration de ses opérations, au FAI nous sommes en recherche de motivation, d’envie d'apprendre et d'enthousiasme.
 Votre mission ? En support aux missions d'audit, vous identifiez les données pertinentes présentes dans les différentes bases de données des SPF pour ensuite les exploiter, effectuer toutes les analyses utiles et présentez les résultats au management.

Data Scientist met passie voor location intelligence? Let’s talk! Word jij warm van big data? Kan location- of spatial intelligence je wel bekoren? Dan moeten we snel praten, want Locus is op zoek naar een Data Scientist Location Intelligence! 






Jouw verantwoordelijkheden


Dit doe jij als Data Scientist Location Intelligence
Ter uitbreiding van ons team zoeken we een Data Scientist die graag zijn of haar tanden zet in complexe problemen. Je takenpakket bewijst dat niet alleen de titel (want zeg nu zelf … ) maar ook de inhoud van je job cool is:

Je vertaalt businessnoden naar datavereisten, en je kan daar helder over communiceren.
 Je voorspelt de toekomst op basis van lessen uit het verleden. Want de data heeft altijd het laatste woord.
 Je schat het potentieel van use cases in door een eerste exploratieve screening. Daarbij zet je zowel een sceptische als opportunistische bril op.
 Je zoekt je weg in uiteenlopende databronnen, ruimt data op waar nodig, destilleert informatie uit databronnen door middel van AI, en brengt alles samen voor verdere modellering.
 Je ontwikkelt predictieve modellen als bouwsteen voor concrete toepassingen. Daarbij maak je gebruik van je statistische kennis en machine learning methoden.

“Elk nieuw idee verdient de nodige aandacht”








Daarom hebben we je nodig


Daarom ben jij onze Data Scientist bij uitstek Omdat jij veel in je mars hebt. We zoeken een Data Scientist die zijn of haar vak door en door kent, maar ook past binnen onze open en vernieuwende cultuur:

Je hebt een masterdiploma in IT, engineering, toegepaste wetenschappen of je bent gelijkwaardig door ervaring.
 Als kameleon spreek je de taal van zowel bedrijfs- en IT experten als je mede Data Scientists. Jij communiceert vlot met verschillende profielen.
 Je bent vertrouwd met feature engineering, model fitting en modelevaluatie.
 Zelfstandig prototypes uitwerken en hun waarde aantonen? Jij kan dat als geen ander. Jouw sterke statistische kennis en ervaring met machine learning algoritmes helpen je hierbij.
 Je hebt hands-on ervaring met SQL, R en/of Python. Zo leg je telkens nieuwe inzichten bloot.
 Je hebt al gewerkt met data science libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Torch en Keras) en Big Data technologieën (zoals Hadoop of Spark).
 Je denkt steeds out of the box, tenzij je classifiers bouwt.
 Nieuwe ontwikkelingen volg je op de voet, en je deelt ze met je collega’s. Jij kent alle trends!


Je hebt een streepje voor op andere kandidaten als je kennis of ervaring hebt met:
        
 Big data platformen zoals Azure, Google Cloud Platform of AWS


 Data modellering en ETL tools


 De toepassing van machine learning algoritmes in een geo context


 BI tools, zoals Qlik, PowerBi of Cognos.










Dit krijg je van ons
Voor wat, hoort wat! Daarom bieden we je:

Groeimogelijkheden. Een training volgen via onze Geo Academy of liever een externe opleiding? 


Intrapreneurship. Of eenvoudigweg: de kans om mee te bouwen aan ons bedrijf. Geo Solutions blaakt van ambitie!
 Ontwikkel- en doorgroeimogelijkheden. We hebben oog voor jouw passies en talenten en geven je carrière graag een extra push.
 Work hard, play hard. Je krijgt enerzijds een gezonde dosis uitdagingen, en anderzijds de nodige portie fun op het werk. En dat met toffe collega’s. Never a dull moment.
 En herbronnen kan je perfect tijdens je 28 vakantiedagen!
 State of the art technologieën. Je ontwikkelt ze niet alleen, je werkt er ook mee. Zodat je steeds het beste van jezelf kunt geven.
 Een marktconform salarispakket: een brutoloon dat wordt aangevuld met een bedrijfswagen en tankkaart, hospitalisatieverzekering, een pensioenspaarplan en een maaltijdvergoeding. Meer daarover vind je in je fulltime, vast contract van onbepaalde duur.









Over Geo Solutions


Als Belgisch bedrijf focust Geo Solutions zich om de mogelijkheden van locatie te laten schitteren bij onze klanten. Onze IT services richten zich op het design en de ontwikkeling van GEO-ICT oplossingen op maat. Elk van onze oplossingen en strategieën zijn gebaseerd op Geographic Information Systems (GIS) en Information & Communication Technologies (ICT).
Verder verzorgen we analyses die de strategie en het operationele beslissingsproces van onze klanten ondersteunen en vergemakkelijken. Onze innovatieve en flexibele dienstverlening is vooral gericht op de overheid, nutsbedrijven en de industrie.
Waar je ons terugvindt? Wel, ons hoofdkantoor is gelegen in Edegem, maar we bieden ook flexplaatsen aan in onze hubs in Gent, Leuven en Namen.





Kan je niet wachten om ons team te vervoegen?
Stuur je cv en een korte motivatie naar kristel.dewit@geosolutions.be

Company Description
  Sia Partners is a specialist Management Consulting firm in 1999 and has grown into a global firm with approximately 2200 employees and annual revenue exceeding $400m. Our culture is strongly orientated towards high-quality expertise and delivering excellent results and outcomes for our clients, which include a wide range of multinational companies. Our global presence and our expertise in more than 30 sectors and services allows us to accompany clients worldwide. Using innovative technologies such as our own in-house apps, social networks, and digital tools, we provide a truly integrated global service.
 Through Consulting for Good, we put our expertise at the service of our clients' climate objectives and make sustainable development a performance lever for our clients. Our portfolio of offerings is cross-sectors, +60 wide consulting offers and generate 15% of revenues.



 Job Description
  As a Senior consultant in Data Science, you will be involved in transformation projects at our clients. You will execute project assignments in modelling and digital transformation (business/IT analysis and partial coding) environments with a good deal of business perspectives:

 Machine learning, AI and statistics: developing predictive models of decision making (supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, econometrics, forecasting, quantitative diagnosis,...)
 Operational research : assistance in the design and implementation of constraint optimization solutions and simulation models
 Big Data : Algorithmic knowledge for large and unstructured data processing

 You will get the opportunity to actively contribute to Sia Partners’ internal activities:

 Development and reinforcement of our offer, by understanding and interpreting data science innovation and challenges
 Business development, by contributing to need definition and participating in our commercial initiatives

 As fast as possible, you will take up team leadership roles and connect with colleagues of all levels.
 Equipped with the entrepreneurial fibre, you are ready to cooperate in a fast growing company.

 In return, you can expect:

 An international company that gives importance to diversity, inclusion, employee well-being and corporate social responsibilities actions.
 A great working atmosphere with friendly and professional colleagues where innovation and entrepreneurship are encouraged
 A personal development plan with a regular follow-up as well training opportunities to develop yourself
 A competitive salary with great advantages, like mobility budget, hospital insurance, performance -related bonus,...




 Qualifications
 

 University Master Civil Engineer (applied mathematics, IT or similar)
 2 to 6 years’ experience as a consultant
 Outstanding team player with great interpersonal and communication skills
 Strong interest in data science and related sectors such as Energy and Finance
 Analytical mind, exploring options and able to synthesize into conclusions
 Dynamic, result oriented, rigorous and committed
 Trilingual: French, Dutch and English
 Prepared to participate in temporary assignments abroad

 Additional Information
  We are unable to provide a work permit for this position

 Sia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Le poste

 Mission

 Le futur collaborateur aura pour première mission de rejoindre une équipe spécialisée en fiabilité au sein d’une grosse usine de métallurgie pour y rédiger les plans de maintenance associés à leurs gros équipements.

Mission
YOUR FUNCTION:
 Within the Digital Connected Company & Innovation we focus on helping our clients unlock the value within data. In order to support our unit, we are looking for Big Data / Analytics/ AI consultants who are able to implement an End-2-End data platform.
 A data platform designed and driven by business value, is able to ingest data in a proper way, can manage the data quality, can store data securely and offers possibilities for integration with client-specific platforms.
 As a Data & Analytics Consultant you have experience with multiple aspects of data: from (master)data management, over big data, data lakes, data visualization to data science and machine learning. You can use data in both a traditional data context (dashboard and reports), but also use it within the modern era of big data solutions, artificial intelligence and advanced analytics.
 You have experience in one or more of these domains:

You are able to listen to business people, understand their challenge and shape a data solution that brings value.
Set up data platforms and the data management (the data model, integration, authorization), with all the components needed to support the data strategy of the customer (AI capabilities, Visualization, MDM,..)
Build data science or machine learning solutions that will bring business value. Build and optimize the best possible algorithm but also a webservice or application that can be used in an operational environment
Visualize the data on the best possible way: from a cooperate dashboards, an interactive report to a full self-service environment
Set up processes and governance that will be enabler for a data-driven culture (data stewardship, golden record, data lineage,..)



Profile
YOUR PROFILE

You obtained a master’s degree in applied statistics, computer science, engineering or similar by experience
You are passionate about data and analytics technology and trends
Have at least 3 years’ experience in implementing data solution and analytics
You are fluent in Python or R
Have knowledge about data architecture, data integration, big data, data lakes, data visualization, computer vision, natural language processing, machine learning
You have experience with different data consumption techniques from traditional to more advanced analytics and AI perspective. (Power BI, Tableau, PyTorch, TensorFlow…)
Or you have hands-on experience with data platforms (e.g Azure, AWS, Google, Databricks, Boomi, Collibra, snowflake…) and are not afraid to dive into something you don’t know.
Have at least 1 year experience with Relational database technology
Have at least 1 year experience with NoSQL database technology
You have a good understanding of clustering, predictive modeling techniques and recommender systems
You have a pro-active, can-do mindset
You communicate clearly in Dutch and/or French and English (both written and spoken).

You get bonus points if…

You can present and defend your solutions in front of clients
You are able to organize, facilitate and lead workshops

OUR OFFER:

The opportunity to have a meaningful job where you can make a difference
The chance to continuously evolve as a professional, coupled with a variety of training opportunities
Relevant career opportunities to get you where you want to be, with the IT knowledge you need
Inetum-Realdolmen wants you to find a balance between work and private life by offering flexible hours, satellite offices and home working
32 days of annual leave, because life isn’t all about working
Forget about the miles: we provide you with a company car and a national fuel card
Group insurance and hospitalization insurance, because we care about you
And of course, we also offer a gross salary. One which is optimized from a net perspective for our employees!

Interested? Questions? Recommendations? For more information, contact your recruiter Arbana directly via arbana.preci@inetum-realdolmen.world


Organization
Inetum Realdolmen, a member of the European Inetum Group with approximately 1,950 highly qualified employees, provides strategic, tactical and operational ICT solutions for over 1,000 customers throughout the Benelux. In every cooperation, Realdolmen realizes the potential of people and organizations and strives to keep ICT human. We are driven by technological innovation, but we advance at the speed of your ambition, results-focused and managing fundamental change. Our company motto "New Challenges, New Ideas" reflects this.
 An employer you really want to work for! Not only is Realdolmen a no-nonsense, solid, stable and experienced company with great in-house knowledge and expertise, but we also put our employees first: every individual receives the attention they need. ‘Heart for People' is more than just words for us – it's one of our very core values. Satellite offices, extensive training opportunities, work-life balance, competence reviews and career opportunities: these are no empty promises for us. Our organization attaches great importance to diversity. We guarantee an objective selection process, whereby candidates are tested and selected solely on the basis of their qualities and skills.
 With us it's all about you!





Country
Belgium 


Location
Customers' offices, Inetum-Realdolmen offices or home office 


Contract type
Permanent contract 
Apply

The Role
You'll work closely with business experts to identify improvement projects based on business needs and your background in data science and machine learning.


In this role, you will be based in Belgium but will interact in an international network and collaborate with other data scientists and process expert teams in customer centers/product companies.


You will be part of the Business Process team in the Manufacturing Department but working closely together with IT and all other departments.
You will design, implement, deploy, and maintain Machine Learning solutions and in this role you’ll have the opportunity to work on challenging and rewarding problems, including:


Scaling Machine Learning models globally to factories on all continents


Creating a structured machine learning environment on local GPU workstations or in Azure Cloud.

 Profile & Experience You have a master’s degree or Ph.D. in Computer Science or a similar field. 
 You have mastered the SciPy stack (Python, pandas, numpy, scikit-learn).
You know your way around source control and reproducibility tooling (GIT, Conda, pip, docker).
You have experience with Deep Learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch), and parallel computing libraries (Dask, Numba).
Solid experience with Python/Java and SQL and related frameworks and components is a must.
You are confident in your Software Engineering skills.
You have experience in Deep Learning for Computer Vision.?
Excellent analytical skills to analyze business processes and data, strong problem solving skills.
You are deeply interested in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.
Experience in discrete manufacturing, supply chain, logistics and/or warehousing is a plus .
 Experience with the Azure stack is considered an asset (AzureML, Azure Databricks)
You have an excellent level of English. Dutch language skills are considered as a strong asset.
 For our client global Air compressor manufacturer we are looking for a Data Scientist & Machine Learning Engineer

 Offer
On top of a very attractive package our client offers :

A friendly, familylike atmosphere
Plenty of opportunities to grow and develop
A culture known for respectful interaction, ethical behavior and integrity
Potential to see your ideas realized and to make an impact
New challenges and new things to learn every day

Data Analyst required to join a growing end customer within the manufacturing industry on a freelance basis.
This role will be working closely with the different business functions and the external Power BI support & development partner to turn transactional data into information and knowledge that can be used to efficiently make business decisions. This position will play an essential role in the development and adoption of dashboards that visualize data to drive actionable insights.
Our client operate on a hybrid working model and would like people to commute to the Brussels office a couple of days a week.
The required skills for this position are:

3+ years experience as a Data Analyst
Power BI experience
Passionate about data analytics, business processes, IT systems and risk management

Please note candidates must be based in Belgium and have the rights to work in Belgium.
Please apply now for immediate consideration.

Vous venez de recevoir votre diplôme et vous avez hâte d'acquérir de l'expérience ? Vous êtes à la recherche d'un emploi socialement pertinent ? Alors nous vous cherchons !
 Vous rejoindrez l'équipe de projet BI responsable du développement et de la maintenance d'un data warehouse (DWH). L'objectif est de faciliter la gestion stratégique de la CAPAC en saisissant des données dans notre outil de Business Intelligence et d'effectuer des analyses approfondies ad hoc.
 Votre mission sera de maintenir et implémenter un modèle de données intégré et consolidé pour les données stratégiques de la Capac. Vous serez le garant de la qualité du datawarehouse (DWH) afin d’exploiter les données de manière efficace et viable.

Vous êtes le pont entre le business et l'équipe chargée des données.
Vous traduisez des sujets techniques complexes en langage compréhensible.
Vous êtes responsable de la livraison de produits de données (rapports) pour les utilisateurs finaux au sein de l'organisation.
Vous traduisez les besoins de l'organisation en exigences fonctionnelles/techniques.
Vous documentez votre travail sur la base des bonnes pratiques de l'analyse business.
Vous examinez les données dans les systèmes sources et validez les données dans les rapports.
Vous faites des suggestions et élaborez des maquettes de rapports sur la base des données disponibles.
Après une période d'initiation, vous dirigerez l'équipe technique.
Vous rapportez aux chefs de projets ICT au sein de CAPAC. Vous contribuerez à la transition d'équipes de données réactives à des équipes de données proactives, transformant les données en valeur réelle au sein de l'organisation.

job_title: Senior Clinical Data Scientist- EMEA wide
job_summary:
Description 
Senior Clinical Data Scientist
Come discover what our 25,000+ employees already know: work here matters everywhere. We’re a growing and evolving biopharmaceutical industry leader, which means you’ll have endless opportunities to work with experts around the world and build the career you’ve dreamed of. As a part of the Syneos Health team, you’ll help us deliver results for a rewarding reason – we improve patients’ lives around the world. Because to us, a patient isn’t just a number, they’re our family, friends, and neighbors.

Why Syneos Health


#SyneosHealthLife means we’re committed to our Total Self culture – where everyone can authentically be themselves. Our Total Self culture is what unites us globally, and we know every person’s unique contributions make a difference.
We believe our success is a direct result of the people who are driving it – you! We value your dedication to care for our customers and patients, so we want to focus on taking care of you. That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits program encompassing your total health - physical, mental and financial.
We are continuously building the company we all want to work for and our customers want to work with. Why? Because when we bring together diversity of thoughts, backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives – we’re able to create a place where everyone feels like they belong.


Job responsibilities

Serves as Functional Lead for Clinical Data Science including primary contact for internal liaison between Clinical Data Science and Project Management, Clinical Monitoring, and other functional groups
Acts as central steward of clinical data quality, monitors risks through the holistic review of clinical and operational data, using high level knowledge of the protocol, taking into account the specific therapeutic area aspects of the protocol related to the data collected and aligning with cross functional operational plans to drive comprehensive clinical data quality
Ensures the required data elements and corresponding data quality oversight steps are identified to support the defined study analysis
Works with assigned project teams to communicate, address, troubleshoot and resolve data related questions and recommends potential solutions; escalates issues which potentially impact patient safety and study analysis
Coordinates cross functional data cleaning activities to ensure quality standards and timelines are met for clinical data deliverables Ensures the required data elements and corresponding data quality oversight steps are identified to support the defined project analysis
Drives the development of the clinical data acquisition plan and corresponding data flow diagram with the study team, assess risks associated with protocol design, study set parameters that could impact the credibility and reliability of the trial results, aligns data flow with the study protocol to ensure data collected meets regulatory and study endpoint requirements. 
Drives the development of analytical tools, utilizes analytical platform/dashboard to detect potentially unreliable data that may impact the validity of the trial results Performs analytic reviews as defined in scope of work and data acquisition plan, identifies root cause to systematically resolve data issues
Monitors and communicates project progress to the Sponsor and project team including use of project status reports and tracking tools/metrics
according to contractual agreement and relevant Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), guidelines, and regulations
Review, maintain budget and identify out of scope for Clinical Sciences activities, raise to PM to be implemented in required change order
Plans, manages, and requests Clinical Data Science resources for assigned projects
Coordinates the work of the assigned Clinical Data Science team
Develops and maintains project plans, specifications, and documentation in line with SOP requirements
Maintains documentation on an ongoing basis and ensures that all TMF filing is up to date for necessary files
Participates in, and presents at internal, Sponsor, third-party, and investigator meetings on behalf of clinical data science responsibilities
Prepares input, and participates in proposal bid defense meetings and request for proposals on behalf of clinical data science responsibilities
Plans for and creates necessary documentation to support internal and external audits; participates in such audits on behalf of clinical data sciences responsibilities
Trains and mentors new or junior team members
Maintains proficiency in Clinical Data Science systems and processes through regular training. May attend/represent the company at professional meetings/conferences
Performs other work-related duties as assigned. Minimal travel may be required (up to 25%)

Qualifications 
What we’re looking for

BA/BS in the biological sciences, computer sciences, mathematics, or data sciences and/or related disciplines in the natural science/health care space. MS degree is preferred. In lieu of degree, equivalent relevant work experience
Clinical Data Science experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Experience in Clinical Data Science practices and relational database management software systems
Strong knowledge of the drug development process and its impact on data quality, in particular risk based approach, biometrics procedures, workflows.
Aptitude for understanding analytic modeling methods such as regression, classification and clustering
Strong project management skills and knowledge of project management methodologies
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of Artificial intelligence /machine learning methodologies preferred
Demonstrated staff leadership skills
Knowledge of ALCOA++ data quality principles
Strong experience with protocol interpretation, data collection and data cleaning specification development
Experienced with data analysis/data review and visualization tool sets including but not limited to Python, R, Spotfire, SAS
Knowledge of medical terminology, clinical data, and ICH/GCP regulatory requirements for clinical studies, in particular requirements applicable to Clinical Data Sciences
Proficiency in MS Windows navigation, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and email applications
Effective oral and written communication and presentation skills
Good organizational, planning, and time management skills with the ability to multitask under tight deadlines while providing attention to detail
Ability to be flexible and adapt to change, to work independently, as well as part of a multi-disciplinary team
Ability to make effective decisions and manage multiple priorities in a highly dynamic environment


 
Get to know Syneos Health We are the only full-service biopharmaceutical solutions company in the world. That means we bring together the best clinical and commercial minds to create a better, smarter, faster way to get medicines into the hands of patients who need it most. Learn more about Syneos Health.
Additional Information: Tasks, duties, and responsibilities as listed in this job description are not exhaustive. The Company, at its sole discretion and with no prior notice, may assign other tasks, duties, and job responsibilities. Equivalent experience, skills, and/or education will also be considered so qualifications of incumbents may differ from those listed in the Job Description. The Company, at its sole discretion, will determine what constitutes as equivalent to the qualifications described above. Further, nothing contained herein should be construed to create an employment contract. Occasionally, required skills/experiences for jobs are expressed in brief terms. Any language contained herein is intended to fully comply with all obligations imposed by the legislation of each country in which it operates, including the implementation of the EU Equality Directive, in relation to the recruitment and employment of its employees. The Company is committed to compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, including the provision of reasonable accommodations, when appropriate, to assist employees or applicants to perform the essential functions of the job.

R&D FAB Data Engineer - Analyst 
     

Manufacturing and Warehouse - Leuven | More than two weeks ago


       As a FAB Data Engineer, you provide the FAB teams with the data and reports they need to run the Pilot Lines effectively and efficiently.
     















       What you will do
      

Your primary task will be to understand needs from the FAB related to operational data, and to build reports that allow the different departments of the FAB to steer their operations.
 To that end, you interact with many people throughout the FAB organization to understand what they are trying to accomplish, you suggest corresponding reporting proposals and develop those reports, mostly in Power BI.
 You collaborate closely with the ICT department for the reporting and data projects that need their involvement. You help to prioritize the projects and issues that the FAB needs their help for.
 You align with other departments, mostly R&D, that use the same data and similar reports to ensure efficient and correct use of the data.
 You manage and maintain the growing FAB report portfolio, including fixing issues that don’t require ICT involvement.

 In addition you will

 Occasionally take up the role of Pilot Line Coordinator. During those periods you control the pilot lines and follow up the lots as they move through the Fab. You make sure high priority lots get proper attention and notify the appropriate people when action is required. You collaborate closely with the Engineering teams to minimize the impact of planned and unplanned tool-downtime. In case of problems, you determine action plans and report to the internal customers on a daily basis.This role is taken up about one week out of 7 and includes weekend work.



       What we do for you
      


        We offer you the opportunity to join one of the world’s premier research centers in nanotechnology at its headquarters in Leuven, Belgium. With your talent, passion, and expertise, you’ll become part of a team that makes the impossible possible. Together, we shape the technology that will determine the society of tomorrow.
       

         We are proud of our open, multicultural, and informal working environment with ample possibilities to take initiative and show responsibility. We commit to supporting and guiding you in this process; not only with words but also with tangible actions. Through imec.academy, 'our corporate university', we actively invest in your development to further your technical and personal growth.
       

         We are aware that your valuable contribution makes imec a top player in its field. Your energy and commitment are therefore appreciated by means of a competitive salary with many fringe benefits.
       


       Who you are
      

You have a Master’s degree in Engineering (e.g. in Electronics, Materials science or Chemistry) or Exact Sciences, or equal by experience.
 You have solid experience with data analysis, manipulation, and visualization.
 You have good experience with general purpose programming (e.g., Python).
 Prior experience with relational databases, SQL or Power Query/Power BI is a strong asset.
 Prior experience with self-service BI is a strong asset.
 You have prior experience in the sector of semiconductors or knowledge of semiconductor processing and integration schemes.
 You have strong (technical) communication skills. You are an engaged listener, able to detect the needs of your internal stakeholders.
 You have a pro-active approach and initiate actions when needed. You are not afraid to roll up your sleeves and dive right into the action.
 You can work autonomously, take initiative and are capable to plan and organize your own work.
 Since you will be working in a highly international environment and will be maintaining a good contact with colleagues and co-workers from all over the world, fluency in English is essential.

job_title: Product Owner Data Insights & Analytics (Ieper of Arnhem)
job_summary:
Zorg jij, samen met je team, graag voor de ontwikkeling van Business Intelligence producten? In de functie van P.O. werk jij mee om de data strategie van CCV verder te realiseren. Ook vergroot jij de grip op processen en zorg jij ervoor dat er snel gereageerd wordt op de ontwikkelingen in de markt. Haal jij energie uit het digitaliseren en data gedreven werken? Dan ben jij dé Product Owner die wij zoeken.
 We brengen je verder Als Product Owner kom je te werken binnen de afdeling Business Transformation Management. Binnen deze afdeling zitten we midden in een transitie van QlikView naar Power BI, de data engineers zijn een nieuw dataplatform aan het bouwen en daarnaast neemt het aantal BI verzoeken steeds verder toe. Door al deze ontwikkelingen is er behoefte aan de uitbreiding met een ervaren Product Owner! Als Product Owner ben je verantwoordelijk voor de doorontwikkeling van BI bij CCV. Je stelt prioriteiten door middel van continue afstemming met de stakeholders. Daarnaast ben je verantwoordelijk voor de backlog en voor het realiseren van de BI roadmap. Dit doe je in nauwe samenwerking met de Manager BI, andere Product Owners en de rest van je BI collega’s.
 Jouw profiel Als P.O. ben je nieuwsgierig en toon je initiatief. Je gaat voor resultaat en durft voor je mening uit te komen. Daarnaast beschik je over goede communicatieve vaardigheden en weet je in alle lagen van de organisatie mensen mee te krijgen door je verhaal op de doelgroep af te stemmen. Verder bied je een luisterend oor, kan je goed de belangen van de verschillende stakeholders inschatten, maar stuur je ook bij wanneer de situatie daar om vraagt.

    Wat je meeneemt:
   

Bachelor werk- en denkniveau met minimaal 3 jaar relevante werkervaring
ervaring met de Agile/Scrum werkwijze
kennis en ervaring met het beschrijven en prioriteren van user stories en requirements
algemene kennis van BI concepten
behaald Professional Scrum Product Owner/Scrum Master Certificaat is een pré


 Je nieuwe werkomgeving Iedere dag maken wij miljoenen betalingen mogelijk. Daar zijn we trots op. Om dat te realiseren zijn we innovatief én betrouwbaar tegelijk. We sleutelen in de voorhoede aan de nieuwste technologie, maar staan ook met beide benen in de maatschappij. En dat zie je in je nieuwe werkomgeving. We zijn ambitieus, gericht op de toekomst, open en collegiaal. Vol vertrouwen in elkaar.

    Bij ons werk je:
   

hybride werken, zowel vanuit huis als op kantoor
met een contract voor 32-40 uur per week in flexibele werktijden (zoals 4 x 9)
in een enthousiast multidisciplinair team met een mix aan Data engineers, Front-end analisten en BI consultants. Er is veel ruimte voor eigen inbreng en ontwikkeling


 Reageer nu
 Word jij enthousiast van deze vacature? Dan ontvangen wij graag je cv en motivatie. Die stuur je naar ons via de solliciteerknop hieronder. Wacht niet te lang. De vacature sluit zodra we de juiste kandidaat hebben gevonden. Neem voor meer informatie contact op met Paulien Knuppel van Recruitment via 088-2289732. Als betaaldienstverlener zijn wij verplicht je te screenen. Daarom doorloop je een screeningsprocedure

For one of our clients in the industrial sector and located in the Liege region, ADIUTUM is looking for a Data & Analytics Engineer to join its fast-growing team of talented and motivated consultants.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:
 As an IT Data & Analytics Engineer, you will be part of the IT team and will be responsible for the design and implementation of a modern data architecture, but you will also guide the internal organisation to become a data-driven company.

 Requirements

 Benefits 

 What's in it for you as an employee? 

 Here, at Adiutum, we put the consultant back at the centre of consultancy.

 This is also why we offer all our employees’ contractual stability, competitive salary packages, personalized career guidance as well as monitoring, training and continuous development opportunities adapted to each individual.

 If you want to take the next step in your career and discuss your development perspectives with a member of the team, apply now!

Louvain-La-Neuve
, 
Belgium
 









CluePoints is an innovative, fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Monitoring and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products enable both risk planning and operational risk monitoring, and utilize advanced statistical algorithms to determine the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. CluePoints is seeking outstanding candidates with strong data analytics aptitude and a passion for delivery excellence, to help drive customer success and broad adoption of the CluePoints solution.
 Please apply only if you hold a valid work permit or if you are a national of the Member States of the European Economic Area.

 Responsibilities


 Perform the technical configuration of the CluePoints solution for clinical studies based on customer requirements

 Perform analyses using the CluePoints Central Monitoring Platform – diagnosing and explaining anomalies identified in the clinical study data

 Summarize findings and support the communication of results to customers (both written report and oral presentation)

 Participate in the continuous improvement and development of our product solutions and operational processes

 Provide consultation and related operational support to customers as needed, with the help of more senior Data Analysts and/or the CluePoints Project Manager as well as mentoring more junior Data Analysts as needed

 Ensure that appropriate documentation is produced and maintained for each study 

Assist Business Development and Quality Assurance teams in responding to client questions and requests (e.g., RFP responses, audits, etc.)

 Skills Needed


 Experience with one or more programming languages, including SAS
 Experience with and understanding of clinical trials and clinical data 
Aptitude for mathematical and statistical concepts and data analytics
 Excellent oral and written communication skills in English
 Experience and ability to work well in a team environment
 Ability to thrive in a fast-moving environment, under time and resource constraints
 High degree of accuracy and attention to detail
 Experience in delivery of technical solution training is a plus
 Experience with CDISC databases is a plus


 Qualifications Needed


 College degree, preferably in a scientific or technical discipline

 +2 years of experience in a clinical research environment

 Knowledge of industry regulatory and clinical data standards including 21 CFR Part 11, ICH E6 (GCP), CDISC standards, MedDRA, WHODRUG, etc. 



 Top Reasons to Work with Us





 Flexibility is part of our DNA and you’ll find at CluePoints you can work 100% from home or chose to come to the office any day
 If you choose to come to the office, you’ll discover a fun atmosphere with kicker, PS4, arcade machine, nerf battles, and our newly added dartboard
 If you feel like a change of scenery, we have recently added the option to work at co-working spaces throughout Belgium.
 Many activities are organized during the year, such as soccer, team lunches, happy hours, , LAN parties, board games nights! We also have running groups, languages lessons, and much more!
 At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you’ll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
 You’ll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
 You’ll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards including “Scale-Up of the year 2019”!
 Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits, company car, bonus potential, employee referral program.




 How to Apply
 Please simply click the button on this page!

Functieomschrijving

Trendskout is een AI Startup die Artificiële Intelligentie toegankelijker wil maken. Dit doen we met ons eigen ontwikkeld AI-Platform dat we rechtstreeks aanbieden aan verschillende types organisaties. Je komt terecht in een bedrijf met een zeer open en aangename sfeer dat een pionier is in Artificiële Intelligentie. We zijn op zoek naar nieuwe krachten die mee met ons pionier willen zijn in de AI revolutie.
Als Junior Data Scientist werk je business vragen uit van klanten in het Trendskout AI Platform op basis van klantendata. De nadruk ligt hierbij op analyse van de business case, het analyseren van data en communicatie met de klant. De nadruk ligt hierbij minder op het programmeren maar wel op analyseren, klantencontact en gestructureerd werken. Afhankelijk van je voorkeuren kan je later doorgroeien tot Senior Data Scientist waar je programmeert aan het Trendskout AI Platform, of Project Manager waar nog meer nadruk ligt op klantencontact en communicatie.



Profiel


Analyseren van business cases van klanten en dit enten op de functionaliteiten van het Trendskout AI Platform,
Analyseren en verwerken van data,
Business cases oplossen a.d.h.v. het platform op basis van je analyse en de klantendata,
Gestructureerd bijhouden van progressie,
Klantgericht communiceren,
Meedenken over verbeteringen aan het platform.





Jobgerelateerde competenties

Ondersteuning bieden bij presales Antwoorden op aanbestedingen Commerciële voorstellen uitwerken (bedragen, middelen, realisaties, termijnen, ...)
 Meewerken aan de testfase en oplevering van ontwikkelde toepassingen Documentatie opstellen

 Gebruikers, klanten en diensten adviseren en hen technisch ondersteunen

About Inari...
 Inari is the SEEDesign™ company. We embrace the diversity and complexity of nature in every aspect of our business to drive innovation – to push the boundaries of what is possible. Through our unrivaled technology platform, Inari uses predictive design and advanced multiplex gene editing to develop step-change products. We are taking a nature positive approach to unlock the full potential of seed that will transform the food system. The results will lead to more productive acres delivering value creation for farmers and a more sustainable future for our planet.
 Our success is dependent on great minds, collaborating to generate bright ideas and deliver exceptional outcomes.
 We have over 230 employees, with research sites in Cambridge, MA (USA) and Ghent (Belgium), as well as a product development site in West Lafayette, IN (USA). We've deliberately built a team that brings diversity of thought to all aspects of our business, to generate new ideas, approaches, and ways of operating. And we've intentionally combined experience with potential, bringing agriculture industry experts with the desire to innovate together with bright minds from academia, human therapeutics, software, and consulting. If you want to be part of a diverse and inclusive team developing unique solutions to feed the world while protecting our planet's natural resources, we'd love to hear from you!

 About the role….
 We are looking for a dynamic, self-motivated and proactive Genomic Data Analyst to join our fast-growing team at Inari Ghent, who is committed and passionate about developing 21st century solutions to address global food challenges. As a Genomic Data Analyst you will mostly focus on establishing, maintaining, and executing analysis pipelines in a cloud environment.


 As a Genomic Data Analyst you will ….



Work with senior bioinformatic and other scientists to deliver high quality, high-throughput data and analyses to advance Inari product concepts and technologies.
Analyze existing and new genomics data (e.g. WGS, WGBS, ATACseq, RNAseq, HiC, etc) generated both externally and internally in addition to genome editing data in crops and single cells.
Interact with wet-lab bench scientists and deliver bioinformatics analyses to end users.
Build and maintain custom informatics pipelines and reports to support new scientific initiatives.
Help analyze, track, and report on overall pipeline capacity, making recommendations for where and how we can improve.
Proactively fill in the gaps and adapt to change in a fast paced, dynamic research environment - there is always something that needs to be done.
Maintain detailed and organized records of your work, project data you generate and other information as needed.
Work with colleagues to troubleshoot and develop effective solutions when problems occur.
Participate in scientific discussions and present research outcomes to peers and management.



 You bring...

BS or MS in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Mathematics, Statistics Biology, Plant Breeding, Genetics, or other relevant scientific field
Experience with data science tools {Python, R}, software development / programming practices and computational infrastructure
Understanding of molecular biology and bioinformatics concepts, processes, and tools
Ability to rapidly summarize data, communicate results, and act quickly and efficiently
Ability to teach concepts or explain your work to a wide variety of audiences
Ability to work in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment and handle ambiguity gracefully
Strong track record of developing creative solutions to complex problems
Strategic thinking, willingness to be bold and take risks
An efficient and well-organized approach to deliver high quality results on time
A collaborative approach, open to giving and receiving ideas, perspectives and feedback
Strong communication skills, both written and oral



 Additional Desired Skills/Experience:



Experience working with any of the following: AWS, Docker, Git, Benchling, web development, Agile methodologies, microservices, APIs
Previous experience working with plant genomic data is a plus, but not required

Als data-analist analyseer je rapporteringsnoden bij onze klanten en dit in diverse sectoren (medisch, non-profit, productie, …) en in organisaties van diverse tailles, gaande van kmo’s tot internationale omgevingen.
 Met jouw analytisch vermogen en door het stellen van de juiste specifieke vragen weet je de basis te leggen voor een correcte functionele analyse en het bepalen van de verdere controle aanpak. Hierbij sta je mee in voor de ontwikkeling van rapporten zowel voor de interne als de externe klant. Ook help je actief mee om de evolutie te maken van ruwe data naar intelligentie en kennis.
 Ook zal je binnen je functie onze financiële auditors bijstaan tijdens hun werkzaamheden; hierbij zal je specifieke historische data analyseren en aanleveren als input voor hun verdere werkzaamheden.
 Je houdt van de verantwoordelijkheid om projecten tot een goed einde te brengen en om de verwachtingen van onze klanten te vervullen en zelfs te overtreffen.

Je bent in het bezit van een masterdiploma met cijfermatige inslag of gelijkwaardig door een 1ste werkervaring.
Een 1ste ervaring in een job waar rapportering en/of data analyse centraal staan is een plus.
Je bent analytisch sterk en in staat abstract en oplossingsgericht te denken.
Je hebt een sterke affiniteit voor data analyse en statistiek.
Je bent communicatief, kan complexiteiten gemakkelijk ontcijferen en op een eenvoudige manier benoemen.
Je werkt graag zelfstandig op kleinere projecten of samen met een collega bij grote projecten.
Je hebt een goede kennis van databases en ETL processen.
Ook kennis van PowerBI of andere rapporteringstools is een plus.
Je hebt een goede kennis van het Nederlands en een gedegen kennis van het Engels. Frans is een plus.

We bieden je een werkomgeving die sterk inzet op professionalisering, digitalisering, innovatie en teamwork. Wij behoren tot de top 10 accountancy- en auditkantoren in België en groeien nog steeds verder. En dat kan tellen als familiale onderneming! Zo vindt onze CEO Nikolas Vandelanotte het belangrijk om een persoonlijk contact te hebben met alle collega's in de verschillende kantoren.
 Ook aan jouw individuele groei en wensen hechten we immens veel waarde (denk maar aan jouw persoonlijk groeipad) en we bieden je tal van interne (VDL Academy) en externe opleidingsmogelijkheden. Binnen Vandelanotte is doorgroeien of jobcrafting mogelijk, wat werken bij ons zo uitdagend en leuk maakt!
 Naast een contract van onbepaalde duur en een mooi salaris bieden we je graag ook de mogelijkheid om jouw werksituatie optimaal af te stemmen op jouw privésituatie (denk maar aan thuiswerk, flexibele werkuren, bedrijfswagen, cafetariaplan, etc.). Je kiest waar je werkt indien je niet bij onze klanten aan de slag bent: Antwerpen, Brussel, Aalst, Gent, Kortrijk, Brugge of Zele. Al onze werkplekken zijn vlot bereikbaar en ook deels thuiswerken is een optie, als je dat wil.
 En niet te vergeten... In deze functie als data-analist word je omringd door enthousiaste collega's die van elke werkdag een geluksdag maken!

job_title: Director Data Analytics - Technology, Media and Telecommunic...
job_summary:
Director Data Analytics - Technology, Media and Telecommunication (220000EA)
  





 Your story

 Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.


Your journey with us 
Starts in the Consulting practice, the Analytics & Cognitive portfolio where we are looking to strengthen our team with a Director who leads strategic and business development in the area of Technology, Media and Telecommunication (TMT).

Lead strategic and business development in the area of Technology, Media and Telecommunication
Manage projects from the inception phase to their final implementation and dissemination
Business development & sales

Take on a leading role in growing Deloitte Analytics & Cognitive footprint in the local & international market
Drive business development in Technology, Media and Telecommunication, exploring business needs, defining project proposals and presenting them to client leadership

Delivering ‘analytics & cognitive’ transformation projects at clients

Develop blueprints for Analytics & Cognitive and deliver transformation projects in the areas of business intelligence, data management, technology and next-generation analytics and technologies, including big data, cloud, and machine learning.
Establish long term client relationships

Team leadership

Lead by example and you act as an inspiring people manager, by creating a positive working environment with maximum learning opportunities and exposure for your team members, encouraging every person in your team to further grow and develop their skills and career
In partnership with HR, you apply an innovative approach to Talent Management, enhancing retention and talent acquisition


Let’s talk about you 

+10 years’ experience, in consulting and business development, in a Technology, Media and Telecommunication context
Hands-on consulting experience in developing blueprints for Analytics & Cognitive, advising clients on how to generate value from their assets, leading assessments of current situation and leading implementation projects
Strong business development capabilities. Highly skilled in nurturing and building long-lasting relationships with existing clients
You are recognized as a trusted advisor to senior management functions within our clients, ensuring the highest quality and ethical standards in client advice and relations
Innovative mindset with strong communication, entrepreneurial and leadership skills
Strong people management skills to drive a multi-disciplinary team forward
Fluency in Dutch, French and English




Our story

 Consulting stands for connecting innovation, transformation and leadership. We help our clients imagine, deliver and run their future, use the latest technologies, from strategy development through implementation. Because impact isn’t created alone. Together we can make history, join us! Part of Consulting, the Analytics & Cognitive practice provides strategic guidance and implementation services related to business intelligence, data management, next-generation analytics and technologies, big data, cloud and machine learning, insight strategy services and intelligent automation.


Who is Deloitte? World-leading professional services firm, we offer value added services in audit & assurance, risk advisory, accounting, tax & legal, consulting and financial advisory. 
+5000 dedicated professionals, active in +10 offices throughout the country, take great pride in supporting our clients with multidisciplinary expertise, industry knowledge, and innovative solutions. We offer services to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.


Why Deloitte? 
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact. 
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into: 

My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte 
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte 
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte 
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:

Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Join a fast-growing, Healthcare Company that is creating greenfield product and AI solutions that utilizes a  bioinformatics-guided in-human discovery engine combined with a breakthrough in optimization!
 

THE COMPANY
 
You will have the opportunity to join an artificial intelligence (AI) company for life sciences, that supports the industry in bringing clinical-stage biopharmaceutical drug discovery and development of innovative to light. 
Are you are looking for an exciting role as a Principle Data Scientist becoming a key team member of the team, boosting its discovery and product improvement support capacity?
 
THE ROLE

Work closely with both data engineers and other data scientists
 Help model unstructured data sets
 You will be creating and delivering Data Science/NLP projects regularly.

 Competitive Salary

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Luc Simpson-Kent via the Apply link on this page

Algorhythm is a scale-up with a big passion for data and a crystal-clear vision of a data-driven future. Algorhythm is about value creation, innovation and helping customers become data driven. That is what we stand for at Algorhythm. Are you our missing link?
 We are currently looking for a Business Analyst Data & Analytics.
 Who is our brand new Business Analyst Data & Analytics?
 As a Business Analyst Data & Analytics, you are an important asset in our team. You participate in the design of the standards around Data & Business Analysis in our company. In addition, you take a leading role as Business Analyst or Product Owner in their Data & Analytics projects. You like to take less experienced people under your wing and in this way determine the direction of the company.


 Part of your day to day job is collecting and documenting business requirements at our customers. 
You analyze business processes and are responsible for defining the target state around Data & Analytics.
 You play the role of Business Analyst or Product Owner in Data & Analytics projects.
 You coordinate the User/Business Acceptance Testing of Data & Analytics projects.
 You will help define a framework to refine and roll out the standards for Business Analytics in our company.
 You participate in presales for leads and opportunities where there is a need for Business Analysis.
 You will be working for clients to analyze existing data streams and propose optimizations.
 You are a point of contact for our Junior Business Analysts.

 What do we expect from our Business Analyst Data & Analytics?

You have at least 5 years of experience in a Data or Business Analysis environment.
 You are a good communicator, you are fluent in English and you have no problem with public speaking.
 You can explain a technical problem to a non-technical audience, but you are also fluent in 'the IT talk'.
 You like working in a project mode and have experience with Business Process Modeling & Business Analysis.
 You have a passion for data and closely follow technological developments around data engineering, data visualization, data science & architecture.
 You are proactive and like to share your knowledge with colleagues and clients.
 You are a team player, but have no problem sitting alone with a customer.
 Industry experience in Pharma, Automotive, Finance & Government are a plus.

What do we offer our Business Analyst Data & Analytics?

Being part of a scale-up within the Cronos network: you will be working within the mature context of the Cronos Group, the largest IT-network of Belgium.
An inspiring environment: everyday, we’ll support you to learn new things and to push your boundaries.
Great colleagues: you’ll be working in a team who are always eager to share their knowledge and make fun during team events, lunches and our annual ski trip.
A flat structure: you’ll work in a working environment with a flat structure and an open culture in which everyone is approachable and every voice counts.
A flexible workplace: you can work from Kontich, Lummen, Ghent or Turnhout to keep your work-life balance in good order. It’s up to you.
An attractive salary: supplemented with extra-legal benefits such as a company car, laptop, mobile phone, meal allowance and insurance

Apply today and we’ll be happy to get to know you over a cup of coffee!
 If you have any further questions, please reach out to: lieselot.peeters@algorhythm.be.
 And check our LinkedIn page!

Who are we?
Keyence is a multinational Japanese company with a strong global presence, providing high-tech products such as sensors, microscopes and advanced vision measurement systems. Keyence has flourished into a global leader in the industrial automation industry. We have rapidly expanded to 45 countries with 200 offices serving over 200,000 customers residing in 100 countries.
Who are we looking for?
- Are you an ambitious and motivated person, planning to start a new career in a very dynamic and international environment?- Do you have a good grasp on the English language?- Are you a data driven person, with a head for numbers? Do you have experience with reporting tools?- Are you naturally drawn to topics such as economy and market analysis?- Whether you have a higher education in economics or a specialization in reporting, finance or statistics, we can help you jumpstart your career.
How can you help us grow?
With your analytical mind-set and your comfort with economic and sales principles, you will support our strategy with relevant data and reporting deliverables.
The job?
- You will be responsible of data life cycle management (importing, cleaning, transforming, validating and modelling our data)- You will work close to stakeholders gathering requirements, performing analysis and delivering reports to support strategic business decision-making- You will assist our sales team with dashboard and report generation- You will be main point of contact for our Sales Administration Software with the possibility of delivering software trainings for our colleagues- You will locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Why should you join us?
You will join a young and dynamic team of highly passionate and motivated colleagues. Through our continuous trainings you will be able to develop and grow, becoming an expert in your field. With access to the newest cutting edge technology and innovations, you will be able to create value by providing the world with first-time on the market products and developments. Our salary package includes extra-legal benefits, bonuses and other opportunities that help you grow.
We are in Forbes 55 top most innovative companies and we are currently ranked No 7 on the BCG 2018 Value Creators Rankings
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent contract
