As part of the enterprise data office, the company is developing an enterprise data warehouse (eDWH) that will bring together data from the various technical applications, while observing some key design principles such as governance by design, reconciliation and data lineage.

 This eDWH will enable BI teams as well as data scientists to make transversal reporting and analysis on data that is uniform across the different systems.

 The enterprise data warehouse is built around the SAS DDS model and includes data from a variety of technical systems. The data from the various technical systems is already captured in respective operational data stores (ODS), consisting of Microsoft SQL databases. The eDWH in turn uses SAS and DB2.

 Tasks


 Collaborate with people from Business as well as Application Managers to understand what information is present in the source systems and how it is modeled



 Mapping data from various technical systems (Mainframe, Talk, GraphTalk AIA, ...) to the uniform data model used by the data warehouse, knowledge of SQL is a must



 Harmonizing codes across the different systems



 Define transformations to move from source system to target data model, so that these can then be translated to ETLs by the development team



 Document the meaning of the data (business definitions)



 Provide support & input in modeling the SAS DDS model


 (Knowledge of the DDS model and an actuarial background are strong assets here.)

 Skills


 Knowledge of the DDS for Insurance Model



 Knowledge of BI and data warehousing concepts



 SQL knowledge to be able to explore datasets and to describe transformations



 Experience with drafting requirements & functional documentation of solutions



 Smooth communicator and team player



 An eye for quality and respecting deadlines



 Experience with iterative work in short sprints (2 weeks)



 Knowledge of insurance (experience with life insurance is a plus)


 (an actuarial background is an advantage)

 Nice to Have

 DDS for Insurance Model
 SQL
 SAS DI
 Microsoft SQL
 SAS EG is a plus
 ERWIN is a plus
 GraphTalk AIA is a plus

 ﻿Contract Duration

 End 2021, extendable

La société

Sprimoglass est un groupe 100% belge et indépendant, qui possède actuellement deux sites : un à Sprimont et depuis 2021, un autre à Hasselt. Nous sommes leader dans le secteur du vitrage isolant pour le domaine de la construction et nous employons actuellement presque 500 personnes. Ce qui nous importe ? Des livraisons rapides, des suivis garantis, des relations honnêtes et transparentes. Ce qui nous importe ? Nos valeurs partagées par l’ensemble de nos équipes : #OneTeam #Curiosity #Winner !
 Portés par une vision pour 2024 et les années à venir, nous recherchons un officer IT Data & Analytics. Une plateforme de données moderne conçue et pilotée par la valeur commerciale, est capable d’ingérer des données de manière appropriée, de gérer la qualité des données, de les stocker en toute sécurité et d’offrir des possibilités d’intégration avec nos plateformes et applications spécifiques. L’ingénieur IT Data & Analytics relèvera du responsable informatique de l’équipe Implémentation.

Fonction

En tant qu’ingénieur IT Data & Analytics, tu feras partie de l’équipe IT et tu seras chargé de la conception et de l’implémentation d’une architecture de données moderne, mais tu guideras également l’organisation interne afin que Sprimoglass devienne une entreprise orientée “données”.
 Tes activités :

Tu conçois et tu construis des architectures de plateformes de données modernes E2E (Data engineering, visualisations, IA et MDM). 
A ton niveau, tu guides l’organisation interne pour devenir une organisation orientée données. 
Tu crées et déploies des stratégies de gouvernance des données et des processus de gestion des données. 
Tu couvres différents aspects concernant les données: de la gestion des données (master), en passant par le big data, data lakes, les entrepôts de données, la visualisation des données jusqu’à la Data Science et le machine learning. 
Tu améliores et tu adaptes le Datawarehouse en fonction des demandes de l’entreprise 
Tu mets en place des plateformes de données et la gestion des données (le modèle de données, l’intégration, l’autorisation), avec tous les composants nécessaires pour soutenir la stratégie de données. 
Tu améliores ou tu maintiens la performance du système de gestion des données 
Tu fournis un soutien pour assurer un service optimal aux différents départements internes 
Tu assures la formation, la documentation et le mentorat de l’équipe informatique et des principaux utilisateurs. 


Profil


Tu es titulaire d'un master en informatique, en ingénierie, en statistiques appliquées ou similaire par expérience 
Tu es passionné par les technologies et les tendances en matière de données et d’analytiques 
Tu as au moins 5 ans d’expérience dans l’implémentation de solutions de données et d’analyse 
Tu as des connaissances dans l’architecture de données et l'intégration de données, ainsi qu'une expérience pratique dans différents domaines concernant les données (MDM, Data Engineering, Big data, Data lakes, visualisation de données, vision par ordinateur, natural language processing, machine learning). 
Tu as une expérience pratique des plateformes de données modernes (par exemple Azure, Google, Databricks, Mulesoft, ...) et tu n’as pas peur de te plonger dans ce que tu ne connais pas 
Tu as une expérience dans la technologie des bases de données, dans l’implémentation de modules dans SSIS 
Tu as de l'expérience avec différentes techniques de consommation de données, allant des techniques traditionnelles (tableaux de bord et rapports), aux techniques d'analyse plus avancées et aux perspectives d'IA (PyTorch, TensorFlow...). 
Tu as une bonne compréhension du clustering, des techniques de modélisation prédictive et des systèmes de recommandation. 
Tu es capable d'écouter les membres de l’entreprise, de comprendre leurs défis et de concevoir une solution de données qui apporte de la valeur. 
Tu as des connaissances dans des méthodologies de gestion de projet 
Tu as les capacités à former et à guider les membres juniors de l'équipe, ainsi qu'à former le personnel du département sur l'utilisation efficace des applications en place. 
Tu es capable de gérer et de prioriser les tâches de manière efficace. 
Tu maîtrises le français et l’anglais (le néerlandais est un atout) 
Tu es naturellement orienté clients.

Description 
 With more than 1,750,000 vehicles, ALD Automotive Group is Europe's leading provider of leasing, fleet management and mobility solutions for businesses and individuals. The Group is present in 43 countries around the world and is part of the Société Générale Group.
 Since our start in 1965, 270 employees have joined our team. Our ambition? Provide exceptional service to fleet managers and drivers. This is a major challenge that we are meeting with a fleet of more than 85,000 vehicles.

 ALD Automotive is the reference in Belgium and Europe for operational leasing, car rental and Fleet Management. With an innovative view on multi-mobility, social challenges and leasing experiences, we also offer our customers flexible and comprehensive mobility solutions: bikes, charging possibilities, multi-mobility applications, consultancy... All taking into account our private and corporate customers.

 ALD Automotive is part of the Société Générale group aiming at becoming the number one mobility player in Europe. You will find yourself in fast growing and healthy company. We are active in a sector that is in full swing. So with us, you work in a working environment that fosters initiatives and innovation. Responsibilities 
 You will be the Data Analyst dedicated to the Sales & Marketing department. In this role, you will be the reference person in terms of figures for the whole department, meaning that:


 You will be in charge of developing / updating daily and monthly dashboards distributed to the Sales team (volumes, profitability, usage of commercial budget, etc.).
 You will have to implement support tools to help management and their teams make the most optimal decisions (pricing, workload, etc.).
 You will build some ad hoc analysis required by the Business.
 You will develop new reports for our customers and / or partners to help them optimize their mobility management.
 You will take part to the development of new products and services in order to help internal and external to move forward.
 You will help our consultancy department in order to put in place some complex calculation formula reflecting the facts evolution of the mobility fiscality (Total Cost of Ownership).
 In the short term, you are open to work in the field of predictive data.
 Must Have Requirements 
 
You have a master’s in economics, mathematics or you are Business Engineer with a first experience in the same function for at least 4-5 years.
 You have an excellent knowledge of Excel and you have experience working with data analysis tools (ideally Power BI and / or IBM Cognos).
 You have strong analytical skills with a real affinity for figures.
 You are eager to learn and to exchange with colleagues.
 You are client & results oriented.
 You are a team player and stress resistant.
 Fluent in French or Dutch with a good knowledge of English and of the second national language.
 We offer 
 
Desirable position with an international player, European leader of his industry with more than 7000 employees in 43 countries.
 A place in an inspiring and challenging working environment.
 Attractive pay package, supplemented with a range of extra-legal benefits such as a pension savings plan, hospitalization insurance, company car, meal vouchers, etc.
 Optimum work-life balance thanks to 12 ADV days, flexible hours and homeworking possibilities.
 Private leasing for an attractive price.
 Coaching and development opportunities.


 Languages French Dutch; Flemish Education Bachelor Experience 4-8 years

job_title: Senior Scientist, Data Science (JRD DS) (1 of 3 Openings)
job_summary:
Janssen Research & Development (“JRD”), a Johnson & Johnson company, is recruiting for a Sr. Scientist, Data Science. The primary location for this position is flexible – either; Titusville, NJ; Raritan, NJ; Spring House, PA; Cambridge, MA; New York City, NY; San Diego, CA; South San Francisco, CA; Beerse, Belgium; remote may also be considered with up to 10% travel.
Janssen develops treatments that improve the health of people worldwide. Research and development areas encompass oncology, cardiovascular and metabolic disorders, immunology, pulmonary hypertension, neuroscience, and infectious disease. Our goal is to help people live longer, healthier lives. We have produced and marketed many first-in-class prescription medications and are poised to serve the broad needs of the healthcare market – from patients to practitioners and from clinics to hospitals. To learn more about Janssen, one of the Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, visit https://www.janssen.com/us/. 
The R&D Data Science Analytics & Insights team within Janssen develops innovative solutions leveraging a variety of different data sources across multiple disease areas. Successful candidates will develop cutting-edge methodologies to drive critical global development decisions and positively impact the way we conduct trials for patients. We are looking for outstanding scientists whose responsibilities include: 

Deliver scalable machine learning solutions and insights to impact functions and therapeutic areas within R&D and participate in cross-functional collaborations with internal scientific and data science teams, and external companies
Lead and contribute to machine learning and artificial intelligence solutions to accelerate and enable global development
Lead and contribute to patient modeling and enrollment simulations to have accurate projections for completion of enrollment
Leverage emerging scientific and technological developments to generate new research ideas, solutions and initiatives using real-world data (electronic health records, insurance claims, others) 
Provide thought leadership for developing, adapting, and delivering real-world data methodologies to identify healthcare practitioners or organizations with patients matching, diversity and inclusion requirements, and hotspots mapping
Closely partner with the Data Science Portfolio Management and therapeutic area teams to execute on the priorities, building a roadmap to deliver the projects from data feasibility to final presentation to senior cross-functional leaders
Be a hands-on technical leader among the Data Science team, helping institute best practices while crafting a data-driven culture, developing, and mentoring more junior members of the team while advocating for skill development, working alongside a robust team of data scientists, bringing fresh perspectives and scientific rigor across Data Science projects and therapeutic areas
Clearly articulate highly technical methods and results to diverse audiences and partners to drive decision-making


Qualifications
 Required qualifications:

A Ph.D. degree, or master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., artificial intelligence, computer science, statistics, biostatistics, health economics, biomedical informatics, epidemiology, applied mathematics, or similar)
Relevant experience (2+ years for Ph.D., 3+ years for a master’s) within a start-up, technology, or healthcare industry
Extensive experience with machine learning, deep learning, statistical modeling, causal inference methods, multivariate regression and classification, and natural language processing 
Proven project leadership in complicated context, able to influence and engage the strategic and technical partners in a matrix organization
Proven track record of consistently delivering on high impact data science projects 
Expert proficiency in Python or R, and SQL
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills

Preferred qualifications:

Hands-on technical data analysis and machine learning modeling experience (across roles)
Experience delivering on Data Science projects using predictive technologies, forecasting, natural language processing, artificial intelligence, or machine learning
Familiarity with the development process in one or more therapeutic areas
Demonstrated experience in one of the following domains: real-world data (EHR, insurance claims, registry data), building patient cohorts, enrollment modeling, or clinical trial analytics
Experience working closely with healthcare professionals
Ability to effectively communicate technical work to a wide audience

Thriving on a diverse company culture and celebrating the uniqueness of our employees, we are committed to inclusion. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
Working with Johnson & Johnson can change everything. Including YOU.
#JRDDS
#JNJDataScience


Primary Location
 United States-New Jersey-Titusville-1125 Trenton Harbourton Road
 
Other Locations
 Europe/Middle East/Africa-Belgium-Antwerp-Beerse, United States-California-San Diego, United States-Pennsylvania-Spring House, United States-Massachusetts-Cambridge
 
Organization
 Janssen Research & Development, LLC (6084)
 
Job Function
 R&D
 
Requisition ID
 2105983528W

Are you looking to make a measurable impact for your clients with data science? Ready to expand your skillset in different tools, methodologies, and across various industries?  Do you have an innate passion for business and entrepreneurial sense while having an interest in the technical aspects of the job?
 What is your mission?
 Help innovative companies thrive in turning their objectives into results, through smarter use of data.
 ✅ More concretely, what will you do day-to-day?
 As a Data Scientist, you will play a vital role in the end-to-end delivery of our projects.
 Therefore, you will work closely with stakeholders to:

Prioritize business requirements
Manage data collection
Analyze results
Provide reports
Model data
Interpret trends and patterns
Communicate the results and next steps effectively with clients

Our assignments include:

Data audit
Data preparation
Descriptive analysis 
Modeling
Presenting the results

Senior Data Scientists supervise and coach junior Data Scientists in delivering their projects and on internal tasks. This guidance is to help junior Data Scientists acquire the business and technical skills to manage their projects quickly. 
Requirements
 Do you recognize yourself?
 Your Background

You have a master’s in Management/Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Biology, or similar - There is no standard study background for data
You are fluent in English and fluent in at least Dutch or French

Your Professional Skills

You have good knowledge and demonstrable experience with ETL and statistical packages (SAS, SPSS, R, Python, Spark). Knowledge of programming languages such as Javascript, Spark, S, C is a plus. 
You have technical expertise in data preparation, data models, data mining, and segmentation.

Your Personal Skills

You have strong analytical skills to collect, organize, analyze, and interpret large amounts of data to underline the relevant information regarding a specific business objective.
You have a problem-solving mindset; you take a pragmatic approach regarding data science and seek out the simple solution.


️ Must Have


You have a driver’s license: type B (car in Belgium) or similar
You are eligible to work in Belgium and the European Union (please be aware that we do not offer relocation support)

You will be a great fit if -

You want to be among the first employees to help us shape our organization and grow in the future. 
You have a natural care about work quality, showing a professional attitude and passion for service. You are proactive, autonomous, and like to take initiative.
You can confidently interact and communicate at all levels, from the front-line staff to the executive team, with data experts and non-experts alike. 
You are curious about new techniques and tools and strive always to keep learning.
 ‍
 
️ Some signs this may not be the right fit -


If you don't like to interact with customers or do presentations from time to time. All our Data Scientists are client-facing. 
If you’re not comfortable working at the client’s premises (on average 2-3 days a week) and from our office in La Hulpe (on average 2-3 days a week).
If you don’t have an entrepreneurial mindset and aren’t ready to go the extra mile to deliver quality work or contribute to an organization’s growth.

Benefits
 Working at Agilytic 
We aim at creating a work environment that allows you to do exceptional work, grow your skillset and, most importantly, be happy while doing it.
 You may work on assignments anywhere in Belgium and neighboring countries like Luxembourg, France, the Netherlands, and the UK. You can expect to interact with IT/data specialists and business executives (marketing, process, customer care).
 We believe that data is a means to an end and not an end in itself. We don’t use cutting-edge techniques when not suited to the problem we need to solve. We adapt to what the client truly needs, even if it might look less appealing from a technical perspective. For instance, we won't train a neural network predicting marketing performance based on 1000 variables if a simple dashboard showing marketing efficiency across a few dimensions answers the customer’s question. All our missions are about data, and so far, approximately 50% of them haven’t required any machine learning.
 Salary and benefits

Competitive remuneration package: We offer a competitive remuneration package,
   
 Complete with a company car, fuel card, phone subscription, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. 


There is also a variable remuneration component based on client satisfaction/ longevity and your contribution to our business development efforts.


A cafeteria plan in which you can allocate your variable remuneration to your preferred advantages (extra days off, electronics... and cash of course)
 
️ Training roadmap: We will draft together a training roadmap, taking into consideration our internal competencies as well as your interests.
Supportive structure and transparency: What we don’t have in scale (yet), we’ll make it up with flexibility, support, and transparency. We will be there for you every step of the way, with individual coaching and career roadmapping.
Modern tools: Tools are a means to an end. We want them to help you do your best work, not become a bottleneck. That’s why you can expect up-to-date hardware and software tools so that you (hopefully) never have to swear at your computer.
Oh, and a little bit of fun too: We take our work very seriously, but we’re not afraid to laugh at ourselves. Life is too short.

Vous aimez harmoniser les communications internes et présentez une affinité pour l’analyse de données ? Alors devenez responsable en communication chez Colruyt Group Data & Analytics. Un emploi varié allant de l’élaboration d’une stratégie de communication à la rédaction de témoignages inspirants.En tant que responsable en communication, vous assumez les tâches suivantes :

 Vous élaborez une stratégie de communication et concevez un plan de communication pour différentes thématiques, comme les procédures de changements, l’exécution du plan stratégique… Vous proposez ainsi un mix de canaux et des délais convenables. Grâce à votre approche, tout le monde dispose d’un aperçu clair de l’objectif de notre division : créer une valeur ajoutée à l’aide de données.
 Vous travaillez en étroite collaboration avec les différentes parties prenantes afin de toujours pouvoir élaborer le plan de communication idéal pour toutes les parties concernées.
 Vous aidez vos collègues à améliorer leurs compétences en communication. En outre, vous réunissez l’équipe de rédaction afin de pouvoir collecter toutes les informations nécessaires dans le cadre de la stratégie de communication de votre division.
 Vous ne communiquez pas uniquement en interne, mais également avec le reste de l’organisation. Vous rendez intelligibles et gérables des aspects techniques pour tout le monde. Ainsi, vous contribuez également à la création d’une organisation axée sur le client.

 Vous travaillez à Wilgenveld et avez la possibilité de travailler deux jours par semaine depuis votre domicile ou l’un de nos bureaux régionaux (Malines, Merelbeke, Deinze…). 



Profil


 Connaissances et expérience – Vous êtes titulaire d’un bachelier ou d’un master en marketing, en sciences de la communication ou en gestion, et justifiez de quelques années d’expérience dans une fonction de communication. Vous présentez également un intérêt pour les analyses de données et avez la plume facile ? Voilà qui constitue un atout. 
Connaissances linguistiques – En tant que francophone, vous communiquez aisément en néerlandais et en anglais.
 Organisation – Vous êtes capable de mettre en place un planning opérationnel et tactique sans jamais perdre de vue l’aspect humain.
 Attitude positive – Vous savez mobiliser les énergies afin de mener à bien les projets.




 Nous vous offrons


 Influence – Vous exercez un travail passionnant où vous pouvez prendre des initiatives. 
Rémunération – Vous bénéficiez d’un salaire attrayant accompagné de divers avantages extralégaux, comme une voiture de société, des chèques-repas et une participation aux bénéfices.
 Formation – Nous proposons une offre de formations variée afin de vous permettre de poursuivre votre développement.
 Vaste réseau de contacts – Vous entretenez des contacts avec des spécialistes de différents domaines.

job_title: Product Owner Data Insights & Analytics (Ieper of Arnhem)
job_summary:
Zorg jij, samen met je team, graag voor de ontwikkeling van Business Intelligence producten? In de functie van P.O. werk jij mee om de data strategie van CCV verder te realiseren. Ook vergroot jij de grip op processen en zorg jij ervoor dat er snel gereageerd wordt op de ontwikkelingen in de markt. Haal jij energie uit het digitaliseren en data gedreven werken? Dan ben jij dé Product Owner die wij zoeken.
 We brengen je verder Als Product Owner kom je te werken binnen de afdeling Business Transformation Management. Binnen deze afdeling zitten we midden in een transitie van QlikView naar Power BI, de data engineers zijn een nieuw dataplatform aan het bouwen en daarnaast neemt het aantal BI verzoeken steeds verder toe. Door al deze ontwikkelingen is er behoefte aan de uitbreiding met een ervaren Product Owner! Als Product Owner ben je verantwoordelijk voor de doorontwikkeling van BI bij CCV. Je stelt prioriteiten door middel van continue afstemming met de stakeholders. Daarnaast ben je verantwoordelijk voor de backlog en voor het realiseren van de BI roadmap. Dit doe je in nauwe samenwerking met de Manager BI, andere Product Owners en de rest van je BI collega’s.
 Jouw profiel Als P.O. ben je nieuwsgierig en toon je initiatief. Je gaat voor resultaat en durft voor je mening uit te komen. Daarnaast beschik je over goede communicatieve vaardigheden en weet je in alle lagen van de organisatie mensen mee te krijgen door je verhaal op de doelgroep af te stemmen. Verder bied je een luisterend oor, kan je goed de belangen van de verschillende stakeholders inschatten, maar stuur je ook bij wanneer de situatie daar om vraagt.

             Wat je meeneemt:
            

Bachelor werk- en denkniveau met minimaal 3 jaar relevante werkervaring
ervaring met de Agile/Scrum werkwijze
kennis en ervaring met het beschrijven en prioriteren van user stories en requirements
algemene kennis van BI concepten
behaald Professional Scrum Product Owner/Scrum Master Certificaat is een pré


 Je nieuwe werkomgeving Iedere dag maken wij miljoenen betalingen mogelijk. Daar zijn we trots op. Om dat te realiseren zijn we innovatief én betrouwbaar tegelijk. We sleutelen in de voorhoede aan de nieuwste technologie, maar staan ook met beide benen in de maatschappij. En dat zie je in je nieuwe werkomgeving. We zijn ambitieus, gericht op de toekomst, open en collegiaal. Vol vertrouwen in elkaar.

             Bij ons werk je:
            

hybride werken, zowel vanuit huis als op kantoor
met een contract voor 32-40 uur per week in flexibele werktijden (zoals 4 x 9)
in een enthousiast multidisciplinair team met een mix aan Data engineers, Front-end analisten en BI consultants. Er is veel ruimte voor eigen inbreng en ontwikkeling


 Reageer nu
 Word jij enthousiast van deze vacature? Dan ontvangen wij graag je cv en motivatie. Die stuur je naar ons via de solliciteerknop hieronder. Wacht niet te lang. De vacature sluit zodra we de juiste kandidaat hebben gevonden. Neem voor meer informatie contact op met Paulien Knuppel van Recruitment via 088-2289732. Als betaaldienstverlener zijn wij verplicht je te screenen. Daarom doorloop je een screeningsprocedure

Data Analytics Architecture Consultant (220000EF)
  





 Your story

 Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.


Your journey with us
Starts in the Consulting business unit, the Artificial Intelligence & Data (AI&D) offering within Strategy, Analytics, Merge & Acquisition (SAMA) portfolio. We are currently looking for a Data Architecture (senior) Consultant, who can design the needed Data Architecture that fits our Clients’ vision. You will:

Assess, capture, and translate complex business processes and requirements into a structured analytics use case.
Understand the required data capabilities needed to implement the defined use cases.
Design the best fit architecture that supports the client’s vision and translate it into an implementation roadmap.
Deliver bold and innovative solutions that differentiate Deloitte with clients.
Perform market and emerging research to identify developments and trends.
Advise clients on emerging market trends, disruptors and innovations that have the potential to impact strategic direction.
Participate in assessments of existing data architecture and give advice on structural improvements in the areas of performance, usability, architecture, processes and organization
Support the development of client bids and the presentation of proposals


 
Let’s talk about you

University degree or equivalent experience
Knowledge of how to manage the data life cycle (governance, quality, master data management…)
Understand the data landscape & technology market and how it combines
Familiar with Cloud services and capabilities
Aware of the Data & Analytics trends and the newest technologies on the market
Ability to translate complex findings and analysis to a business audience
Intellectual curiosity combined with outstanding analytical skills
Team player with strong communication skills







Our story

 Our Consulting practice within Deloitte has a strong reputation and track record as Business Performance Consultants. We are a recognized leader in helping clients solve complex business problems, differentiated by our ability to execute on the advice we provide. Our multi-disciplinary competencies allow us to address CXO issues from every angle.
Part of the Consulting practice, Artificial Intelligence & Data is helping its Clients grow, evolve, mature and question their business. We do this by leveraging our extensive and ever evolving information driven technology and methodology know-how. We rationalize information and apply it to any challenge ahead, in partnership relationships with our Clients.
We employ a broad range of different information-driven profiles: Data Managers, Information Builders, Data Scientists, RPA, Cloud, Cognitive… All information-driven roles are somehow present. We are looking for pragmatic minds that can adjust their way of working to resonate with his/her client. In The Age of With, via our Analytics & Cognitive team, we have a focus on applying Intelligence across the entire data, analytics, automation and AI spectrum.

Data & Analytics modernization: Design and implement large scale data programs and analytics platforms that promote organizational intelligence
Robotics & Intelligent Automation: Leverage robotic and intelligent automation technologies to transform business processes, augmenting human labor with automation to drive better outcomes with enhanced productivity
AI Insights & Engagement: Generate insights to catalyze growth and engage stakeholders using Science based capabilities, Machine Learning and AI platforms, delivered via an alternative Studio based model
AI Strategy: Define the AI strategy of a company in support of the new business models and realizing improved business outcomes
Managed Analytics & AI services: Operate Data and Analytics infrastructure and systems, provide capacity by embedding talent in our client organizations and build As a Service based subscription models at scale
Assets & IP Factory: Build AI-enabled assets, IP addressing high value, and repeatable use cases.


 
Who is Deloitte? World-leading professional services firm, we offer value added services in audit & assurance, risk advisory, accounting, tax & legal, consulting and financial advisory. 
+5000 dedicated professionals, active in +10 offices throughout the country, take great pride in supporting our clients with multidisciplinary expertise, industry knowledge, and innovative solutions. We offer services to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.


Why Deloitte? 
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact. 
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:

job_title: Local Business Process Management - Data Analyst
job_summary:
At GSK, we're a company with a purpose to help people do more, feel better and live longer. We realise that our purpose starts with us. When we feel at our best, we perform at our best. Therefore, we want all applicants to be able to perform their best throughout the recruitment process.
 We will be delighted to hear from talented individuals that align to our values. These are at the heart of everything we do and include: Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork. 

When you set out on your adventure at GSK, we make a deal. You commit to living our values and expectations and performing against our Innovation, Performance and Trust priorities. In return, GSK commits to providing the right environment for you to thrive. Together, we build an environment where we can all thrive and focus on what matters most to each of us.

 As a , we empower you to be yourself, share ideas and work collaboratively

 As a LBPM Data Analyst, you will be responsible to guarantee the best in class in place in use of digital tools* as e.a. SAP, CDW, power BI, spotfire, sharepoint, .... for Belgian operations.

 This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career, these responsibilities include some of the following

 Act as the technical subject matter expert who assists the business on the best tool's choice optimizes the user's DDA journey (diagnose)
 Define User Specific Requirements and if needed translate in a model data and interpret results to create value
 Design the solution in the adequate tool
 Ensure the validation of the solution
 Dispense transversal instructions/training to users
 Maintain local documentation updated and validated
 Support the In use digital tool (ea. Monitoring of usage)
 Lead and organize continuous improvement of system and services to meet client’s satisfaction
 Solve problems in his area (ea. Maintenance, hypercare)
 Define and or develop reporting associated to the tool to cover the needs of the business in term of status training or KPI's, Anaytics to enable production activities, continuous improvement, optimise costs


 Continually monitor system usage and functions versus authorities’ requirement and local SOP’s if applicable
 You work with the project team to quickly prototype, launch and test changes that will improve and deliver the end product ( eg dashboard )
 Animate a network of stakeholders inside functional area
 You drive iterative communication with end users and business SMEs to ensure that digital's tool is aligned with their needs
 You work with project teams and stakeholders across the org to coordinate effective delivery of the Minimum Valuable Product with impactful communications,


 Our Local Business Management Process department characterizes by being a central team of technical experts of all digital & data analytics solutions to support manufacturing and annexed services such as Quality, engineering, logistic, CI, LMSAT (short information about the organization and how the team is composed). 

Why you? 
Basic Qualifications:

 Bio-engineer, Process Engineer or Business Engineer degree
 Excellent knowledge as end-user and project manager of SAP modules related with his/her business process.
 Experience in ERP or digital solutions as user or project manager is key (5-7 years experience).
 Knowledge of quality control activities is a must.
 Expertise in Project Management and Validation Methodology
 Good knowledge of GSK Vaccines Organization, especially in developing partnership with Tech organization and GSK Vaccine network.
 Champion for Change Management.
 Agile experience is an asset-Innovative mindset
 Excellent written and spoken English is a must


 Preferred Qualifications:
 If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:

 Knowledge of cGxP requirements is an asset
 Knowledge in Microsoft Azure Cloud, Power BI technologies, Pithon, SQL is a plus
 Balanced mix of technical and business skills: deep understanding of the business problem that the digital tool is designed to solve
 Able to evaluate potential innovative technology areas relevant to his area
 Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with ability to quickly learn and understand business processes and problems to effectively design solutions
 Project management experience, good communication skills, team player
 Ability to manage relationships and expectations with various types of stakeholders


 Why GSK? :

 Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture. These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork in a culture of Innovation, Performance and Trust.

 GSK Vaccines - Our Vaccines business has a broad portfolio and innovative pipeline of vaccines to protect people of all ages. We deliver over two million vaccine doses per day to people living in over 160 countries.
 For further information, please visit www.gsk.com.

 Our department

 Global Industrial Operations (GIO):
 Once our pioneering treatments have been developed, they are manufactured to the highest standards and distributed across the regions that need them most. Accomplishing this as efficiently and quickly as possible can quite literally be a matter of life and death. So, it's no wonder that more than 70% of our talented workforce is based within Global Industrial Operations - the essential business unit that manufactures and manages the entire vaccine supply process, from customer order to product dispatch on a global scale. As the name suggests, it operates in a multi-national context across more than 17 sites around the world, working closely in tandem with colleagues from a variety of disciplines and professions. The department is structured in operating units that focus on various aspects of the manufacturing and supply process. These include Industrialization (overseeing the transfer of production from R&D to a commercial level), Supply Chain Management and Technical Services.

 GSKTechTalent

 GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose – to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together – so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns – as an organisation where people can thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it, and we aim to impact the health of 2.5 billion people around the world in the next 10 years.   Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it’s also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a place where people feel inspired, encouraged and challenged to be the best they can be. A place where they can be themselves – feeling welcome, valued and included. Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead Together.

Who are we?

 Innovating for life since 1986, IBA has become the 
 global leader in proton therapy, considered as the most 
 advanced and 
 accurate form of radiotherapy in cancer treatments using 
 ionizing rays.
 Thanks to the unique properties of protons, tumors can be targeted more accurately while limiting exposure of the surrounding healthy tissues
  We provide two types of therapy center: the IBA’s Proteus®PLUS which offer a multi-room solution and the Proteus®ONE who is a more compact single room solution that is easier to install, integrate and operate.
  To date, more than 58 world renowned medical institutions have built a Particle Therapy Center with IBA across 3 continents.
 

Sustainability commitment

 As a company, we are focused on striking the right balance between our stakeholders: increasing our market share and the return for our shareholders, improving the quality of life of our customers, patients and employees, and contributing to the well-being of our society, while also maintaining and restoring our planet’s health.
 
 “Since 2021, IBA is recognized as a certified B Corporation (or B Corp). B Corps are companies that promote ‘business as a force for good’, balancing profit and purpose. They meet the highest standards of social and environmental performance, public transparency, and legal accountability.”
 
 Our Proton Therapy Solutions are targeted towards the same objective of making a positive impact on patient health by providing health care professionals with the most effective and accurate solutions for diagnosis and treatment.
  Check out our
  
webpage sustainability
 to find out more!
 

Innovation at the core: shaping the future of proton therapy

 We dare designing innovative solutions because we aim for better treatment. That is why our teams are focused on continuously improving the quality and stability of our Proteus®ONE and Proteus®PLUS solutions.
  IBA constantly improve the proton therapy technology for the benefit of patients. We work diligently to advance proton therapy, in close collaboration with our customers and through R&D partnerships.

 As a data analyst in the Tools & Data team, you will work alongside data analysts from the Tools & Data team (part of Operations) as well as data scientists and data engineers from the Advanced Analytics team (part of IT). The objective is to empower the Operations department with data & reports to help them become more efficient and make informed decisions. Your mission will be to: (1) Work closely with the business to understand their needs, develop data analyses and automated reports to solve them (2) Contribute to IBA’s self-service analytics ambition for example by co-developing IBA’s governance and BI processes, providing BI trainings and user support
  As a data analyst you will be the interface between business stakeholders and data engineers. You will capture needs related to operations, for example regarding Protontherapy sites operations, customer portal, logistics & manufacturing flows. You will understand the data and data structure required to deliver on these needs and translate them into development requirements with our data engineers. More importantly, you will bring your expertise in Power BI to create production-level reports and support other report creators in the organisation.
 

Core Responsibilities
 As a Data Analyst with focus on PowerBI, your responsibilities will be to: 
 
Act as a bridge between business and IT, responsible for requirement analysis and solution definition of dashboarding and reporting solutions using mostly PowerBi
Develop production-level reports and dashboards incl. customer-facing dashboards
Work hands-on with business to test, validate and maintain/improve deliverables over time
Define and improve the data governance, documentation and data catalog jointly with the Advanced Analytics team
Share best practices and act as an evangelist to promote a data culture within the company


Do you have what it takes?
 Ideally you have a relevant background in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Intelligence or similar. In addition, you have the following experience: 
 
2+ years experience in Business Intelligence, Analytics or equivalent
Proficient in PowerBi ecosystem (knowledge of DAX is preferred and certified in PL-300 will be a plus)
Understand databases, how to connect and query them
Understand Data Warehouse terminology, Star schemas, able to articulate and validate data modelling best practices
Able to connect with business users to help translate business user stories into functional design
Highly motivated, self-starter able to work autonomously, prioritize and drive real change in an organisation
Kind and collaborative, with good interpersonal and communication skills and able to lead projects creatively and independently
Willing to grow, eager to learn new technologies and skills, share ideas and help colleagues do the same
Fluent and clear in English both oral and written, French nice to have


Impostor syndrome: if this description matches what you'd like to grow into and not necessarily where you are now, we encourage you to apply
 

What’s in for you

Purpose – you’ll directly contribute to IBA’s mission to enhance, protect and save lives. You’ll create insights that directly help our colleagues deliver and operate our cyclotrons
Personal & team growth – we grow individuals providing coaching, learning & training opportunities both within IBA and leveraging external expertise where needed
Team – we have a team with diverse experiences and background located mostly in Belgium as well as Germany and the US. We strive to make it as inclusive and collaborative as possible
Flexible and remote-friendly work environment within Belgium, open to remote applications (possibility to travel to Belgium easily preferred)

 The identity of IBA is characterized by a group of colleagues driven by motivation, curiosity, creativity, the desire to learn on a daily basis, by technical challenges and above all by a highly developed team and family spirit that makes the daily life smoother and more enjoyable!
 
 By joining a team of about 40 nationalities and working on more than 45 different sites on 3 continents, IBA offers you the opportunity of a meaningful career with a direct impact in the fight against cancer. 
 
 We are driven by: 
 
Innovating in a cutting-edge technology environment 
Developing professional and personal skills by learning on the Job; by participating in challenging projects; top class courses 
Evolving in a friendly culture environment based upon solid values (dare - share - care - be fair) 
Acting autonomously and belonging to motivated teams with good work-life balance 
Contributing to a company where sustainability, safety and well-being are key to our success
If you are passionate, cause-driven, you can make this quest yours by joining our dedicated colleagues and give your career a new meaning.

Colruyt Group utilise les « big data » et les connaissances des entreprises du groupe pour créer de la valeur ajoutée. En tant que coordinateur des données et de l'analyse, vous identifiez les possibilités et les mettez à profit en utilisant des données, des informations et une expertise analytique.
 En tant que data & analytics coordinator, vous contribuez à la croissance et à la maturité de nos business units avec lesquelles vous collaborez étroitement. Vous faites partie d’une équipe de trois à cinq experts. L’équipe est encore en plein développement. Votre expertise, vos connaissances et votre approche flexible contribuent à lui donner forme.
 Que faites-vous concrètement en tant que data & analytics coordinator ?

 Vous cherchez de façon proactive de nouvelles possibilités pour l’utilisation de données, d’informations et d’analyses. Vous réalisez également des cas d’utilisation.
 Vous êtes attentif aux possibilités qui se présentent ainsi qu’aux besoins en matière de données, d'informations et de surveillance des performances de bout en bout et vous les traduisez en exigences et en un plan d'approche concret. 
Vous facilitez la mise en place et la réalisation d'une feuille de route analytique basée sur les objectifs stratégiques d'une unité opérationnelle.
 Vous introduisez des possibilités d'externalisation dans la business unit. Vous servez de source d’inspiration pour votre business unit dans la création de valeur ajoutée à partir des données et des informations. 
Vous vous constituez un vaste réseau au sein de Colruyt Group. Vous pouvez ainsi travailler efficacement et durablement. 

Vous travaillez à Hal et pouvez faire du télétravail jusqu’à deux jours par semaine.



 Profil


 Connaissances et expérience – Vous êtes titulaire d’un master et participez au travail de réflexion au niveau de la direction et du management. Vous possédez plus de dix années d’expérience. Les données et informations complexes vous sont dès lors familières.
 Communication et empathie – Vous communiquez facilement à tous les niveaux. Vous faites face à des besoins complexes ? Vous en tirez facilement l'essentiel et rendez les solutions techniques compréhensibles. En outre, vous avez la maturité et le charisme nécessaires pour communiquer au niveau de la direction.
 Aptitude conceptuelle – Vous avez pour seconde nature de mener un travail de réflexion conceptuelle. Vous pouvez ainsi comprendre rapidement une business unit et saisir les opportunités.
 Flexibilité – Vous vous adaptez facilement aux changements d’environnement et jouez un rôle actif à cet égard.
 Connaissances linguistiques – En tant que francophone, vous communiquez aisément en néerlandais et en anglais. Vous pouvez ainsi collaborer facilement avec l’ensemble de vos collègues, partenaires et parties prenantes.




 Nous vous offrons


 Influence et responsabilité – Vos connaissances et conseils contribuent à définir le cap à suivre pour les différentes business units et l’ensemble du groupe.
 Travail varié – Vous collaborez avec des équipes actives dans des domaines d’expertise très divers. Nous concentrons nos efforts sur l’innovation, ce qui génère constamment de nouveaux projets dans lesquels vous pouvez prendre vos responsabilités.
 Rémunération attrayante – Votre salaire s’accompagne de nombreux avantages extralégaux, tels qu’une voiture de société, des chèques-repas et une participation aux bénéfices.

Vacature 
   
Data Analyst 







Je bent een business georiënteerde Data Analist die expertise in data, kennisgrafieken en machine learning combineert met een passie voor het oplossen van real-world problemen. Je staat te popelen om bij te dragen aan concrete business projecten in een brede waaier van domeinen.
 Als jij dat bent, dan willen we graag met je praten over de rol van Data Engineer/Analyst bij DataScouts.
 DataScouts is een datatechnologiebedrijf dat zijn klanten ondersteunt bij het opbouwen van markt- en competitive intelligence door een AI-enabled workflow te bieden voor het systematisch ophalen en verwerken van data over concurrenten, innovatieve technologieën en markttrends in snel veranderende omgevingen.
 Locatie: Ons kantoor ligt in Gent, maar we zijn het gewoon om vanop afstand te werken.
 Als data analist werk je nauw samen met onze klanten, het ecosysteem en business analisten om DataScouts te configureren en relevante data pipelines en visualisaties af te stellen voor specifieke klantcases.
 Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de integratie met relevante databronnen, het ontwikkelen van datavisualisaties en het aanpassen van de AI-gebaseerde workflow, de datapijplijnen en classifiers die direct markt- en concurrentie-inzicht opleveren.
 Je bent betrokken bij pre-sales gesprekken en het ontwikkelen van voorstellen voor klantspecifieke integraties, dataverzameling en rapportage workflows.
 Je zorgt voor het succes van de klant bij het afleiden van waardevolle markt-en concurrentie-informatie.
 Je bent een zeer samenwerkingsgerichte persoon die in staat is om je eigen agenda te beheren, samen te werken met collega's, en prioriteiten te stellen voor taken met impact.







Functie. 


Je werkt nauw samen met onze klanten, het ecosysteem en bedrijfsanalisten aan concrete Market & Competitive Intelligence-projecten;
 Je bouwt en beheerst een grote verscheidenheid aan gestructureerde en ongestructureerde datasets om use case-specifieke markt- en concurrentie-inzichten op te bouwen;
 Je ontwikkelt workflows en data pipelines om data te cleanen, te normaliseren en te verrijken;
 Je analyseert big data sets om relevante patronen te identificeren
 Je ontwikkelt modellen en visualisaties om data om te zetten in bruikbare inzichten
 Je maakt gebruik van je data engineering en machine learning vaardigheden om prototypes te maken van oplossingen om onze data pipeline, data visualisaties en oplossingen te optimaliseren
 Je werkt nauw samen met Product Management om prototypes, data en modellen te vertalen naar gebruiksvriendelijke en intuïtieve dashboards, rapporten en visualisaties







Profiel. 

We verwachten niet dat je een expert bent in alles, maar je moet wel beschikken over,

 MSc diploma in een discipline zoals informatica, machine learning, toegepaste statistiek, wiskunde, of engineering;
 Eerste ervaring als bedrijfs- of data-analist is een pluspunt;
 Python is essentieel, andere talen (bijv. R en SQL) zijn gunstig;
 Goede presentatie- en communicatievaardigheden, met het vermogen om complexe analytische concepten uit te leggen aan mensen uit het bedrijfsleven
 Methodische maar creatieve probleemoplosser;
 Ervaring in het toepassen van data science en machine learning methodes op real-world problemen.

 Aanvullende vaardigheden en kwalificaties:

 Gedreven door resultaten en gemotiveerd door het verkrijgen van concrete deliverables.
 Servicegericht, detailgeoriënteerd en kwaliteitsgedreven
 Teamspeler
 Sterke analytische en planningsvaardigheden
 Track record in het succesvol leiden van complexe projecten
 Vlotte kennis van het Engels (zowel mondeling als schriftelijk). Kennis van het Nederlands of Frans is een pluspunt.







Aanbod. 

Je maakt deel uit van een ambitieus, jong en snelgroeiend team. Je job zal veel variatie bieden door klanten in verschillende sectoren, verschillende domeinen en verschillende omgevingen.
 Je werkt in een multidisciplinaire omgeving met onze klanten, het consulting team, machine learning engineers, en software ontwikkelaars.
 Als je een ondernemersgeest hebt, enthousiast bent over het vinden van slimmere manieren om dingen te doen, en een brandend verlangen hebt om deel uit te maken van een team waar je echt een verschil kunt maken, dan willen we je ontmoeten.
 Aarzel niet en neem contact op met Bart via bart.frison@datascouts.eu

Wat bieden we jou?

 About Umicore


Reducing harmful vehicle emissions. Giving new life to used metals. Powering the cars of the future. We aim to be a clear world leader in materials for clean mobility and recycling and have turned our sustainability approach into an even greater competitive advantage. With ambitions like this, imagine what you could do?




 About Electro-Optic Materials (EOM)


Power in space. Vision at night. Coatings thinner than human hair. Umicore is a world leader in material solutions for the space, optics and electronics sectors – enabling every day cutting-edge technologies. We guarantee our customers secure access to supply, plus recycling technologies that give materials a new lease of life. To produce materials with even higher performance, and provide recycling to new markets, we cannot stand still. We need to find new ways to do things, discover new solutions and develop new processes. Which is where you come.

EOM continuously emphasizes more standardized, automated and digitalized modus operandi in the different business and IT domains.  Project involvement: work in close collaboration with the business project manager, the global domain managers, business key users in defining needs and validating a proposed solution

 Technical expertise: Lifelong learning, adopt new techniques and technology in the fast evolving data landscape





 Who we are looking for


We are looking for a colleague with:

 Master’s degree in applied computer sciences, information technology sciences, engineering, mathematics or economy

Technical knowledge in the following domains:
      
 Azure Data platform (Data Factory, SQL Server, Data Lake, Synapse)

 Python, SQL, Spark (DataBricks)
 DevOps, CI/CD
 Optional: machine learning and MLops

 Good understanding of self-service data analytics governance
 Working experience in a service driven, customer oriented environment.
 Interest in and exposure to industrial activities, processes and technology


 Don't worry, we don't expect you to tick every box from the beginning. Most of all: we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for data as well as personal and professional development!




 What we offer


We aim to lead the way. Not just for our customers, but for our employees too. That is why we strive to create a collaborative environment in which we can all succeed, and a culture through which we can all share ideas, develop our expertise and advance our careers. We engage in building an inclusive work culture that offers equal opportunities for all employees irrespective of their diverse backgrounds. As you would expect from a world-leading organisation, we will also reward your contribution with a competitive salary and benefits. With all this and more, imagine what you could do?

Solliciteer

You have an MA or MSc in management sciences, applied economics or computer sciences (PRM or FRM certification is a plus)
 Have at least 2 years of experience in the banking sector
 You have a first hands-on experience in the risk management
 You are familiar with data analysis using huge datasets (e.g. with SQL) and data visualization (e.g. Power BI)
 Other functional/technical skills ( e.g. SAS, R, Python, etc) would be a plus
 You can make the link with the stakeholders in and out the Risk Management environment
 You bring attention to the details while being able to keep the big picture
 You are able to work autonomously in a result-oriented environment
 You are fluent in English (both verbal and written) and you have good presentation skills in English. 
Nice To Have Requirements 
 
Proven experience with data management framework implementation (BCBS239) is a plus
 A first experience with Agile ways of working is a plus
 We offer 
 
The opportunity to join young, dynamic and passionate colleagues recognized for their expertise
 An excellent working environment, offering you the opportunity to define your own specialization and career within our flat and flexible structure
 A competitive remuneration package with flexible working arrangements
 Extensive training programmes adapted to your personal needs, both on technical matters as well as on softs skills
 The opportunity to take initiatives and responsibilities quickly in a fast-growing company
 Travel opportunities inside European countries
 Languages English Education Master Experience 2+ years

Jouw motto van de dag? Meten is weten! Je transformeert data van onze 25.000 (en meer) klanten per land naar bruikbare inzichten. De vragen die jou wakker houden: welke soort nieuwsbrief moet klant X ontvangen? Welke catalogus versturen we naar klant Y? Wordt onze nieuwsbrief meer geopend? Welke evoluties zijn zichtbaar in onze KPIs? Deze antwoorden moet je natuurlijk niet alleen zoeken maar dit doe je samen met een gedreven team.
 Word je alvast enthousiast door dit te lezen? Lees dan snel verder.



Je functie & takenpakket 


Je voert dagelijks, wekelijks of maandelijks rapporteringen uit voor onze belangrijkste KPI’s.
 Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het opmaken van de klantsegmentaties voor nieuwsbrieven en catalogi. Op deze manier waak jij over dat de juiste boodschap bij de juiste klant terecht komt.
 Je bereidt onze cataloguszendingen voor en staat daarbij nauw in contact met de verschillende externe partners.
 Je onderzoekt de resultaten van onze marketing approach: bereiken we potentiële klanten met onze catalogus? Zien we een verandering in de click rate van onze nieuwsbrieven? Hebben onze promoties succes? Het is aan jou om te ontdekken welke strategie werkt en welke niet. Je bezorgt de nodige cijfers aan je collega’s van websitebeheer, sales, aankoop, enzovoort.
 Je ondersteunt het datateam bij het uitwerken van de jaarlijkse objectieven.
 Zie je mogelijkheden om onze processen, rapporteringen en datakwaliteit te verbeteren? Dan kijken we graag naar je voorstellen! Ook dit is een belangrijke taak waar we continu achter de schermen mee bezig zijn.
 Je rapporteert aan de Marketing Business Analyst.




Je profiel 


Tools: Microsoft Excel heeft geen geheimen voor jou. Verticaal zoeken en draaitabellen zijn je favoriete instrumenten. Kennis van andere tools zoals NAV/Business Central, Salesforce, enz. is een mooie extra.
 Analyse en presentatie: je bent kritisch ingesteld en durft dingen in vraag te stellen. Je kan je cijfers en grafieken helder presenteren aan een leek en je collega’s.
 Commercieel: je bent een Marketeer in hart en nieren. Je denkt vanuit klantbewegingen en business value. Je analyses dragen bij tot de einddoelstellingen van het bedrijf.
 Opleiding en ervaring: we zoeken iemand met de juiste technische skills en een analytische gedrevenheid. Opleiding en/of ervaring die dit aantonen zijn een waardevolle start maar overtuig ons vooral van je kwaliteiten.
 Ownership en curiosity: je neemt verantwoordelijkheid voor je taken en rapporteert proactief. Je bent “a man/woman with a plan” en gaat zelfstandig op zoek naar creatieve oplossingen omdat je nieuwsgierig bent naar de uitkomst.
 Planning en flexibiliteit: je hebt oog voor planning en deadlines. Daarnaast zal je je ook flexibel moeten kunnen opstellen: prioriteiten kunnen soms onverwacht verschuiven.
 Teamspirit: je overlegt vlot met collega’s en streeft naar een open en eerlijke communicatie.
 Talenkennis: naast een zeer goede kennis van het Nederlands communiceer je ook vlot in het Engels.




Ons aanbod 


Je komt terecht in een internationaal bedrijf. Het Benelux-team is gevestigd in Tongeren met zo’n 250 gepassioneerde medewerkers.


 Je krijgt een gevarieerde fulltime job met een interessant salarispakket. We bieden je werkzekerheid, toekomstperspectief en begeleiden je van A tot Z.

 Daar bovenop bieden we jou een mooi pakket extralegale voordelen aan:

 CAO bonus
 Eindejaarspremie
 Maaltijd- en ecocheques
 Hospitalisatieverzekering
 Pensioenplan
 Fietsleasing en fietsvergoeding
 Sportabonnement
 En tal van jaarlijkse presentjes
 12 adv-dagen bovenop je wettelijk verlof.
 Leuke events en tal van informele uitjes because we are fun! Bewijs nodig? Klik hier.


 Ook handig: vlotte bereikbaarheid via de E313 en de E40 (net aan de afrit).

Hoe maak jij onze klanten blij ?
    





     Als "Digital Data Analyst" ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen en analyseren van gegevens uit de digitale kanalen van de NMBS. Je communiceert je resultaten aan interne stakeholders (marketing, corporate, UX, HR, enz.) zodat zij hun digitale initiatieven kunnen sturen en de NMBS in staat stellen haar digitale ambities waar te maken en zo de reizigers optimaal kunnen bijstaan.
     






     Wat is jouw rol bij NMBS ?
    





     Als Digital Data Analyst bestaat je takenpakket uit volgende aspecten:
    

Je beheert onze tagmanager en zorgt voor de inrichting van onze tools: van het taggingplan tot de technische implementatie steeds met respect voor de regelgeving met betrekking tot de bescherming van de privacy.
Je verzamelt, structureert en verzekert de kwaliteit van de te gebruiken data.
Je voert ad-hoc analyses uit en creëert geautomatiseerde dashboards om inzichten aan te leveren binnen het digitale team en binnen de NMBS.
Je communiceert je resultaten helder en werkt aan de ontwikkeling van een ‘data-driven culture’ binnen het team.
Je analyseert de customer journeys van hun acquisitie tot hun conversie. Je identificeert verbetermogelijkheden en formuleert voorstellen om de conversie te verhogen. Hiervoor maak je gebruik van de concepten CRO en A/B testing. 






     Waarom is deze job iets voor jou ?
    





     Je behaalde een Bachelordiploma of hebt een gelijkwaardige ervaring en je hebt minimum 2 jaar ervaring in digitale marketing. Daarnaast beschik je over onderstaande beschreven ervaring en competenties:
    

Technische competenties:


Je hebt een eerste ervaring met het gebruik van tools voor tagbeheer (Google Tag Manager, Adobe Launch, Tealium, enz.) en analyses (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Matomo, enz.).
Je hebt kennis van de technologieën die aan de basis liggen van websites en mobiele applicaties (HTML, JavaScript, CSS, CDP, CRO, enz.).
Je bent in staat om data te extraheren uit verschillende bronnen en platformen (al dan niet gestructureerd) en te gebruiken.
Je bent in staat verkennende analyses uit te voeren en dataproblemen op te lossen.
Je spreekt vlot Nederlands, Frans en Engels.
Het is een pluspunt als je weet hoe je data vertaalt naar begrijpelijke visuals en kunt dashboards bouwen voor andere gebruikers (PowerBI, Google Data Studio, enz.).


Gedragscompetenties:


Je nieuwsgierigheid zorgt ervoor dat je constant op de hoogte blijft van nieuwigheden. Je durft nieuwe ideeën aanbrengen.
Je functioneert goed in een complexe omgeving met verschillende stakeholders. Je hebt voldoende overtuigingskracht in een onderhandeling.
Je hebt een can-do mentaliteit om dingen vast te pakken en verandering te weeg te brengen
Je hebt een analytisch profiel en werkt gestructureerd en je bent in staat om verschillende projecten te beheren.


     Iedereen is uniek. We vinden het dan ook belangrijk dat je jezelf kan zijn. Want dat maakt NMBS sterker. Daarom hechten we veel belang aan diversiteit en inclusie .
     






     Wat mag je van ons verwachten?
    





Een contract van onbepaalde duur.
Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket, in overeenstemming met je competenties en diploma. Aangevuld met tal van extra legale voordelen (hospitalisatieverzekering, treinabonnement in eerste klasse, treintickets voor gezinsleden, minimum 33 dagen verlof aangevuld met 13 extra compensatiedagen…)
Een boeiende en afwisselende job bij een stabiel bedrijf dat bijdraagt tot een duurzame mobiliteit voor de samenleving.
Toffe geëngageerde collega’s.
Véél mogelijkheden om bij te leren.





     Begint het al te kriebelen? Zeker solliciteren dan!
     






     Waar ga je werken?
    





 Je komt terecht in het Digital sales & performance team. Jouw collega’s zijn digital designers, experts in client journeys, SEA, SEO, social mediaspecialisten en Data Scientists. De werkzetel is in Brussel, vlak bij het station Brussel-Zuid.
     






     What’s next ?
    





     We willen dat je je goed voelt bij ons en een zo rijk mogelijk beeld krijgt van de job, jouw collega’s en ons bedrijf. In functie daarvan voorzien we enkele stappen, waarin jij ons en wij jou kunnen leren kennen.
    


Je kan solliciteren via onze website


We zullen je CV en motivatiebrief met veel interesse lezen.


Als we denken dat je over de juiste ervaring en competenties beschikt zullen wij je opbellen voor een korte taaltest.


Spreek je voldoende Frans dan nodigen we je uit voor een selectiegesprek. Om dit gesprek voor te bereiden, vragen wij jou om op voorhand een persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst en redeneertesten online in te vullen.


Tijdens het gesprek maken we verder kennis en gaan we dieper in op je motivatie, competenties, ervaring én jouw visie op de invulling van de functie. Uiteraard kan je ons ook op de rooster leggen zodat je perfect weet wat de job inhoudt.




 Voorafgaande procedure kan eventueel onderbroken of aangepast worden om gegronde redenen.
    





      Heb je nog vragen?
    





     Jobnews 35420

0476558414


     Hassan.elbouchtaoui@belgiantrain.be

Here at C&A we’re embracing the digital transformation taking place across the retail sector, whilst also ensuring we don’t lose sight of our heritage.

 “Let’s build the future together - the best is yet to come”

 C&A is on a journey to put data at the heart of its decision making for both online and offline channels, leveraging data to deliver insight which focuses on problem areas within the business to deliver maximum value and return on investment. As a Senior Analyst at C&A, you will focus on outcomes rather than interesting facts, working closely with senior stakeholders to help them understand the art of the possible as well as the results of analysis in non-technical language.
 Key aspects of this role will include:


 Building strong relationships with senior business stakeholders to understand pain points and how deep dive analytics and regular reporting can be improved
 Hands on analytics - accessing and drawing insights from the vast amount of data we have at our fingertips with tools such as R, Python and SQL
 Acting as a ‘data translator’ - translating and advising on complex business challenges with data and appropriate visualisations
 Evangelising data literacy throughout C&A, supporting our shift toward becoming a truly data-driven business

 We would love to speak to those with a blend of some or all of the following:


 Very strong presentation and story telling skills to translate complex analysis into simple to understand actions and recommendations for business leaders
 Deep commercial understanding to translate business needs and priorities into analysis to influence KPIs
 Expert level understanding of analytics and insight methodologies and capabilities, coupled with a deep understanding of data and the data landscape both online and offline
 Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills to director level


 This is an opportunity for you to join us on a truly exciting digital transformation, where you’ll be able to leave footprints that last and contribute significantly to our digital vision.. As well as knowing that you played a key part in the evolution of one of Europe’s most recognisable retail brands, you will also enjoy:


 An international and inspirational working environment
 An in-depth induction into your life at C&A
 A positive working atmosphere with an open feedback culture
 Attractive discounts including a public transport travel pass and remote working options

 C&A fosters equal opportunity for people of all backgrounds and identities. We are led by a gender-balanced board committed to build a diverse and inclusive organisation where everyone can become their best self. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, religion or belief, parental and family status, or any other protected characteristic. We welcome applications from women, men and non-binary candidates of all ethnicities and socio-economic backgrounds. We encourage people belonging to underrepresented groups to apply.

Want to help shape the bank of tomorrow ?
 At the bank for a changing world, our employees make change their greatest asset, turning challenges into opportunities. They think ahead to offer customers innovative solutions perfectly suited to their needs. At BNP Paribas Fortis, the country’s number one bank, employees enjoy continuous career growth in a rewarding and flexible work environment.
The objective of the Data Department is to modernise the bank’s data repositories, data governance, data management and data usage. Data Department’s ambition is to: 

Safeguard and cultivate revenue streams - using data to enhance our product offering and client satisfaction


Gain efficiency through the rationalisation of data management practices and usages, and improved data quality


Comply with the regulatory environment and requirements


Create an adaptable platform—enabling, among others, the re-engineering and full digitalization of our processes for efficiency gains and improvement of customer experience

 Within the Data Quality team of the Data Governance Centre of Expertise, we are looking for a hands on and client oriented data quality analyst which …

has had an experience, and enjoys digging into, client data or master data related topics
wants to contribute to state of the art practices in Client Referential Management
will be a key actor in addressing the data quality issues that impact bank’s efficiency, customer satisfaction, employee satisfaction, bank’s revenues

Are you looking for a new challenge ? Are you eager to participate to the bank transformation by managing data as a valuable asset ? Then, please apply!
Your future job :
As Client Data Quality Analyst:

You perform cleansing of data quality issues through the analysis and solving of potential dysfunctions and/or non-optimized usage of Client data: 
   
Identification of Data Quality issues (proactive and reactive)
Analysis of root causes and Problem definition
Impacts assessments (on bank’s efficiency, revenues, clients & employees)
Prioritization of issues
Proposition of solutions in collaboration with various stakeholders (IT, process, functions, …)
Implementation of chosen solution (via IT development or via update of process)
Support to change management actions for impacted teams

You create data quality controls on the data that are key to support efficient business processes
You monitor the quality of these data based on dedicated dashboards, supports redesign & upgrade of these dashboards
You support Data certification processes and contribute to the Client Quality Assessment & Remediation Committees
You contribute to designing, monitoring and reporting on common reference tools (e.g. data definitions, dictionaries and glossaries), consolidating and harmonizing them
You contribute, via the Data Community, to raising awareness of the importance of good data management
You support the Client Data Manager in the maintenance of the client data documentation, and to the identification of use cases that bring value to the bank 
You develop your expertise on the client data flows
You act as a key contributor to the development of the Data Quality practices, sharing experience, best practices, challenges, use cases, areas of improvement within the Data Quality Analyst community

Organisation
The Data Quality team, headed by Audrey Mons is part of the management team of the Data Governance Centre of Expertise, which reports to the Chief Data Officer. 
Within Data Quality team , the candidate will join a team of Client Data Quality Analysts and report to the Client Data Manager. 
Highlight your strengths !
Experience

You have at least 5 years of experience in Data Quality Analysis in the bank
You understand data lifecycle and data usage
You demonstrate strong analytical ability and problem solver skills
You have performed data analysis demonstrating business impacts
You can demonstrate a strong interest or passion for data & metadata, digital transformation and related topics
You are familiar with the notions related to client/third party static data (identification data, sectors of activity, groups composition; for physical persons and / or legal entities)

Skills
TECHNICAL 

Business Object, Office tools (Excel, MS Access, Powerpoint) 
Client databases, in particular BNPP Group or Fortis Client Referentials (KL, RMPM)
Development and/or use of dashboards (eg Tableau)
Knowledge of the digital culture and capacity to navigate into the digital ecosystem
Data governance tools (Collibra/Ab Initio) is a plus
SQL, Python, SAS is a plus

SOFT 

You are a team player, flexible, accurate and control minded
You show good communication, written and spoken (FR/NL, UK)
You are autonomous, self-taught
You are resolutely solution-oriented and you aren’t afraid to tackle complex issues
You are curious, show an open & digital mind-set and able to challenge the information given
You thrive in a team environment, happily sharing your knowledge and insights
You uses creativity in day to day activities

What does BNP Paribas Fortis offer you ?

Entrepreneurial venture in the midst of the largest Belgian bank
Unique opportunity to gain experience in a new and growing industry (data sciences)
Be part of a dynamic and growing team (the Data department)
Take pride in the knowledge and experience that you have already acquired but also to develop yourself continuously and grow up your skills

In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them have their own experience and identity. Together, let's build the bank of tomorrow: innovative, responsible and sustainable. All of our full-time vacancies are also open to candidates wishing to work 80% or 90%.
Choose BNP Paribas Fortis now and apply here.
We will make our first selections on the basis of your CV and letter of motivation. Are you the candidate we’re looking for? Then you’re sure to hear from us. Good luck!

De functie
 Als Data & Process Analyst ondersteun je het Technical & Logistical Department in verbeter-initiatieven. Je proces-denken en data gedreven analyses leggen de basis voor verandering. Daarnaast krijg je een aantal afgelijnde projecten toegewezen, waarbij je project management skills kunt leren en oefenen. Vanaf 2023 speel je ook een actieve rol bij een ERP implementatie in onze firma.

 Deze rol omvat volgende verantwoordelijkheden:

 Data Analyse
   
 Je wordt de specialist van het departement voor alles dat te maken heeft met data, analyses en rapporten.
 Je helpt je collega’s om te leren informatie uit data te halen.
 Jouw analyses brengen de prioriteiten qua verbeter-initiatieven naar boven.

 Proces Analyse
   
 Je leert alle bestaande processen kennen in het departement, en helpt deze inpassen in het nieuwe ERP pakket.
 Je bent in staat om de zin en onzin van iedere proces-stap boven water te krijgen.
 Uiteindelijk definieer je zinvolle KPI’s per proces
 Met veel trots giet je de ‘best-practice’ processen in procedure-documenten.

 Project Management
   
 Samen met het Indoor Warehouse Team kopieer je de bestaande processen naar een extra stuk warehouse.
 Na het afwerken van bovenstaande project, krijg je een nieuw project toegewezen.


Het profiel

Je bent een ambitieuze starter met een master binnen een analytische richting (Master ingenieurswetenschappen – Master economische wetenschappen, Master Handelswetenschappen) of gelijkwaardig door ervaring.
 Je bent stipt, nauwkeurig en ordelijk en streeft ernaar steeds correct werk op te leveren.
 Je bent een analyticus en kan snel tot een synthese komen. Je weet grotere hoeveelheden aan data te verwerken en inzichtelijk te maken.
 Je bent een geboren organisator en weet prioriteiten in te schatten.
 Je bent leergierig, denkt mee en levert een actieve teambijdrage
 Je beheerst vlot het Nederlands en Engels en kan je daarnaast goed uitdrukken in het Frans.

Onze klant
 Onze klant is een multi-specialistische bouwgroep met meer dan 2.500 medewerkers. Het groeimodel is gefundeerd op 3 pijlers:

 diversificatie
 innovatie
 export

 Innoveren doen ze niet in één specialisme, maar als totaalbedrijf in meerdere disciplines: water, energie, mobiliteit, restauratie, bouwkunde, speciale technieken en andere gespecialiseerde bouwtechnieken.  Onze klant is een veelgevraagde partner voor de meest complexe bouwprojecten en infrastructuurwerken.
 Aanbod

Een uitdagende job binnen een sterk groeiende onderneming.
 Een professionele omgeving waar samenwerking centraal staat.
 Een salarispakket dat jouw prestaties en ervaring optimaal beloont.
